Bülbring. Part I, preface and text.

TITLESTMT.TITLE: The earliest complete English prose Psalter, together with eleven canticles and a translation of the Athanasian creed; edited from the only two mss. in the libraries of the British Museum and of Trinity College, Dublin, with preface, introduction, notes, and glossary, by Karl D. Bülbring. Part I, preface and text.

EDITORIALDECL.P: This electronic text file was created by Optical Character Recognition (OCR). No corrections have been made to the OCR-ed text and no editing has been done to the content of the original document. Encoding has been done using the recommendations for Level 1 of the TEI in Libraries Guidelines. Digital page images are linked to the text file.

THE EARLIEST
Complete English Prose PsalterTOGETHER WITH
Eleven Canticles
AND A
Translation of the Athanasian CreedEDITED FROM THE ONLY TWO MSS. IN THE LIBRARIES OF THE BRITISH MUSEUM AND OF TRINITY COLLEGE, DUBLIN,
WITH
Preface, Introduction, Notes, and Glossary
BY
KARL D. BÜLBRING M.A. PH.D.
EDITOR OF DANIEL DEFOE'S "COMPLEAT ENGLISH GENTLEMAN."PART I
PREFACE AND TEXT.LONDON PUBLISHT FOR THE EARLY ENGLISH TEXT SOCIETY
BY KEGAN PAUL, TRENCH, TRÜBNER & CO., LTD. 1891.
97.HERTFORD; PRINTED BY STEPHEN AUSTIN AND SONS.

DIV1.HEAD: ERRATA IN THE TEXT.
DIV1.P: Ps. 6, 2 L. instead of have read haue.
9, 27 D. instead of have read haue.
14, 6 L. instead of that read þat.
14, 7 L. instead of shall read shal.
27, 4 D. instead of ieuls read iuels.
33, 9 D. instead of no read no nede.
60, 4 D. instead of scha read 2. shal] scha.
67, 15 L. instead of souless hul read soules shul.
78, 13 L. instead of seven read seuen.
82, 11 L. instead of scunari read sanctuari.
88, 25 L. instead of Gode read gode.
90, 10 D. instead of cam read com.
93, 23 L. instead of departem read departen.
97, 4 L. instead of merey read mercy.
108, 18 L. instead of cloyþng read cloþyng.
134, 11 L. instead of Kyng read kyng.
187, 24 L. instead of cleþed read cleped.

DIV1.HEAD: Early English Psalter. [British Museum, Additional MS. 17376.]

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 1.
DIV2.P: Blesced be þe man, þat ȝede nouȝt in þe counseil of wicked, ne stode nouȝt in þe waie of sinȝeres, ne sat nauȝt in falsfals written on erasure in a later hand. iugement.ȝede n.] haþ noght go: wicked . . . nouȝt] wykkyd men & haþ not stond: sinȝeres . . . ] synful men, & haþ not syt in þe chayer of pestilence, þat is to seyne, of ven|geaunce, or of fals iuggement.
Ac hijs wylle was in þe wylle of oure Lord, and he schal þenche in hijs lawe boþe daye and nyȝt.Bot in þe law of our Lorde the wyl of hym schal be, & in hys law he schal haue mynde day & nyght.
And he schal be as þe tre, þat hijs sett by þe ernynges of waters; þat schal ȝeue his frut in hijs tyme.a trow: be-syde þe cours: ȝuld.

And hijs lefBy a later hand an a is added over the e. schal nouȝt fallwen;The w is added above the line by a different hand. and alle þynges þat þe ryȝtful doþ schal multiplien.fallwen] fade or falow: þe r. doþ] he schal do: mult.] wellfare or multyplie.
Nouȝt so ben þe wicked, nouȝt so; as a poudre, þat þe wynde casteþ fram þe face of þerþe.þe wykkyd men schal noþer be so no so, but as pouder.
For-þi ne schal nouȝt þe wicked arise in iugement, ne þe sinniers in þe conseyl of þe ryȝtful.þer-fore þe wykkyd schal noȝt aryse, no þe synners in þe counseyl of ryȝtful men.

[TRINITY COLLEGE, DUBLIN, MS. A. 4. 4.]The signs + and — will be used to indicate additions and omissions; words preceding them are given in the spelling of D. The numerous repetitions in L, which are notified under the text, do not, of course, occur in D.
For oure Lord knew þe waie of þe ryȝtful, and þe waye of synners schal perissen.knowþ: of ryȝtfull men: synful men.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 2.
DIV2.P: Whi douteþ hij hem of þe lawe, þe folk wyþ-outen lawe, & folk þoȝt idel þynges?Why doutyd or gruchyd þe folk withowten law of þe law & thogth ydel thyngeȝ.
Þe kynges of erþe vpstonden, and þe princes acorden in on oȝains our Lord and oȝain hys preste anoint wyþ creme.of þe erþe stod up: acordyd: aȝen: aȝen.
Þe fader seiþ to þe sone and to þe holi gost, Breke we here mys|byleue, and cast we oway fram vs þe charge of here synnes.y corrected from u.sayde: mysb.] bondes of her m.
He þat woneþ in heuen schal scornenMS. tornen. hem, and oure Lord schal vnder-nymenBetween vnder and nymen, ne is dotted out. hem.scorne.
Þan schal God speken to hem in hys wraþe, and schal trublen hem in hijs wreche.trublen] schende.
Ich for-soþe am stablyst kyng of þat fader up heuen, hys holy hyl, precheand hys comaundementȝ.For-soþ ich am ordeynde a kyng: up] of: þe hesteȝ of hym.
Þe Lord, oure fader, seide to me, Þou ert my sone; ich biȝat þe today wyþ me.Our Lorde fader.
Aske of me, and ich schal ȝeueȝ on erasure in a different handwriting. to þe men þyn eritage, and þin habbinge þe terme of þerþe. habb.] possessions: termes.
Þou schalt gouernen hem in sharpnes; and þou schalt breken hem as an erþen pott.sharpn.] a ȝurde of yse or in scherpenes: a pott of erþe.
& ȝe kynges, vnderstondeþ nov; beþ lered, ȝe þat iugen þerþe.
Serueþ our Lord in doute, and gladeþ to hym wyþ quakeing.
Take disciplin, þat our Lord wraþ noȝt, and þat ȝe peris noȝt out of þe ryȝt waie.Takeþ lore: wr. n.] be noȝt wraþt: þe] þis.
Whan he be styred in hys short ire, blisced ben hij, þat afien in hym.is mouyd: trysteþ.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 3.
DIV2.P: Lord, why ben hij multiplied þat trublen me? mani arisen aȝeinsaȝe on erasure. me.
Many siggens on erasure of v, by a later hand. to my soule, Þer nys non helþe to hym in hys God.sayþ.
Þou, Lord, for-soþe ys my keper, my glorie, and heȝand min heued.ert: keper & my ioie & enhying.
Ich cried to my Lord wyþ my uoyce, & he herd me fram hys holy heuen.hyll or heuen.
Ich slepe and slomered and a-ros; for our Lord toke me.
Ich ne schal nouȝt doute þousaundes of folk þat bysetten me; aryse þou, Lord, þat art my God, ande make me sauf.—ne: drede: þ. b.] bysegyng.

For þou smeteCorrected from smote by erasing a little off the right part of the o. alle þat were oȝains me wyþ-outen enchesoun; and þou defouledest þe wickednes of sinȝeres.smote: cause: to-brast þe teþe or þe wykkydnes of synners.
Helþe ys of oure Lord, and þy blisseing,MS. vlisseing. Lord, hys on þy folk.blyssyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 4.
DIV2.P: As ich cleped, God of my ryȝt herd me; þou, Lord, forbare me in my tribulacioun.When: God] to my Godd: ryȝt + he.
Haue mercy on me, Lord, and here my prayere.
Ha ȝe mennes sones, why ben ȝe heuy of herte? wherto loue ȝe ydelnes and secheþ lesyng?—Ha: men: segeþ.
Wyte ȝe wele, þat our Lord haþ made wonderfulliche hys holy name; my Lord schal here me, whan ich haue cried to hym.& wyt: haue c.] schal cry.

Wraþþes ȝou, & wil ȝe nouȝt synȝen;ȝ on erasure in a later hand. þat ȝeȝ corrected from h, which is erased, by a later hand. saie in ȝour hertes and beþ prikked in ȝourMS. our. chouches.Wr. ȝ.] Beþ wroþ: ȝe s.] saþ: our] ȝour: couches.
Sacrifieþ sacrifice of ryȝt, and hopeþ in our Lord; mani siggenMS. singgen. Who schal shew vs gode þynges?Sacrifyþ+þe: seyn: schal sh.] haþ schewyd to.
Lord, þe lyȝt of þy face hys merked vp vs; þou ȝaf liȝtnesȝ corrected from a t. in my hert.vp] on: hast ȝyue.
Of þe frute of hys whete and of hys win and of hys oile ben þe gode multiplied.—1. and: þe gode] þey.
In pees schal ich slepe, and in þat ich resten.ich rest.] same schal y rest.
For þou, Lord, haþ on-licheBetween on and liche, e seems to be erased. stablist me in hope.hast: sett.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 5.
DIV2.P: Lord, take myn wordes wyþ þyne eren; vnderstonde my crye.eres+&.
Vnderston (!) þe voice of myn praier, þou my king and my God.Take hede to þe voce (!).
For y schal praie to þe, Lord, and tou schalt erlich here mye uoice.
Erlich shal ich stonde to þe and sen; for þou nert nouȝt God willand wyckednes.ert.
Þe wycked shal nouȝt wonen bisid þe, ne þe vnryȝtful schal nouȝt dwellen a-forn þyn eȝen.ne þe v.] no vnriȝtful men: to-for.
Þou hatest alle þat wirchen wickednes, and þou shalt lesin alle þat speken lesyng.—and: lese.

Our Lord shal haue in abhominacioun þe man þat sinȝeþ and þe treccherous; ich am, Lord, in þe miclenesMS. cl (which is expuncted) vnclennes. of þy mercy.A man of synnes & a tricherus man our Lord schal haue in abhomi|nacion: mychelnes.
Y shal entren in-to þyn houus; y shal praie to þyn holy temple in þy doute.entry: drede.
Lade me, Lord, in þy ryȝtfulnes for myn enemys; adresce my way in þy siȝt.& dresse.
For soþenes nys nouȝt in her mouþe; her hert ys ydel.For þer is no soþnes: mouþe+&.
Her þrote ys a graue open; hij diden trecherouslich wyþ her tonges; God, iuge þou hem.an open byryel+&: gyle|fullych: deme.
Fallen hij fram her þouȝtes; and put hem ouȝt fro þe, Lord, efter þe mechelnes of her iuels; for hij wraþed þe.wykkydnees (!).
& gladen all þat hopen in þe; hij schul ioyen wyþ-outen ende, and þou shalt wonen wyþ hem.glade be all þo þat.
& alle þat louen þy name shalt (!) gladen in þe; for þou shalt blisse þe ryȝtful.schal be gladyd: ryȝtful+man.
Lord, þou hast crouned us as wyþ þe sheldeshelþe MS., þ being written on an erasure by a different hand. of þy gode wylle.schelde.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 6.
DIV2.P: Lord, ne repruce me nouȝt in þy vengeaunce; ne reproue me nouȝt in þyn yre.—ne: reproue: ne] no.
Lord, haue mercy on me, for ich am sik; hele me, Lorde, for alle myn bones ben trubled.sturbuld.
& my soule ys mychel trubled, & þou, Lord, sum dele.sturbuld.
Be þou, Lord, turned, and defendeMS. defended, the last d being expuncted. my soule; make me saufe for þy mercy.defend: soule+and.
For þer nys non in dampnacioun, þat hys þenchand on þe; and who schal shryue to þe in helle?nys] is: —schryue.

Ich trauayled in my sorowynges; ich shal wasshe my bed [by]After bed two letters are erased, and after this erasure the space of four letters is left empty. uch nyȝt; ich shal deweyThe y of dewey is added over the line. myy corrected out of i. couertour wyþ min teres.haue tr.: sorow: bed by ech: watery.
Myn eȝen (!) hys trubled wyþ wraþe; ich wex olde amonge al myn enemys.ye is sturbuld.
Departeþ fro me, ȝe alle þat wyrchen wickednesseMS. wickenednesse.; for our Lord herd þe voice of my wepe.MS. wepeg, of which g is written on an erasure by a later hand. wykkydnes: wepe (distinct).
Our Lord herd my praier, our Lord toke myn oreisoun.praier+&.
Wax alle myn enemys asshamed, and ben hij greteliche trubled; ben hij conuerted, & shame hij ful swyftlich. sturbuld: schamyd ful ha|stylych.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 7.
DIV2.P: Lord, my God, ich hoped in þe; make me saufe of alle þat pursuen me, & deliuer me fram alle yuel;My Lord God ych trust: all purseuyng.
þat þe enemi ne rauis nouȝt my soule as a lion, þer-whyles þat þer nys non to raun|soun it, [ne to] mak it sauf.—ne: to-whyls þer is: raunson + yt no to: saue.
Lord, my God, ȝyf ich did þys þyng, ȝyf wycked[nesse]nesse is added in margin by another scribe. hys in myne hondes,My Lord Godd: wykkydnes.
Ȝyf ich ȝelde euel to hem þat ȝelden iuel to me, y schal falle by desert idel fram myne enemys.do: doþ: fall wylfullych fram myn ydel enemys.
Pursue þe enemy my soule, and take it, and de-foule my lyf in erþe, and lade mi glorie in-to poudre.ioye.
Aryse, Lord, in þyn yre, & be þou hered in þe cuntres of myn enemys.enhyed.
Lord, my God, aryse in þe comaundement þat tou sent,MS. lent. & MS. in. synagoge of folke shal encumpas þe.Aryse my Lord God: þi com|manment (!): þou sent & þe s.: besett.
& for þat ich þinge cum up oȝain on heȝe; our Lord iugeþ þe folk. —ich: go aȝeyne on hye+ þer: demeþ.
Juge me, Lord, efter my ryȝtfulnesse, and after myne innoce[nce] be þou vp me.Deme: ryȝtwysnes: —in|noce.

þe wickednesse of synȝeres shal be wasted; and þou shal drescen þe riȝtful, God, sechaunda corrected from e. hertes and reiners.MS. and ry reiners. Reiners is probably only a blunder instead of reines. destrued: riȝtful + man: —God: schechyng (!): & reynes.
Min helpe ys ryȝtful of our Lord, þe which makeþ sauf þe ryȝt-ful of heret.heret MS. (t on erasure and by a later hand).þe which] þat: safe —þe: ryȝtful + men: hert.
God ys iuge stalworþe, ryȝtful, and suffrand, and ne wraþes hym nouȝt ich daie.is a domes-man ryȝtful, strong, & sofferyng, no is he noȝt wraþed be all dayes.

Bot ȝyf ȝe be styred fram iuel, he shal shew MS. sw (expunged) shew. hys vengeaunce; he made hys manaces, and he dyted hem.turnyd: braundesch or schew his swerd or vengaunce, his bow or his manece he bent or made & haþ engrayde hym.
And in þat dyȝted he pynes of deþe, and made hys woundes to þe brynnand in pynes.he dygth: paynes: byrnyng: paynes.
Lo, þe sinner doþ vnryȝt-fulnesse; he conceiued sorow, and childed wickednesse.childed] brogth forþ.
He opened helle & dalf it, and fel in þe diche þat he made.def (!) it vp and+he.
Hys sorowe shal be turned oȝains hys heued, and hys wickenesse(!) shal fallen doun oȝayn þe haterel of hys heued.wykkydnes.
Ich shal shryue to our Lord after hys ryȝtfulnesse, and synge to þe name of þe heȝest Lord.to þi n.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 8.
DIV2.P: Ha þou, Lord, our Lord, ful wonderful hys þy name in al þerþe.—Ha.
For þy mychelnes ys heȝed up þe heuens.vp þe] aboue.
Þou madest heryynge of þe mouþe of childer and of þe sukand, for þyne enemys; þat þou destruye þe enemy and þe wrecher of Adam sinne.of sowkyng: Adames.
For ich schal seneMS. se new, the w being added by a later hand. þyn heuens, þe werkes of þyn fyngers, þe mone and þe sterres, þat þou þ is corrected from t. settest.se—new.
What þynge ys man, þat þou ert þenchand on hym? oþer mannes sone, þat-ou visites hym?theching (!).
Þou madest hym a lyttel lasse þan þyne aungels; þou corouned hym wyþ glorie and honur, and stablist hym vp þe werkes of þyn hondes.—a: þan þyne] fram: crouned: —wyþ: ioie: settest: þe] þine.
Þou laidest alle þynges vnder hys fet, alle shepe and nete and also þe bestes of þe felde;castest all+all(!): fete—alle.
Þe briddes of heuen, and þe fisshes of þe see, þat gon by þe bystees of þe se. goþe þe paþes.
Ha Lord, our Lord, ful wonderful ys þy name in alle erþe.vt supra.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 9.
DIV2.P: Ich shal shryue to þe, Lord, in alle myn hert; ich shal tellen al þyn wonders.Lord y schall schr. to þe.
Y shal ioien and gladen in þe, y shal syngen heȝestlich to þyne name.gladen & ioye: hylych.
I[n] turnand oȝainward myn enemy, þe wicked shul ben vnstabled & perissen fram þy face.In turnyng: wykkyd+men: be seke or dye & schal perysche.
For þou madest my iugement and myn enchesun; þou, þat iuges riȝtfulnes, sittest vp þe trone.dome: cause: demest: þi.
Þou blamed þe folk, and þe wicked perissed; þou dedest owai her name wyþ-outen ende and in heuen.blamyd—þe: wykkyd+man.
Þe vengeaunce of myn enemys defailed in-to þende, and þou destruedest her heritage.vengances: failed: her cytes or her herytages.
Her mundAltered to mende by a later hand. perissed wyþ noyse, and our Lord dwelleþ wyþ|outen ende.þe mynde of hem.
He made redi his trone in iugement, and shal iuge þe folk in riȝtfulnes.MS. riȝtiles.dome, & he schal deme þe worlde in euennes, and he schal deme folk in riȝtfulnes.
And our Lord hys made refut to þe pouer, helper in nedfulnes in tribulacioun.pouer+and.
And hopen hij in þe, þat knowen þy name; þou, Lord, for-sake nouȝt þe sechand þe.name+for: forsakeþ noȝt men scheyng (!) þe.
Singeþ to our Lord, þat woneþ in heuen; sheweþMS. sw (expunged) sheweþ. his studyynges amonge men.heuen+and.

For he schandInstead of sechand. þouȝtMS. nouȝt. [on her] synne; he ne forȝate nouȝt þe crye of þe pouer in gost.sechyngBefore sechyng, schyng with e added over the y is struck out. recoredid (!) her synn & he for-ȝat.
Haue mercy on me, Lord;d on erasure. se misemi MS. lowenes of myn enemys.Lorde before haue: me+&: on.
Þou þat heȝest me, Lord, of ingoynge of deþ, þat ich swewe al þyn heryynges of þe goynges of þe soules of heuen.enhiest me fram þe gates or þe entre of deþ or of hell þat y may schew: h. in þe gates.
Y shal gladen in þyn helþe; þe folke ben ficched in deþ of synne þat hij diden.gl.] ioie: stykkyd or sett in+þe.
In þe gnares þat þe folk hid, is her fote MS. forte. taken.grynnes: hid . . . forte] made or hydd is her fote.
Our Lord shal be knowen doand iugementȝ; þe sinȝer hys hys on erasure. taken in þe workes of his hondes.makeyng dome.
Ben þe synners turned in-to helle, alle þe folkes þat for-ȝeten God.Synners be þey turnyd; hell & all folk.
For forȝetyng of pouer in gost ne shal nouȝt be in ende; þe suffraun ce of þe pouer ne shal nouȝt perisse in ende. of+þe: —in gost ne: in+þe: ende+&: pacience:—ne: in+þe.
Arise up, Lord; be nouȝtMS. nauȝt (expuncted) nouȝt. man conforted; be þeMS. boþe. folkes iuged in þy syȝt.Lord+&: be þe folk denyd(!).
Sett, Lord, up hem þe berer of lawe; witen þe folkes þat hii ben men.Verse 22 is omitted in this text.—(PSALM 10).of þe lawe & know þe folk.

Þer-whiles þat þe wicked proudeþ, þe pouer in gost ys bre[n]t; hij ben taken in þein þe, on erasure. counseil in wich hij þenchen.To-whyls—þat: brent and hey(!) beþ take in her counseiles þat þey thenche in.
For þe synȝer isMS. synȝeris. heried in þe desires of hys soule, and he blisced of þe wicked.praysid: hert: he (!) wyk|kyd is blyssyd.
Þe synner greued our Lord; he schal nouȝt seche efter þe mechelhede of hys ire.Lorde+and: mychelnes.
God nys nauȝt in his syȝt; hys waies ben filed in alle time.is: syȝt+&: defoilyd.
Þyn iugement ben don oway fram þe face of þe synȝer; þe ryȝtful shal lord-shipen of alle hys enemys.domes: synner+&: schal haue lordship.
For þe wicked seid in hys hert, Y ne schal nouȝt ben styred fram kynde to kynde wyþ-outen iuel.kyn to kyn.
Of wich þe mouþe ys ful of waryingi added over the line. and of bitternesse and of trecherie, trauail and sorow is vnder his tunge.Whas mouþe: cursyng: bit|terness and gyle.
He sitteþ in waieteynges wyþ þe riche inMS. and. priuetes, þat he slo þeMS. sloþe. nouȝt a-noiand.waytynges: ryche men in preuytes þat he slee þe vngylty.
Hys eȝen loken oȝain þe pouer in gost; he waiteþ in priuite as lioun in hys denne.aȝens: p.+man: goste+&. as+ a.
He waiteþ þat he rauis þe pouer; forto rauis þe pouer in gost, þer|whiles þat he drawe him to him.pouer+and: p. —in gost: to|whylles.

Þe wicked lowed in hijs wickednes-js wi- on erasure. þe riȝtful, he enclined hym to synne, and he shal fallen, whan þat he haþ lordshipped of þe pouer in gost.w.+man: made lowe: w.+or falshode: r.+man &: when he schal have lordschip.
For þe wicked seid in his hert, God haþ forȝeten synnes; he turneþ his face fram euel, þat he ne se nouȝt at ende.synnes+&: fram þe wykkyd: —ne: into þe ende.
Arise, Lord, and be þinMS. beþ in. honde an-heȝed,MS. and heȝed. þat þou ne forȝetete added over line in a different hand. þe pouer in gost.enhied: —ne: forȝete+noȝt.
For what þynge stired þe wicked God? for he seid in his hert, He ne shal nouȝt sechen.greuyd þe wykkyd+man: —ne.
Seþ þou, sinner? forfor for MS. þou seþ trauail and sorowe, þat þou heueRead ȝeue. hem into þyn hondes.Sest tow sinner for þat þou hast sorow & trauayle: take.
Ha God, þe pouer in gost ys bilaft to þe; þou shal be helpere to þe faderles.—Ha: Godd+to: 1. to þe] &: f.+chylde.
Defoule þe miȝt of þe synȝer and of þe wicked; hys sinneA later hand has added an s. shal be souȝt, and ne shal nouȝt be founden in þe riȝtful. Defoile: synn: ne] it.
Our Lord shal regnen wyþ-outen ende in þe worled of worldes; ha ȝe men wyþ-outen lawe, ȝe shulle perissen fram hys erþe.— ha: lawe—ȝe: perisch.
Our Lord herd þe desire of þe [pouer] in gost; Lord, þin ere herdMS. ereberd. þe red[i]nes of her hertes.of pouer men: goste+&: eres herd þe redynes.
To iuge þe moderles and þe meke, þat man sett nouȝt to herien hem vp þerþe.Forto deme to þe m.: put noȝt ouer to make hym grete or hie vp þe erþe.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 10 (11).
DIV2.P: Ich affie me in our Lord; hou saie ȝe wicked to mi soule, Wende þou in-to heuen as a sparwe?aff. me] tryst: w.+men: pass.
For whi se! þe synȝers made her þretynges; hij diȝted her malices in hardnesse, þat hij herten in derknesse þe riȝtful of hert.For lo how þe s.: hij] &: or|deynd: males: herten] myȝt greue.
For hij destruiden þat tou made; what þyng of iuel did þe riȝtful?
Our Lord hysBefore hys, in is struck out by the corrector. in hys holi temple; our Lord his in heuen, þer his sete ys.
Hys eȝen loken to þe pouer in gost; his eȝeliddes asken þe childer of me[n].g.+&: sonnes of men.
Our Lord askeþ þe riȝtful and þe wicked; and he þat loueþ wickednesse, hateþ hys soule.wykkyd—and.
It shal rayne up þe synȝers droppes of fur and of brunstone; and þe gost of tempestes ys partenerparceuer MS. of her wyckednesse.He: dr.] grynnes: & brun|stone: spirites: is partiner.
For our Lord ys riȝtful, ande he loueþ riȝtfulnes; hys semblaun saiȝ euennis.MS. enemis. louyd: face segh euennes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 11 (12).
DIV2.P: Ha Lord, make me sauf, for þe holi failed in parfit holynes; for soþnes ben litteled fram mennes sones.Ha: Godd: h. + man: made litell: men.
Ichon han i-spokenMS. ham spoken. idel þynges to her neȝeburs, trecherous lippes benMS. hem. in her hert, and hij spaken trecherie in hert.haþ: neȝpurs&gileful: hem] beþ: hertes: gyle.
Our Lord desp[ar]ple alle trecherous tunges & þe tunge miches (!) spekand.disparple: muchel.
Hij þat saiden, We shal praysen our tonges, our lippes ben fram us; who iswho is on erasure. our Lord?Hei (!).
For þe chaitifte of nedeful and þe waimentyng of pouer y shal aryse nov, saiþ our Lord.wrechidnes: waylyng.
Y shal sett þe gode in helþe; y shal make hem faiþlichefaiþlicle MS. þer ynne.h. + &: —hem: fayþlych.
Þe wordes of our Lord ben chast wordes, siluer ytried wyþ fur þryes, eft purged seuen siþes.chaste (—wordes) as siluer examynd in þe fure prouyd thryse & purgyd seuen syþe.
Þou, Lord, shal kepen us and loke vs wyþ-outen ende fram þat biȝetyng.schalt ȝeme vs & schalt kepe vs: þis kynred.
Þe wicked ȝeden abouten, þou multiplidest mennes sones efter þyn eȝenes. hynes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 12 (13).
DIV2.P: Ha Sir, hou longe forȝetestouMS. -toū. me on ende? hou longe turnestou þy face fram me?Ha S.] Lord: into þe e.
Hou longe shal ich sett counseil in my soule, sorow in my hert bi day?conseyles: soule+and.
Hou long shal myn enemy ben heȝed up me? Lord, my Gode, loke, and hereMS. heȝe. me.enhied: here.
Liȝt myn eȝen, þat y slepe no time in deþ; þat myn enemy ne say nauȝt, Ich was more worþy oȝains hym.y ne sl. noȝt in any tyme:—ne.
Hij þat trublen me shal joien, ȝif ich haue ben stired; and y hoped in þy mercy.sturbeleþ: y schal be: and y h.] ych for-soþe hope.
Min hert shal ioien in þyn helþe; ich shal singe to our Lord, þat ȝaf to me godes, and yMS. h (struck out) y. shal synge to þe name of our Lord alderȝeste (!).alderhiest.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 13 (14).
DIV2.P: Þe vnwyse seid inMS. and. his hert, It nys God.v.+man: and] in: þer is no Godd.
Hij ben corrumped and made loþeliche in her studies; þer nys non þat doþ gode, þer nys non vnto on.abhominabil: is: is noȝt to one.

Our Lord loked fram heuen vp mennes sones, þat he se, ȝyf þer be ani vnderstand[and]MS. end added in margin in a different handwriting. oþer sechandAnother hand has added an e to sechand. God.be] is: vnderstondyng or.
Alle boweden, to-gider hij ben vnprofitable; þer nys [non þat doþ gode, þer nys] non vn-to on.declinyd to-geder & þei beþ + all: þer is none þat doþ gode þer is noȝt to one.
Her gorge is an open biriel, hij deden trecherouusliche wiþ her tunges; venim of aspides, .i. nedders, is vnder her lippes.In margin notabile by a later hand. throte is+as: gilefullych:— aspides .i.
Of whiche þe mouþe ys ful of waryyngeMS. þaryynge. and bitternysse, her fete ben swift to shade blode.þe mouþ of wham: cursyng &+of: b.+&.
Defoule and vnhappe ys in her waies; and hij ne knewen nouȝt þe waie of pees; þe drede of God nys nouȝt to-fore her eȝen.Defulyng: —ne: is.
Alle þat wirichen wickednesse, ne shal hij nouȝt knowen; wycheCorrected from weche. de-uouren mi folk as mete of brede?wyrch: —ne: —hij: know no þes swalouþ.
Hij cleped nouȝt our Lord; hij trembleden þer for doute, þer no doute nas.d. were was no d.
For our Lord his in riȝtful biȝetyng; þou, Lord, confoundest þe counseil of þe mesais; for our Lord hys hys hope.generacioun: confoundid: m.] pouer man.

Who shal ȝyf fram þe heuen helþe to Israel? whan our Lord haþ turned oway þe chaytifnesse of hijs folk, þe kynreden of Iakob shal gladen, and þe folk of Israel shal ioyen.fram—þe: thraldome: kyn|red: gl.] ioie: ioyen] be glade.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 14 (15).
DIV2.P: Lord, who shal wonenIn margin notabile, by later hand. in þy tabernacle, oþer who shal resten in þyn holy hill?oþer] &.
He þat entreþ wyþouten wemmAfter wemm, two letters are erased. and wyrcheþ ryȝtfulnesse; wemm] synn.
He þat speke soþnes in hys hert, and ne dide no trecherie in hys tunge;spekeþ soþfastnes: —ne: gyle.

Ne did non yuel to his neȝbur,After neȝbur an e seems to have been erased. ne toke no reprusynge oȝayn hys neȝburs.In MS. with an o written over u by later hand. Ne] & he þat: & did no re|profe aȝens.
Þe wicked hys brouȝt to nouȝt in hys siȝt, and God glorifieþ þe dredand our Lord.þe dr.] men dredyng him.
He þat swereþ to hys neȝbur and deceiueþ hym nouȝt and ȝaf nouȝt hys tresour to oker and ne tok ȝiftes up innocent:dissayuyþ: & he þat ȝaf: mony to vsurye ne toke noȝt ȝ. vp on innocentes.
He þat doþ þes þynges, ne shal nouȝt be stired wyþ-outen ende.ne] he: mouyd.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 15 (16).
DIV2.P: Kepe me, Lord, for ich hoped in þe; ich seide to our Lord, Þou art myMS. lord þou art my lord þou art mi. God, for þou ne hast no nede of myn godes.—ne.
Unto halwen þat ben in his londe he made wonderful alle my willes in hem.To his holy men.
Her syknesses ben multiplied, and efterwardes hij hasteden to hym.sekenes beþ: afterward: hym] me.

Ich ne shal nouȝt gader to-gideres, seid our Lord Dauid, her wicked felawe-shippes of synȝes;Over e and s a later hand has added an n. ne ich ne shal nouȝt be þenchand on her names by my lippes.Our Lord sayd to Dauyd, Y schall noȝt g. to-geder her wykkyd felyschyppes: y — ne: be þe thencher of.
Our Lord is part of myn heritage and of mye ioie; þou art þat shal restoren to me myn heritage.party: schalt restore myne h. to me.
Foundeinges fellen to me in godenesces; for min heritage his ful clere to me.After me a letter is erased. Temptacions: god.] clerete of godenes.
Y shal bliscen our Lord, þat ȝaf me vnderstondyng, and vp þat unto nyȝt my kydnaies blamed me.ȝaf+to: ouer þat myne kyd|ners blamyd me vnto n.
Y puruaiede our Lord in my siȝt, for he is at my riȝt half, þat ich ne be nouȝt stired.at] on: syde: —ne.
For þatat on erasure in a later hand. min hert ioide,MS. seide. and my tunge shal gladen, and my flesshe shal al-so resten in hope.& þer-for myne h. was gladyd: ioie: also schal.

For þou ne shal nouȝt [laten my soule in helle, and þou ne shal nouȝt] ȝyf þyn holy to se corupcioun.For þou schalt noȝt lete my soule in hell, ne þou schalt noȝt ȝif þine holy seruant forto see corrupcion.
Þou madest knowen to me þe waies of lyf, þou shalt fulfillen me of ioie wyþ [þy] face; delitynges ben in þy riȝt honde vnto þe ende.m. þe ways of lyfe know to me: with+þine: delites: into.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 16 (17).
DIV2.P: Here, Lord, my riȝt; vnderstonde my praier.riȝtfulnes+&.
Receiue my praier wyþ þy neren nouȝt in trecherousMS. trecherour. lippes.Take: þine eres: gileful.
Forþ go þi iugement out of þy semblant; se þyn eȝen euennes.Þi dome pas out of þi sem|blaunte+&.
Þou prouedest myn hert, and uisited it on niȝt; þou assaidest me þurȝ fur, and wickednesse nys nouȝt founden in me.in: examyndest: with: was.
Þat my mouþe ne speke nouȝt werkes of men, ich kept hard waies for þe wordes of þy lippes.—ne: for þe wordes of þi l. y kepid h. wayis.
Fulfyl my goynges in þy bestiȝes, þat m[i] traces ne be nouȝt stired.Fulfil+þou: b.] paþes: my: —ne.
Ich cried, God, for þou herd me; bow þyn eren to me, and here myne wordes.—God: ere.
Make þy mercies wonderful, þou þat makest sauf þe hopand in þe.1. þe] men.
Kepe me fram hem, þat oȝain-stonden þyn ryȝt-half, as þe appel of þyn eȝe.K. me as þe appill of þin ye fram men aȝenstondyng þi riȝt honde.
Defend me vnder þe shadow of þy mercies fram þe face of wicked, þat tormented me.
Myn enemys ȝede aboute my soule wyþ synnes; hij shetten to-gideres her fattnes; her mouþe spekeþ pryde.to-geder: spak.
Þe kestand oway godnesse han nov gon abouȝt me, and han stablyst her eȝen to bowe into þerþe.þai castyng away me or her godnes fram me haþ: sett: forto.
Hij token me as a lyon redy to his praie, and a welpe of a lyon wonand in hydels.and+as: dwellyng.
Aryse vp, Lord, and cum to-forne hym and put [hym] out; defende my soule fram þe wycked, defend þy makeyng fram þe enemys of þyn honde.put+hym: wykkyd+&.
De-part hem, Lord, fram fewe of þe erþe in her libbynges, and her wombeS. an (expuncted) wombe. ys fild of þyn hydynges.leuyng: preuy þingis.
Hij ben fulfild of wickednesses hid, and hij departed to her lytel her iuel toknes.wykkydnes preuy: departid+or left: smale chyldern her releues or toknes of wykkydnes.
And y shal apperen in ryȝt to þy siȝtMS. fiȝt.; y shal be fild, whan þy glorie haþ shewed.to] in: siȝt+&: ioie schal schew.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 17 (18).
DIV2.P: Ha Lord, y shal loue þe, my strengþe, my fasteninge, my refut, and my deliuerer of iuel.—Ha: f.] stedfastnes.
My God ys myn helper, and y shal hopen in hym; The English translation is omitted, as well as the Latin in the next verse.
My defendour and þe helpe of myn helþe and my taker.helþe] help.
Ich heriand shal clepe our Lord, and y shal be sauf fram myne enemis.
Sorowes of deþ ȝeden aboute me, þe welles of wickednes han trubled me.me+ &: reuers: han] &: sturbelyd me+me (!).
Þe sorwes of helle encumpassed me, þe trappes of deþ han taken me.enc.] ȝede aboute: grynnes: han taken] ocupied.
Ich cleped our Lord in my tribulacioun, and ich cried to my God.—cleped: —ich.
And he herd my uoice fram hys holy temple, and my crie entred in-to hys eren in-to hys syȝt.eren into] eres in.

Þe erþe hys styred, and hyȝt trembled; þe foundemenȝtThus in MS., the ȝ being written over another t. of þe mounteyns ben trubled, and hij ben styred, for he hys wraþed to hem.of—þe: trubled . . styred] sturbled & mouyd: wroþ.
Smeke mounted up yn hys wraþe, and fur brent of hys face; coles ben þer-of alyȝted.Sm. m.] þe s. went: & þe fure of his face b. & þe c. beþ aneled þer-of.
He bowed þe heuens, and com adoune; and derknes ys vnder hisMS. her. fete.enclynyd—þe: his fote.
And he mounted vp cherubyn, & fleȝe; he fleȝe vp þe liȝtnesse of þe wyndes.went vp aboue ch. & fleȝ & fleȝ aboue þe feders or þeswyftnes of þe w.
And he sett derknesses hys dwellyng, o-bouten hym hys tabernacle, as derk water in cloudes of þe aier.derknes.

Þe cloudes passeden in hys siȝt to-fore þe shininge, hail and coles of fur.Verse 15 omitted, both Latin and English. schynig (!). & our Lord thunderd in fram heuen, & ful hye he ȝafe his voice; haiel & coles of fure.
And he sent hys manaces and wasted hem; he multiplied leuinges, and trubled hem.sparpild: liȝtynynges: stur|bled.
& þe welles of waters appered, and þe foundement of þe worled ben y-shewed,foundementes.
For þy blamyng & for þe inspiracioun of þe spiriȝt of þyne ire.Fram þe blame of þe Lord & fram þe i.
He sent fram heȝe, and toke me fram many tribulaciouns.hye+a-boue.
He defended me fram myn stronggest enemis and fram hem þat hated me; for hij ben conforted vp me.
Hyy com to-fore me in þe day of [my] tourmentyng, & our Lord ys made my defendour.of+my.
And he lad me in brede; he made me sauf, for he wold me.into brode+&: wolde me+.s. be safe.
And our Lord shal ȝyf to me efter my ryȝt; and he shal heueBlunder for ȝeue. to me efter þe clennesse of myn hondes. þe] my.
For ich kept þe waies of our Lord, ne ich ne bare me nouȝt yuel oȝain my God.& y did noȝt yuyll.
For al hys iugementȝ ben in my siȝt, & ich ne putted nouȝt hys riȝt-wysnesse oway fram me.domys: & & (!) y putt.
And ich shal be unfiled wyþ hym, and ich shal kepe me fram my wickednesse.vnfulyd.

And our Lord shal ȝeue to me efter my ryȝtfulnesse and efter þe clennesse of myn hondes in syȝt of hys eȝen.Here the MS. makes a paragraph, and begins the next Latin verse with a large and ornamented letter. Accordingly a later hand has added the number 18 in the margin. in+þe.
Þou shalt ben holy wyþ þe holy, and þou shalt be innocent wyþ þe innocent man.with holy men: holy with — þe.
And wyþ þe chosen þou shalt be chosen, and wyþ þe wycked þou shalt be wicked.
For þou shalt mak sauf þe mild folk, and þou shalt lowen þe eȝen of þe prowde.þe m.] meke: þe p.] proud men.
For þou alyȝtest myn lanterne; ha þou, Lord my God, alyȝt my derknesse.al.] makest liȝt:—ha þou: my Lord Godd lyȝten.
For in þe shal ich be defended fram temptacioun, and y shal passen þe yuel in my God.in] þurȝþ: skape euyll by.
My God ys, and hys waie ys vn-filed; þe wordes of our Lord ben proued wyþ fur, and he hys defendour of alle þe trowand in hym.þe tr.] men trowyng.
For who ys God bot our Lord, oþer who is GodMS. wheisgod. bot our God?or who.
God þat girt me wyt uertu and sett my waye vnfiled;gird.
Þat made my fete lyȝt asMS. af. of þe hertes, and stablissand me up heȝe þynges;as þe fete of h.: settyng.
He þat techeþ myn hondes to fiȝt oȝayn þe fende; and þou sett myn arme stable as a bow of brasse.stronge.
And þou ȝaf to me defens ofMS. of of. myn helþe, and þy poste toke me.—to: power.
And þy discipline amended me on ende, and þy discipline onlich shal teche me.on] into þe: onlich] þat.
Þou madest large my goynges vnder me, and my traces ben nouȝt made syke.brode: waies: vnfast.
Y shal pursue myn enemys, and y shal taken hem; and ich ne shal nouȝt turne oȝain, vn-to þat hij faile.—þat.
Y shal breken hem, and hij shul nouȝt mow stonde; hij shul fallen vnder my fete.—nouȝt.
And þou girt me wyþ vertu vnto batail; þou put out þe vparisand oȝaines me. vnto] to: bataile + &: þe . . . . me] men rysyng aȝens me vnder me.
& þou ȝafMS. h (expuncted) ȝaf. myn enemys riggen to me,MS. men. and þou desparplist þe hatand me.men] me: disparpeld: þe] men.
Hij criden to our Lord; ac þer nas non þat made hem sauf, ne he ne herd hem nouȝt.was: ne he ne] no he.
Y shal littelel (!) hemMS. ham, the a being dotted out and an e written over it. as poudre to-fore þe face of þe wynde, and y shal don hem o-way as lome of þe stretes.+And: littyl: cley.
Þou shalt defende me of oȝain-syggeyngesMS. oȝain-syngeynges. of þe folk; þou shalt sett me oȝain þe heued of men wyþ-outen lawe.fram aȝene-siggynges off.+&.
Þe folk, þat ich ne knewe nouȝt, serued me, and bowed to me in heryngeMS. heryynge. of eren.—ne: and in heryng of ere þat bowyd to me.
Straunge children leiȝed to me; straunge childer ben elded, and hij ben made lame fram þy waies.were elde: b.m.l.] haltyd.
Our Lord lyueþ; and blisced be my God, and þe God of myn helþe be heȝed.be made hie.
Ha God, þat ȝeueþ to me uengeaunces and settest þe folk vnder me, be þou my delyuerer of myn enemys wraþful.—Ha: e.w.] w.e.
Þou, Lord, shal an-heȝe me fram þe arisand oȝains me, and þou shal defende me fram þe wycked man.+And: enhie: þe a.] men arisyng.
For-þy, Lord, y shal shryuen to þe in cuntreys, ande y shal synge psalme to þy name,nacyons: sigge.
Heriand þe helþes of his kynge and doand mercy to hys Dauid anoit wyþ creme and hys sede vnto þe world.anoityd: &+to: into.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 18 (19).Ps. 19, MS.
DIV2.P: Þe heuens tellen þe glorie of God, and þe firmament telleþ þe werkes of his hondes.þe h.] h.: ioie: scheweþ.
Þe daye putteþ forþe þe worde to þe day, and þe nyȝt sheweþ conyng to þe nyȝt.schweþ word.
Hij ben nouȝt speches, ne wordes of wiche þe voices of hem ben nouȝt herd.Hij . . . wordes] þe speches & þe wordes beþ noȝt.
Þe souneMS. seune. of hem ȝede out in-to alle erþe, and her wordes in-to þe contreis of þe world.soune: endes of all þe w.
He sett his tabernacle in þe sunne, and he as a spouse comand forþe of hys chaumbre.
He ioyed as a giaunt to erne his waye; his going-out is fram þe heȝest heuene,MS. heuenē.to his way to be ȝorne: —þe: heuen.
And hys oȝayn-ernyng vnto hys heȝest; and þer nys non þat hideþ hym fram his hete.aȝen-goyng+is: is.
Þe lawe of our Lord hys nouȝt filed, turnand soules fram yuel; þe witnessyng of our Lord ys trew, ȝifand wisdom vn-to þe littelSecond t over line. of vnderstondynge.wytnes: vnto þe] to: cunnyng.
Þe ryȝtfulnesses of our Lord [ben] makand ioyful ryȝtlich þe hertes, þe comaundementȝ of our Lord his clere, liȝtenand eȝen to heuens. Lord beþ gladyng riȝtfullych hertes þe heste: —clere: heuen.
Þe holy doute of our Lord ys wyþ-outen ende, þe iugementȝ of our Lord ben soþe, made riȝtful in hym self,drede: domes: soþe & iustified: hem self.
Desiderable michelMS. minchel. more þan gold and precious stones, and swetter þan hony [&] honykombes.Des. m.] And þe domes of our Lord beþ desirabil: & muchel sw.: hony or h.
For þy saruaunt kept him; mechel ȝeldyng is it in keping hem.kepeþ hem & muchel reward is in hem to be kepid.

Who vnderstondeþ my trespasses? Lord, make me clene of my dedelich priueteȝ, and spele of þe oþer ueniales to þyn seruaunt.trespas: preuy .s. dedelich synnes & spare þi seruant fram oþer .s. venialles synnes.
Ȝif þat hij neMS. h (dotted out) ne. haue nouȝt lord-shipped of me, þan shal ich be vnfiled, and y shal ben clensed of my grettest trespasse.— ne: lordeschipei added over the line.: vn|fulid: grete.
And þe wordes of my mouþe shul ben, þat hij plesen to þe, and þe þouȝt of myn hert alwaies in þy siȝt.alw.] schal be euer more.
Lord, þou art myn helper and myn oȝainbyger.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 19 (20).
DIV2.P: Ps. 20, MS.Ha þou my soule, her our Lord þe in þe day of þy tribulacioun; þe name of þe God Jacob defende þe fram iuel.O: Godd+of.
Sende he to þe helpe of þe holy gost, and defende he þe fram iuel.to þe+þe: —he.
Be he þenchand on al þy sacrifice, and be þyn offryng made gode.
Ȝif he to þe efter þyn hert, and conferme he alle þyn conseil.ȝif he+he.
Whe shul ioyen in þyn helþe, and we shul herien in þe name of our Lord.
Our Lord fulfille al þyn askynges; nou haue ich knowen þat our Lord made sauf hys preste anoint wyþ creme.ych haue.
He shal here hym fram hys holy heuen; þe helþe of hys mercy ys in his miȝtes.
Hij in carres, and hij in horses, and we shul herien þe name of God, our Lord.Þai + clepid: cartes: — hij: herien] clepe in.
Hij ben bounden and feld adoun, and we ros vp, and ben adresced.f.a.] þai fell doune: adr.] arered vp.
Lord, make þou þe kyng sauf, and her us in þe daie þat we haue cleped þe.—þou.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 21, MS.PSALM 20 (21).
DIV2.P: Lord, þe kyng shal gladen in þy vertu, and he shal greteleche ioyen vp þyn helþe.gladen] ioie.
Þou ȝaf to hym þe desire of his hert, and þou deceiuedestMS. dece inuedest. hym nouȝt in þe wille of his lippes.desayuedest
For þat þou comest to-for hym in bliscinges of swetnes; þou sett on his heued a croune of precious stones.—þat: come: stone.
He asked lif of þe, and þou ȝaf to hym lengþe of daies in þe world and in þe world of worldes.
Þe glorie of hym ys grete in þyne [helþe]; þou shalt sett vp him glorie and michel honour.ioie: þine + helþe Lord: —sett: vp]on: ioie: grete.
For þou shalt ȝyf hym in bliscyng in þe world of worldes; þou shalt liȝten hym in ioye wyþ [þy] semblant.blyssyngys: of world: liȝten] glade: semblant] þi chere.
For þe kyng hopeþ in our Lord, and þe mercy of þe heȝest shal nouȝt be stired.mouyd.
Be þy merci founden to alle þyne enemys, þyne helpe finde al þo þat hated þe.m.] honde of mercy.
Þou shalt sett hem as ouen of fur in þe time of iugement; our Lord shal trublen hem, and þe fur of helle shal deuoure hem.as+ane: dome: sturble.
Þou shalt lese her frute of þerþe & her seide fro mennes sones.sede: men.
For iuels boweden in þe; hij þouȝten conseils, which þat hij ne myȝt nouȝt stablice.euyl þingis declined: — which: —ne: stable.
For þou shalt sett hem a-rigge, and þou shalt make rady her semblant in þy leuinges.put: a-bache: chere.
Be þou, Lord, an-heȝed in þy vertu; we shul syngen & psalmen þy vertuȝ.enhied: v.+&.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 22, MS.PSALM 21 (22).
DIV2.P: Ha God, my God, loke in me; whi for-soke þou me? þe wordes of min trespases ben fer fram myn helþe.Ha] þou: into.
Ha my God, y shal crien bi daie, and þou ne shalt nouȝt here; and by nyȝt, and nouȝt to unwitt toMS. te. me.—Ha: —ne: vnwysdome to.
Þou forsoþe wonest in holy heuen, heryyng of þe folk of Israel; our fadres hopeden in þe, and þou deliueredest hem of iuel.For-soþe þou: Israel+þai hopid in þe.
Hij criden to þe, and hij ben made sauf; hij hopeden in þe, and hij ben nouȝt confounded.
And ich am worme and no man, reproceyng of men and out|castyng of folk.am+a: reprouyng.
Al þat seȝen me scorned me, and spaken wyþ her lippes, and stired her heued,mouyd.
Saiand, He hoped in þe Lord; defende he hym, make he hym sauf; for he wil hym.þai said: delyuer: m.he] & make.

For þou artMS. þo uart. þat drawe me out of þe wombe; þou art myn hope fram þe tettesOr tittes? the letters are written too close together. of myMS. þy. moder; in þeMS. moderinþe. am ich out-caste of þe wombe.drowe: of—þe: tetis: my: þurȝ þe y am cast oute of.
Þou art my God fram þe out-going of my moder; depart þou nouȝt fro me.
For tribulacion is nere to me; for þer nys non þat helpeþ me.nyȝ: for] &: is.
Many temptacioun ȝeden a-boute me; mani uices bisegeden me.temptacions: me+&.
Hij maden her sautes vp me as a lyon rauissand and rumiand.m. her s.] opynd her mouþe: roreyng.
Ich am helded out as water, and alle myn bones ben desparplist.h.] sched: disparpyld.
Myn hert ys made as wex meltand a-middes of my wombe.—of.
My uertu defailed as a shelle, and my tunge drowe to myn chekes; and þou ladde me in-to passyng of deþ.dryde or failid: cleuyd: clekes(!): pouder or passyng.
For many fendes han en-cumpassed me, þe counseil of wicked vmseged me.enc. me] go aboute me &: w.+men: by-segid.
Hij doluen myn honden and myn fete, and tolden alle my bones.deluyd: telde.
Hij for-soþe seȝe iuel and lokeden, & dep[ar]teden to hem myn cloþynges, & up myn cloþynges hij casten lott.Hij fors.] & for-soþe þai: departyd: 1. cloþynges] cloþes.
And þou, Lord, make nouȝt þyn helþe fram me; loke to my defendyng.make n.] schalt noȝt make: me+or þi help bot.
De-fende, God, my soule fram vengeaunce and myn on soule fram þe honde of þe fende.Godd defend: on] onelich.
Sauue me fram þe mouþe of helle and my mekenes fram iuelsMS. iueld. of pride.helle] þe fende in hell: fram þe euyls.
Y shal tollen þy name to my neȝburs, and y shal herien þe amiddes of myn hert.tell: —of.
Ȝe þat douten our Lord, herieþ ȝe hym; alle þe sede of Jakob, glorifieþ hym.ȝe hym] him & ȝe.
Ich manMS. am. of Israel doute hym; for he for-soke nouȝt, ne despised nouȝt þe praier of þe pouer in gost.Ech man: ne] no: of pouer men—in gost.
Ne he ne turned nouȝt his face oway fram me; and he herd me, as [y] criedascried. to hym.Ne he ne] And he: —oway: & when y cride to hym, he herd me.
Myn heryynge his to þe in a grete chirche; y shal ȝelde my vowes in þe syȝt of þe doutand hym.wonnes: of men drededyng(!).
Þe pouer shul eten, and shul ben fild; and hij shul herien our Lord; hij þat sechen hym, þe hertes of hem shul liuen in þe world of worldes. 1. &+þai: Lorde+&: sechen] sche(!): her hertes.
Alle þe cuntreis of þe erþe shul biþe[n]chen, and shul turne to our Lord.be-þench: turne] be tourne (!)
And alle þe meinȝeis of folkes shul aouren in hys syȝt.meynȝe: anoure.
For þe kyngdom ys of our Lord, and he shal lord-shippe þe folkes.lordsh.] have lordschyp of.
Hij eten and aoured alle þe fatnes ofMS. of of. þerþe; alle þo þat fallen in to þerþe shul fallen in hys syȝt.honourid: fattesses (!).
And my soule shal leuen to hym, and my sede shal seruen hym.
Þe kynde þat hys to comen shal be shewed to our Lord, and þe heuens shul shewe hys riȝtfulnes to þe folk þat shal ben borne, which our Lord made.which] þat.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 22 (23).Ps. 23, MS.
DIV2.P: Our Lord gouerneþ me, and noþyng shal defailen to me; in þe stede of pasture he sett me þer.faile: he haþ sett me in þe st. of p. þer.
He norissed me vp water of fyllyng; he turned my soule fram þe fende.broȝt me forþe vp þe w. of fulfillyng+&.
He lad me vp þe bistiȝes of riȝtfulnes for his name.paþes.
For ȝif þat ich haue gon amiddes of þe shadowe of deþ, y shal nouȝt douten iuels; for þou art wyþ me.F. ȝif y schal go amiddes—of: —iuels.
Þy discipline and þyn amendyng conforted me.lore: am.+þes þinges.
Þou madest radi grace in my siȝt oȝayns hem þat trublen me.sturbleþ.
Þou makest fatt myn heued wyþ mercy; and my drynk makand drunken ys ful clere.madest: with+þi.
And þy merci shal folwen me alle daies of mi lif;all+þe.
And þat ich wonne in þe hous of our Lord in lengþe of daies.in þe lengeþ.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 24, MS.PSALM 23 (24).
DIV2.P: Þe erþe is our Lordes and his plente, þe world and ichon þat woneþ þer-inne.& þe plentusnes þer-of.
For he bigged it vp þe sees, and made it redi vp þe flodes.sett.
Who shal climben in-to þe mountein of our Lord, oþer who shal stondestonden MS., with the final n dotted out. in his holy stede?cl.] go vp: m.] hill: or: place.
Þe innocent in honde and of clene hert, þat ne toke nouȝt his soule in idelnesse and ne swore noȝt in gileri to his neȝbur.clene of hondes and clene of h.:—ne: id.] vayne: —ne: gile.
He shal take bliscyng of our Lord, and mercy of God, his helpe.helþe.
Þis his þe biȝetyng of þe sechand hym, sechand þe face of God Jacob. generacyon of men scheyng hym & of men scheyng: Godd+of.
Openeþ ȝour ȝates, ȝe princes of helle, and beþ ȝe lifted, ȝe euerlastand ȝates; and þe kynge of glorie shal entre.heuyd vp.
Which is he, þat kyng of glorie? Þe Lord stronge and miȝtful, þe Lorde myȝtful in batail.Who is þis kyng of glorye? he is a str. L. & a myȝty, he is a myȝty Lord in batayle.
Openeþ ȝour ȝates, ȝe princes of heuene,MS. heuenē. and beþ ȝe lifted, ȝe ȝates euerlastand; and þe kynge of glorie shal entren.heuen: arered vp — ȝe ȝates e.: ioie: entre+in.
Which is he, þat kynge of glorie? Þe Lord of uertu, he his kynge of glorie.Who is þis k. of ioie.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 25, MS.PSALM 24 (25).
DIV2.P: Lord, ich lefted my soule to þe: þou art my God; ich affied me in þe, ich ne shal nouȝt shame.lift+vp: Godd+&: —ne.
Ne ne schorne nouȝt myn enemis me; for alle þo þat susteine þe shal nouȝt be confounded.Ne scorne noȝt me myn e.: susteineþ.
Alle þat don iuels vp idelshippe, be confounded.euyl to ydelfullych.
Lord, shewe me þyn waies, and teche me þyne bisties.Before bisties stands a þ, which is struck out.schew+to: b.] paþes.
Dresce me, Lord, in þy soþenesse, and teche me; for þou art my God, my sauiour, and ich susteined in þe aldaie.haue susteynd.
By-þenche þe, Lord, of þy pites and of þy mercius þat ben of þe world.
Þe trespases of my ȝengþe and my vncona[n]dnes ne þenche þou nouȝt.ȝouþe; vnknowynges haue þou noȝt in mynde.
Lord, for þy godnes þenche on me efter þy mercy.
Our Lord is swete and riȝtful; for-þy he shal ȝeue lawe to þe tres|passand in þe waie.þer-for: 1. þe] men.
He shal drescen þe mylde in iugement, and he shal teche þe de-boner his waies.meke: dome: debonour.
Alle þe waies of our Lord ben mercy and soþenes vnto þe sechand his testamentȝ and his wittenes.soþefastnes to men scheyng his testament.
Lord, for þy name be merciable to my synne; for it is michel.
Who is þe man þat douteþ our Lord? he stablist to him lawe in þe waie þat he ches.þe] þat: ordeyneþ law to hym: haþ chosyn.
His soule shal dwellen in gode, and his sede shal enheryte þerþe.godes.
Our Lord is fastenynge to þe dredand hym, and his testament þat it be shewed to hem.fastnes to men dredyng & þat h. t. be schewyd to hem.
Myn eȝen ben alway to our Lord; for he shal drawe out myn feet of þe gnare.grynne.
Loke to me, and haue pyte on me, for þat ich am on and pouer.mercy: —þat.
Þe tribulaciounsThe stroke is only over the last u. of myn hert ben multiplied; deliuer me fram my nedefulnes.
Se, Lord, my lowenesse and mi trauail, and forheuei.e. forȝeue. me alle my trespas.for-ȝif.
Loke to my enemis; for hij ben multiplied, and hij hated me wyþ wycked hatyng.
Kepe my soule, and defende me; y ne shal nouȝt be asshamed, for ich hoped in þe.—ne.
Þe nouȝt noiandMS. noinad. and þe ryȝtful drow toMS. drowte. me; for ich susteined þe.þe innocentes: to.
Delyuer þou, God, þe folk of Israel of alle her tribulacions.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 25 (26).Ps. 26, MS.
DIV2.P: Iuge me, Lord, for ich entred in myn innocens; and ich hoped in our Lord, ne shal nouȝt be made syke.Deme: ennocence: ne] and y.
Proue me, Lord, and assaie me; kepe my kydnaies and myn hert.kydneres.
For þy mercy ys to-fore myn eȝen, and ich plesed in þy soþenesse.
Y ne satt nouȝt wyþ þe conseil of ydelnes, and y ne shal nouȝt entren wyþ hem þat iuel beren hem.—ne: —ne: with men euyl beryng hem.
Ich hated þe techyng of þe wicked, and y ne shal nouȝt sitte wiþ þe wicked.—ne.
Y shal wasshen myn honden omonges þe innocentȝ, and y shal gon aboute þin auter, Lord,among þine innocentes.
Þat ich hereMS. bere. þe voice of þyn heryyng and telle al þyne meruayles.here: wonders.
Lord, ich loued þe fairnes of þyn hous and þe stede of þe wonyng of þy glorie.habitacion of þi ioie.
Ne lese nouȝt, Lord, my soule wyþ þe wicked, and my lif wyþ þe filed wyþ dedelich synnes.—Ne: þe f.] men defulid.
In whas hondes wickednesse ben, her ryȝtfulnes is fulfild of ȝiftes.riȝtf.] riȝthonde or her riȝt|wysnes: with.
Ich am for-soþe entred in myn innocence; raunceoun me, Lord, and haue mercy on me.For-soþe ych am: inn. + .s. clennes þou.
My fote stode in stede dresced; Lord, ich shal blisse þe in chirches.riȝtful.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 27, MS.PSALM 26 (27).
DIV2.P: Our Lord, which ich shal douten, is my liȝtyng and my helpe.þat: helþe.
Our Lord is defendour of my lif; for what þyng shal ich drede?
To þat noiandMS. noinand. comen neȝe vp me, þat hij etand my flesshes:To-whyles noyng+men: ete.
Myn enemys, þat trubleden me, ben made sike, and hij fellen.sturbeleþ.
Ȝif hij setten manaces oȝains me, myn hert ne shal nouȝt drede.manes+or strenkeþ: —ne.
Ȝyf myn enemy arere bataile oȝains me, y shal hopen in þat.þer-in.

Ich asked þe lif þat euer shal last of our Lord; ich shal bisechen þat, þat ich mai wonne in þe hous of our Lord alle þe daies of my lif;þe lif .. Lord] one askyng of our lorde and: mai w.] dwell: Lord+in: —daies.
Þat ich se þe wille of our Lord and uisite his temple.
For heHere þat is expuncted and struck out. hid me in his myȝt, he defended me fram þe dedes of wicked in þe priuete of his tabernacle.miȝt+&: wykkyd+men.
He heȝed me in stablenes, and nou he haþ en-heȝed myn heued vp alle myn enemis.made me hyȝe in stabilnes: aboue.

Y ȝede a-bout, and sacrified in his tabernacle offerand berand voice; iMS in. shal synge and saie salme to our Lord.offerand b. v. in] y schal syng but y schal syng is expuncted. þe sacrifice of voice beryng y.
Here, Lord, mye voyce, wyþ which hiji.e., y (ego). cried to þe; haue pite on me, and her me.hij] y: mercy.
Myn hert seid to þe, my face soȝt þe; Lord, y shal seche þy face.
Ne turne nouȝt fram me þy face, ne bowe nouȝt owaie in ire fram þy seruaunt.—Ne: —ne: fram þi seruant in þi wraþ.
Lord, be þou myn helper, and for-sake me nouȝt; ha God, myn helþe, ne despise me nouȝt.—ha: —ne.
For my fader and my moder han for-saken me, and our Lord haþ taken me.
Sett to me, Lord, lawe in þy waie, and dresce me in þy bistie for myn enemys.Lord sett to me: paþe.
Ne ȝyf me nouȝt, Lord, into þe soules of þe trubland me; for fals witnesses aros oȝains me, and her wickednesse leiȝe to hem.—Ne: þe tr.] men stur|blyng: lyed.
Ich hope to se þe godes of our Lord in þerþe of liuiand.of men lyfyng.
Abyde our Lord, and do manneleche; and þyn hert be conforted, and kepe wyþ þe our Lord.be þyn h.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 28, MS.PSALM 27 (28).
DIV2.P: Lord, my God, y shal crye to þe; ne stylle nouȝt fro me, ne let nouȝt fro me; and y shal be liche to þe descendand in þe diche.Lord] Lor: —ne: still+ þou: ne holde noȝt preuy fram: to men fallyng into.
Here, Lord, þe uoyce of my praier, þer-whyles þat ich byseche to þe; þer-whyles þat ich an-heȝe myn honden to þyn holy temple.to-whils y pray: & to-whils ych holde vp.
Ne ȝyf me nouȝt to-gidres wyþ synȝers, and ne lese me noȝt wyþ hem þat wirchen wickednes;—Ne: —ne: with men wyrchyng.
Þat speken [pees] wyþ her neȝbur, iuels for-soþe in her hertes.þai þat spekeþ+pees; iuels] & euyl: for-soþe+beþ.
Ȝeue to hem efter her werkes and efter þe wickednesse of her fyndynges.
Ȝyf to hem efter her werkes of her hondes; ȝelde her rewarde to hem.
For hij ne vnder-stode nouȝt þe werkes of our Lord, and þou shalt destrue hem in þe werkes of her hondes; & þou ne shalt enhabite hem in heuens.—ne: —nouȝt: —ne: schalt+ noȝt.
Blisced be our Lord, for he herd þe voice of my praier.
My Lord his myn helper and my defendour, and myn hert hoped in hym, and ich am hulpen.helpyd.
And my flesshe florissed oȝain, and y shal shryue to þe of my wylle.

Our Lord ys þe strengþe of his folk, and he his defendour of þe bliscyngesof his folk and he his defendour of þe bliscynges twice in MS. of his prest anoint wyþ creme.strenþe(!): saluacion: an|oyntyd.
Make, Lord, þy folk sauf, and blisce þyn heritage, and gouerne hem, [& anheȝe hem] vnto wyþouten ende.hem+& enhye hem.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 29, MS.PSALM 28 (29).
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe Goddes sones, bringeþ to our Lord, bryngeþ to our Lord sacrifice of weþers.—Ha: sunnes of Godd.

Bryngeþ to our Lord glorie and honour; bringeþ to our Lord glorie to his name; aoureþAn n is added over ao by another hand. our Lord in his holi temple, þat ys, mannes body.þat ys mannes body underlined with black and red ink in MS.ioie & wyrschyps added over the line. bryng: ioie: honoureþ.
Þe voice of our Lord is vp waters; God of maieste, þou þunred; Lord vp many waters.þou þ. Lord] Lord thunderde added over the line.: —many.
Þe voice of our Lord is in vertu, þe voice of our Lord his in heryng,herying.
Þe voice of our Lord brekand cedros; and our Lord shal breke þe cedros of Liban.cedres: cedres of+þe:
And he shal littelen hem as folk of Liban, and loued as cautel of vnicornus.of+þe: as+þe: vnicorns.
Þe voice of our Lord praiand makeþ flamne of fur; þe voice of our Lord smytand to-gidres desert, and our Lord shal stiren þe desert of Cades for þe wickednesse of hem þat wonen þer-inne.famne (!)
Þe voice of our Lord makand rady hertes; and he shal shewe þe hidels, and alle folkes shal saie glorie to hym in his temple.folk: ioie.
Our Lord makeþ þe flode to wonen, and our Lord shal siten kyng wyþ-outen ende.dwell.
Our Lord shal heue Read ȝeue. vertu to his folk, and our Lord shal bliscen his folkes in pes.—2. Lord: folk.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 30, MS.PSALM 29 (30).
DIV2.P: Y shal heȝe þe Lord, for þou herdest me, and madest nouȝt mynMS. þyn. enemys on brede vp me.myn: on brod.
Lord, my God, ich cried to þe; and þou madest me hole.My Lord Godd: heledest me.
Lord, þou lad my soule out of helle, and sauedest me fram þe falland into synne.þe] men.
Syngeþ to our Lord, ȝe his halwen, and shryueþ to þe mynde of his holinesse.
For ire ys in his dignacioun (!), and lif in his wylle.indignacyon.
Wepynge shal dwellen at even, and ioie at morwen,atte m.
Ich for-soþe seid in my wexing, Y shal nouȝt be stired wit-outen ende.For-soþe y: plenteousnes.
Lor, in þy wylle þou ȝaf vertu to my fayrenesse.Lord.
Þou turnedest þy face fram [me], & ich am made trubled.fram+me: am] was: heuy.
Lord, i shal crien to þe; and y shal praie to my God.
What profit is in my penaunce, þer-whiles þat ich descendeMS. descended. in-to synne?fall.
Ys to wyten ȝifMS. ȝis. man shal shryue to þe, [oþer] tellen þy soþenes?Wheþer noȝt man schal schryue hym to þe, oþer tell þi soþnes?
Our Lord herd me, & had pite of me; our Lord hys made myn helper.mercy on.
Þou turnedest my waymentyng in-to ioie; þou carf my sak, and compasedest me wyþ gladnes,ioie+to me: enclosed.
Þat mi glorie synge to þe, and y ne be nouȝt prikked; Lord, my God, y shal shryue to þe wyþ-outen ende.ioie: —ne: schryue+me.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 31, MS.PSALM 30 (31).
DIV2.P: Ich hoped in þe, Lord; y ne shal nouȝt be counfounded wyþ-outen ende for þy riȝtfulnes; deliure me fram iuel.y .. be] þat y be noȝt: for] pro (!).
Bowe to me þyn ere, and heiȝe þe, þat þou deliure me of yuel.haste.
Be to me in-to God defendour, & in-to þe hous of refut, þat þou mak me sauf.
For þou art my strengþe and my refut; and for þy name þou shalt lade me and norisse me.
Þou shalt lade me out of þe gnare which þe fendes hidden to me; for þou art my defendour fram iuel.grynne þat þe deuyl hydd.
Lord, [ich] ȝyf my gost in-to þyn hondes; þou, Lord of soþenes, bouȝtest me.Lord+y: soþfastnes.
Þou hatedest hem þat kept uanites vp idelnes.
Ich for-soþe hoped in our Lord; y shal gladen and ioien in þyn mercy.For-soþe ych.
For þou lokedest to my lowenes, and þou sauedest my soule fram nedfulnesses.
Ne þou ne shettest me nouȝt in þe hondes of þynMS. of þyn twice. enemy; þou stablisced my fete in large stede.And þou closyd: settest.
Haue mercy on me, Lord; for ich am trubled; myn eȝe is trubled in ire, my soule [& my wombe].sturbled: sturbled: soule+& my wombe.
For-þy my lif fayled in sorowe, and my ȝeres in waymentynges.—þy.
My uertu is made sike in pouert, and my bones ben trubled.sturbled.
Ich am made reproce up alle myn enemis, and greteliche to my neȝburs, and drede to hem þat knowwen me.reproue: to my knouen men.
Hij þat seȝen me flowen out fram me, and ich am ȝeuen vnto forȝetyng as deþ fram hert.out] away: vnto] to.
Ich am made as vessel loren; MS. lord. for ich herd blamyng of many dwelland abouten.as a vesell lore.
Þer-whiles þat hij comen to-gidres in þis oȝains me, hij conseiled hem to take my soule.—me: —hem.
Ich hoped in þe, Lord; ich seid Þou art my God; myn lottes ben in þyn hondes.
Defende me fram þe honde of myn enemis and fram hem þat pursuen me.
Alyȝt þy face up þy seruant, Lord; make me sauf in þy mercy, and ich be nouȝt confounded; for ich cleped þe.Lord aliȝt: Lord] &: be ych.
Ben þe wicked made asshamed, and ben hij ladd in-to helle; and þe trecherous lippes ben made doumbe,be þe trichourus lippis.
Which speken wickednes oȝayns þe ryȝtful in pride and in abusion.which] þai þat: pride+also.
Ha Lord, ful michel his þe multitude of þy swetnes, þatou hidest to þe doutand þe.—Ha: þe] þi: —þy: þe d.] men dredyng.
Þou madest ioie to hem þat hopen in þe, in þe siȝt of mennes sones.hopid: men.
Þou shal hiden hem in þe hydyng of þy face fram þe trublyng of men.sturblyng.
Þou shal defende hem in þy tabernacle fram oȝainsiggeing of tunges.with-siggyng.
Blisced be our Lord, for he made his mercy wonderful to me in heuen.me] men.
Y seid in passyng of my þouȝt, Ich am owaie cast fram þe lyȝt of þyn eȝen.passyng+oute: cast away.
For-þy þou herdest þe voice of my praier, þer-whyles þat ich cried to þe.þer-fore: —voice.
Loueþ our Lord, ȝe alle his halwen; for our Lord shal sechen soþenes, and ȝeue vengeance plentiuouselicheSecond u added over the line. to hem þat don pride. plentefullych.
Doþ manneliche, and beþ ȝour hert conforted, ȝe alle þat hopen in our Lord.hertes: ȝe] ȝ (!).

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 32, MS.PSALM 31 (32).
DIV2.P: Ben hij blyscedy corrected from e. of wich þe wickednesses ben for-ȝeuen and of which þe synnes ben hed.þai beþ blissyd þe wykkyd|nes of wham: whas synnes beþ hydd or preuye.
Blisced be þe man to whom our Lord aretted nouȝt synne, ne gilery nys nouȝt in his gost.put no s. & gyle is: hert or goste.
For ich held me stylle; my bones wexen olde, þer-whyles þat ich cried alday.
For þyn honde ys greued vp me day and nyȝt; ich am turned in my chaitifte,MS. chaitiste (with a long s). þer-whiles þat vices ben ficched in me.myschefe: þorne or vices er prikkyd.
Ich made myn trespasMS. trappes. knowen to þe, and ich ne hid nouȝt myn vnryȝtfulnesses.trespas: —ne: vnryȝtfulnes.

Ich seid, Y shal shryue oȝayns me myn vnryȝtfulnesse to our Lord; and þou for-ȝaf þeoȝayns me myn vnryȝtfulnesse to our lord and þou for-ȝaf þe oȝains me myn vnriȝtfulnesse to our lord and þou for-ȝaf þe MS. wickednesse of myn synne.
For-þy shal ich an halwe praie to þe in couenable tyme.ech halow schal: behoue|able.
For-soþe hij ne shal nouȝt come nere hym in þe gaderyng of mani synnes.—ne: —nouȝt: gederyng.
Þou art my refuitMS. restut? fram þe tribulacioun þat cumpassed me; my gladnesse de-liuereMS. de-liuerer. me fram hem þat conpassen me wyþ iuel.refute: —þe: enclosid: de|diuer: encloseþ.

Y shal heueRead ȝeue. to þe vnderstondyng, seid our Lord, and y shal en-fourmeu added over line. þe, and y shal fasten vp þe myn eȝen in þat wai þatouMS. þa tou. shalt gon.enfourme: festen myn eȝen vp þe: þat þou: go+in.
Willeþ ȝe nouȝt, mennes sones, ben made as horses and mule, to which vnderstondyng nis nouȝt.Ȝe sonnes of men will ȝe noȝt be made as hors or mule in whych is none v.
Constreingne her cheken in bernacheMS. bernathe. Or ought to be bernacle? and bridel, Lord, þat ne neȝed nouȝt to þe.chekes in barnakle: lord] þai: ne n. n.] cum noȝt neȝ.
Mani tourmentes ben of synȝers; and mercy shal cumpassen þe hopand in our Lord.enclosye man hopyng.
Gladeþ, ȝe ryȝtful in our Lord, and beþ ioyful and glorieþ, ȝe alle riȝtful of hert.beþ . . ȝe] ioieþ & ioieþ.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 33, MS.PSALM 32 (33).
DIV2.P: Gladeþ, ȝe ryȝtful in our Lord; heryynge bicomeþ to þe ryȝtful.ȝe] ȝ (!): for riȝtful b. herying.
Shriueþ to our Lord in uertuȝ, and doþ to hym þe techynges of þe .x. comaundementȝ.
The translation is omitted.Do ȝe gode warkes, & serueþ to hym in all ȝour strengþ.
For þe worde of our Lord is ryȝt, and alle hys werkes ben in faiþe.feye.
He loueþ mercy and iugementȝ; þerþe is ful of þe mercy of our Lord.dome.
Þe heuens ben fastened þurwe þe worde of our Lord, and alle her uertue is of spiriȝt of ys mouþe.
Gaderand to-gidres as in a gourde þe waters of þe see, settand depe hellesMS. belles. in tresours of yuiles.MS. hilles. hellis: hilles] yuyll.
Drede al þerþe our Lord; and alle þat wonen in þe worled ben styred of hym.
For he seid, and hij ben made; he comaunded, and hij ben fourmed.beþ m.: be fourmyd.
Our Lord wasteþ þe counseiles of men wyþ-outen lawe, and he reproceþ þeMS. he. counceils of princes.Our . . princes] & he reproueþ þe þouȝtes of folkes, & he reproueþ þe conseils of pr.
Þe counseil of our Lord woneþ wyþ-outen ende; þe þouȝtes of his hert ben in kynde and kynde.fram k. into k.
Þe folk ben blisced of which our Lord is her God; þe folk þat he chees to hym in heritage ben blisced.þat f. is: wham: ben] beþ.
Our Lord lokedMS. lokeþ. fram heuen; he seiȝe alle mennes sones.loked: h. + &: men sonnes.
He loked fram his tabernacle made redi vp alle þat wonen on erþe;
Which feined onliche her hertes & vnderstondeþ alle her werkes.
Þe kyng nys nouȝt saued þurȝ michel uertu, and þe geant ne shal nouȝt be saued in þe michelhede of his uertu.is: —ne: gretnes.
Þe hors is deceiuable vnto helþe; and he ne shal nouȝt be saued in þe wexing of his uertu.dis[. . . .]blePart of the word is stained and illegible.: help: —ne.
Se! þe heȝen of our Lord ben vp þe dredand hym, and in hem þat hopen in his mercy;þe] men.
Þat he defende her soules fram deþ & noris hem in grete desire.
Our soule loueþ our Lord; for our Lord is our helper and our defendour.
For [in] þat our hert shal glade in hym; and we hoped in his holy name.For+in.
Be, Lord, þy merci made up us as we hoped in þe.Lord þi mercye be.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 34, MS.PSALM 33 (34).
DIV2.P: Y shal bliscen our Lord in al time; be his heryyng euermore in my mouþe.
My soule shal be heried in our Lord; heren þe milde, and gladen hij.meke+men.
Þe folk herieþ our Lord wyþ me; MS. ine. and heȝe we his name wyþ hym seluen.—Lord: me: hye: in.
Ich bi-souȝt our Lord; and he herd me, and defended me fram alle my tribulaciouns.& of all my t. he delyuerid me.
Comeþ to hym, & beþ aliȝted; and [ȝ]our faces ne shul nouȝt be confunded.ȝour: —ne.
Þis pouer crie[d]; and our Lord herd hym, and deliuered hym of alle his tribulaciouns.cryd: & of all h. t. he d. hym.
Þe aungel of our Lord goþ about þe dredand hym, and he shal defenden hem fram iuel.þe dred.] in þe cumpas of men dredyng: deliuer.
Swelweþ and seþ, for our Lord is liþ; blisced bi þe man þat hopeþ in him.Tasteþ: swete: be: men.
Doute our Lord al is halwen; for misais nys nouȝt to hem þat douten hym.Douteþ: mis. n. n.] þer is no nede.
Þe riche were nedeful, and hungred; and þe sechand our Lord shal nouȝt be made lasse of all gode.& men sechyng (e added over line).
Comeþ, ȝe men, and hereþMS. bereþ. me; y shal teche ȝou þe drede of our Lord.men] chylder: here me + and.
Which is þat man þat wyl þat lif þat euer shal laste, and loueþ to se gode daies?
Defende þy tunge fram yuel, and þy lippes þat hij ne speke nouȝt treccherie.—ne: no gyle.
Turne þe fram iuel, and do gode; secheþ pes, and folweþ it.seche (e over line): folow.
Þe eȝen of our Lord ben vp þe riȝtful, and his eren to here her praiers.eres: —here.
Þe semblant of our Lord for-soþe is vp þe doand iuel, þat he destruie þe mynde of hem up þerþe.For-soþe þe face: þe] men: lese.
Þe ryȝtful criden, and our Lord herd hem, [& he deliuerd hem] of alle tribulaciouns.MS. tribulacous with a stroke over the o and part of the u.hem+& he deliuered hem: all+her.
Our Lord is nere honde to hem þat ben trubled in hert; and he shal saue þe milde in gost.neȝ to hem þat(!) of sturbled hert: meke.
Mani ben þe tribulaciounsThe stroke is over the u and part of the s. of þe riȝtful; and our Lord deliuered hem of hem ichon.echon.
Our Lord kepeþ al her bones; on of hem ne shal nouȝt be de-fouled.—ne.
Þe deþ of synȝers is werst; and hij þat hated ryȝtful þyng shul trespassen.hateþ.
Our Lord shal bigen þe soules of his seruauntȝ; and alle þat hopen in hym ne shul nouȝt trespassen.The English transl. is om.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 35, MS.PSALM 34 (35).
DIV2.P: Iuge, Lord, þe anoiand me; fiȝt oȝain þe fitand wiþ me.Deme, Lord, men noyinge me, ouercome men fiȝtyng aȝens me.
Take myȝt and uertu, & aryse in helpe to me.
Shade þy uengeaunce, and close it oȝains hem þat pursuen me; saie to my soule, Ich am þyn helþe.Schede+oute.
Ben hij confunded, and drede hij þat sechen my soule.þat s.] sechyng.
Ben turned oȝain and ben confounded þe þenchand iuels to me.Be+þay: be+þai: þe]men.
Ben hij made as poudre to-fore þe face of þe wynde; and our Lordes aungel be constreinand hem.—be.
Be her waies made derk and slider, and our Lordes aungel pur|suand hem.sleder.
For hij hidden to me by her wylle deþ of her wicked enticement; hij reproced my soule of idelshippe.hid wyllfullych to me: re|proued.
Cum to my enemy þe gnare which þat he ne knoweþ, and þe takeyng þat he hid take hym, and falle he in-to þat ich gnare.MS. graue.grynne —which: —ne: þat same grynne.
My soule shal gladen in our Lord, and shal ioien in his helþe.
Al myn wittes shal saien, Lord, who ys liche to þe?
Þou shalt deliuer þe mysais fram yuel of his enemis, þe nedeful and þe pouer fram þe rauissand hym.mys.] nedeful.
Wicked witnesses arisen, asked me þynges þat ich ne knew nouȝt.arysyng: —ne.
Hij ȝauen oȝain to me iuels for gode, barainesse to my soule.—oȝain: godes.
And as hij were anoiand to me, y was cloþed in penaunce.when: an.] heuy.
Y lowed my soule in fastyng; and my praier shal be turned in myn helpe.h.] bosum or help.
Y pleised neȝbur as our broþer; and ich was lowed as man sori and waimentand.pleised+my: as a sory man.
Hij ben gladed oȝains me, and comen to-gidres; and turmentes ben assembledMS. assembland (dotted out) assembled. up me, and y ne wyst nouȝt.c. tog.] moued: ass.] gaderd: —ne: wyst+yt.

Hij ben wasted, and hij ne ben nouȝt prikked; hij tempteden me, and hijand hij twice in MS. vndernimmeden me wyþ vnder-nyminge, & gnaisted vp me wyþ her teþe.wasted and hij ne] sparbled &: pr.+ or for-þouȝt: & scornyd me with scornyng: grente.
Lord, whan þou shalt loke to me, stablis my soule fram her wickednes, myn on soule fram fendes.st.] sett.
Y shal shryue to þe in stedfaste hert, and hiji.e., y (ego). shal herien þe for sinful folk.for] among.

Ne gladen hij nouȝt vp me, þat ben contrarious oȝains me; þat hatedMS. hateþ (expuncted) hated. me wyþ wylle, and hij loren oþer twynquelinoþer tw. underlined with black and red ink. wyþ eȝen.— Ne: ioie: hateþ me wylfullych & twynkeleþ with her eȝen.
For hij spak peisiblelich to me, and hij spekand þouȝten trecherie in wraþe of þe erþe.peseablech: gyle.
Hij maden her mouthe large up me, and seiden, Alas, alas! our eȝen seȝen.maden] sprad: —large: seȝen] haþ see.
Þou seiȝe hem, Lord, ne holde þe nouȝt stylle; ne depart þou noȝt fram me, Lord.—ne: —ne.
Ha Lord, my God, arise, and ȝyf kepe to my cause in iugement.Ha Lord] My Lord &: ȝyf] take: dome.
My Lord and my God, iuge me efter þyMS. my. riȝtfulnes; and ne glade nouȝt þe wicked vp me.deme—me: my] þy: —ne.
Ne saien hij nouȝt in her hertes, Sorow, sorow,The second o is added over line. to our soule; ne saien hij nouȝt, We shal deuouren hym.—Ne: ne] &.
Wexen hij asshamed, and dreden hij to-gidres, þat gladen of myn iuels.—to-gidres.
Ben hij cloþed wyþ confusione and drede, þat speken iuels up me.
Gladen and ioien hij þat wyl my riȝtfulnes, and saie hij, Bi our Lord alwaie heried; and hij þat willen þe pees of his seruaunt glade.bi] be: glade before þai þat.
And my tunge shal þenchen þy riȝtfulnes and þy heryynge ich day.all day.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 36, MS.PSALM 35 (36).
DIV2.P: Þe vnryȝtful seid, þat he ne trespasseþ nouȝt in hym seluen; þe drede of God nis nouȝt to-forn his eȝen.—ne: is.
For he did trecherouslich in his siȝt, þat his wickkednes be founden to hatyng.gylefullych.
Þe wordes of his mouþe ben wickednes and trecherie; he nold nouȝt vnderstonde to do wele.tr.] gyle: wolde: vnde|stonde (!): well.
He þouȝt wickednes in his couche, he stode to al wai nouȝt gode; for-soþe he ne hated nouȝt wickednes.gode+&: —ne.
Lord, þy mercy his in heuen, and þy riȝtfulnes vn-to þe cloudes.Lor.
Þy riȝtfulnes ys as þe mounteines of God, þi mani iugementȝ as helle.domys.
Þou, Lord,Here the MS. has a þ, which is struck out. shal saue men and bestes, as tou, God,MS. astougod, followed by a þ, which is struck out. haþ multiplied þy mercy.
For-soþe mennes sones shul hopen in graces of þy mercy.men: in þe grace.
Hij shul ben drunken of þe plente of þin hous, and þou shalt ȝeue hem drynk of þe welle of de-litinges.delites.
For atMS. þat. þe is þe wille of liif; and we shul se liȝt in þy liȝt.For at þe: well.
Shade for-þe, Lord, þy mercy to þe knowand þe, and þy riȝtfulnes to hem þatHere the writer has first written an h, but has struck it out. ben riȝtful of hert.Schewe: þe kn.] men know|yng.
Ne cum nouȝt to me þe viceMS. voice. of pride, and þe honde of sinȝer ne stir nouȝt me.—Ne cum nouȝt to: vice: —ne: moue.
Þer fel hij þat wirchen wickednes; and hij [ben] putt out, and hij ne myȝt nouȝt stonden.& þai & þai beþ put oute:—ne.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 37, MS.PSALM 36 (37).
DIV2.P: Ne wil þou nouȝt filȝen in þe wicked; ne loue þou nouȝt þe doand wickednes.—Ne: felow: þe d.] me[n] doyng euyl or.
For hij shul drien hastilich as hay, and hij shul fallen sone as worten of herbes.
Hope in our Lord, and do godnesse, and wonne in erþe; and þou shalt be fed in his riches.
Delite þe in our Lord, and he shal ȝeue to þe askinges of þyn hert.to þe+þe.
Shewe þy way to our Lord, and hope in hym; and he shal do þy wylle.
And he shal lede þy riȝtfulnes as liȝt and þy iugement as middai; bi suget to our Lord, and praye to hym.dome: bi] be.
Ne wil þou nouȝt folwen in him þat prosperet in his waie, ne in man þat doþ wronges.—Ne: folow in (!) þat wele fareþ no in his way non in: wrong.
Ende fram ire, and forsak wodeship; and ne wyl þou nouȝt folwe ire, þa-tou be made wicked.Sese: wodnes: —ne.
For hij, þat ben wicked, shal be don out of heuen; hij, þat seruen our Lord, shul han þe heritage of heuen.heuen+&: seruye.
And ȝit a litel vnder-stonde, and no synne (!) shal be in heuen; and þou shalt seche his stede, and þou shalt nouȝt finde it.non syn.
For-soþe þe mylde shul enerit þe heuen, and delyten in þe michelnes of ioie.meke: enheryt—þe.
Þe synȝer shal pursuen þe riȝtful,MS. riȝtfus (with a round s). and shal gnaist up hym wyþ hys teþe.riȝtful: grent.
Our Lord for-soþe shal scorne hym, for he seþ þat his ende come.For-soþe our Lorde: schal cum.
Þe synȝers made her manaces, and sheweden her iuels,
Þat hij deceyue þe suffrand and þe gode, þat [hij] folen þe ryȝtful of hert.deseyue me[n] sufferyng+or þe pore: þat folen] & defule.
Her manaces entre in-to her soules, and be he[r] iuel to-broken.he] her.
BetterMS. Beiter. is lytel þynge wyþ ryȝt, þan mani riches wyþ synȝes.Better: ryȝt+for to haue: riches+of synners.
For þe myȝtes of þe synȝers shal be defoulede; our Lorde for-soþe helpeþ þe riȝtful.defoilyd.
Our Lord knew þe dedes of þe vnwemmed, and her heritage shal be wyþ-outen ende.vnfilyd.
Hij ne shul nouȝt be confounded in tyme of vengeaunce, and hij shul be fulfild in daies of pines; for þe synȝers shul perissen.payne.
For-soþe þe enemys of our Lord, as sone as hij ben worþshipped and heȝed, hij shul failMS. fall (expunged) fail. failand as smoke.enhyed: defaylyng: smeche.
Þe synful shal borow and nouȝt ȝelden; þe riȝtful for-soþe han mercy, and shal ȝelden.pay: haþ: pay.
For þe blissand our Lord shul en-herit þe heuen; and þe iuel sygg|andMS. syngand. to hym shul sholden fram hym.For men blyssyng: iuel siggyng: perisch.
Þe goynges of man shul be dresced to our Lord; and he shal wylle his waie.goynges] waies.
Whan þe riȝtful haþ fallen, he ne shal nouȝt ben hirt; for our Lord laiþ his honde vnder hym.—ne: hurte+or harmyd.

Ich was ȝonge, and by-come olde;MS. hold (expuncted) olde. and y ne seiȝ neuer þe ryȝtful for-saken, ne his sede faile ioies.& y wex elde: —ne: r.+man: non his sede sechyng his his brede or faylyng ioies.
Þe ryȝtful ys merciful al day, and laneþ; and his sede shal [ben] in bliscynge.leneþ: schal+be.
Bowe fram yuel, and do gode; and woneþ in þe world of worldes.wone.
For our [Lord] loueþ iugement, and shal nouȝt forsaken hys halwen; hij shul ben kept wyþ-outen ende.+Lorde: dome &+he.
Þe vnryȝtful shul be punist, and þe sede of þe wicked shal perisse.
Þe ryȝtful for-soþe shul enherit þe erþe, and hij shul [wonen in þe] worlde of worldes up it.For soþe þe r.: schall+won in þe: up it] þer vp.
Þe mouþe of þe ryȝtful shal þenchen wisdam, and his tunge shal speke iugement.dome.
Þe lawe of God ys in his hert, and his goynges ne shul nouȝt be put out.wayes—ne.
Þe synȝer seþ þe ryȝtful man, and secheþ to sle hym.MS. him (dotted out) hym.

Our Lord for-soþe ne shal nouȝt for-sake þe riȝtful in þe hondes of þe sinȝer; ne he ne shal nouȝt dampne him, as he haþ iugodMS. iu god. hym.For-soþe our L.—ne: ne he ne] & he: when he schal be demyd to hym.
A-bide our Lord, and kepe his waye; and he shal anheȝen þe, þat tou take þerþe in heritage; and þou shalt sen, whan þe synȝers shul perisse.Habyde: enhye.
Ich seiȝe þe wicked up-heȝed and vp-lifted as þe cedros of Liban.se: enhied & rered vp: ceders of+þe.
And ich passed, and se! he nas nouȝt; ich soȝt hym, and his stede nas nouȝt yfunden.was: was.
Kep clennesse, and se euennes; for hij ben relikes to man þat his peisible.to a pesable man.
Þe vnriȝtful forsoþe shul ben desparplist, and þe relikes of þe wicked shul dien.For-soþe þe v.: disparpled.
Þe helþe of þe ryȝtful ys of our Lord, and he his her defendour in tyme of tribulacion.is—of.
Our Lord shal helpen hem, and diliuer hem, and defende hem fram synȝers, for þat hij hopeden in hym.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 38, MS.PSALM 37 (38).
DIV2.P: Lord, ne wyþ-nymeMS. wyþ myne. me noȝt in [þy vengeaunce, ne reproce me nouȝt in] þyn ire.— ne: withnym: ire] vengaunce no reproue me noȝt in þin ire.
For þyn a-sautes ben ficchedAbove the second c there is a stroke shaped like an horizontal comma. to me, and þou confermed vp me þyn helpe.prikkyd: confirmyd þin help vp me.

Helþe nys nouȝt in my flescheInstead of the e the MS. has a curved stroke after the h, such as is usually written as an abbreviation for n. for þe charge of [þyn ire, þer nys no pes to my bones for þe charge of] myn synȝes.is: charge of+þine ire þer is no pes to my bones for þe charge of.
For myn wickednesse ben ouergon myn heued, and as a greue charge hij ben greued up me.greue ch. hij] greuous chard(!) þat.
Min helynges oþer helþes a-bouen roteden, and ben corrumped of þe charge of myn vncunninges.My helyd woundes beþ roten & corrupt for þe ch. of myn vncun|nyng.
Ich am made wroched (!) and croked vnto ende, and ich entred al day sorȝful.wrechid & ych am made cr. vnto+þe: soryfull.
For myn bachesMS. uaches. ben fulfild of illusiouns; and helþe nys nouȝt in my flesshe.lenden: dyssaytes: is.
Ich [am] turmented, and ich am michel lowed; and ich cried fram þe sorweyng of myn hert.+am: ich am . . fram] lowed gretlych ych rored for.
Lor,MS. ffor. al my desire is to-fore þe; and my waymentyng nys nouȝt hid fram þe.For] Lord: is.
Myn hert his tribled in me; my uertu haþ forsaken me, and þe liȝt of myn eȝen, and þat nys nouȝt wyþ me.sturblyd: is.
Myn frendes and myn neȝburs com to-wardes me and stoden.stode+or aȝens me.
And hij þat weren by me stoden fer fram me, and hij þat souȝtenMS. þouȝten. my soule made force.by] next: fer . . .] afarre & made strengþe þai þat souȝt my s.
And hij þat soȝten iuels to me speken uanites; and aldai hij þouten trecheries.Latin and English omitted.
Ich for-soþe [as defe] herd nouȝt, and as doumbe nouȝt openand his mouþe.Ich forsoþe] & ych as dumbe defe(dumbe being expuncted): open|yng noȝt his+his(!).
And ich am made as man nouȝt herand and nouȝt hauand vnder|nimynges in hys mouþe.hauyng in his m. reprouynges.
For ich hoped in þe, Lord; Lord, my God, þou shal here me.—lord.
For y seid, þat myn enemys ne ioien nouȝt vp me, and spoken grete þynges vp me, þer-whyles þat my fete ben stired.—ne: ioied: & þai spake.
For ich [am] made radi in tourmentes, and my sorowe ys alway iu my syȝt.+am: into tourmentynges.
For ich shal tellen my wickednesse & þenche for my sinȝe.tellen] schewe.
Myn enemys for-soþe liuen, & ben confermed vp me; and hij, þat hateden me wickedlich, ben multiplied vp me.For-soþe m.e.: confirmyd.
Hij þat ȝelden iuels for godes, bakbytyng me, for þat ich folwed godenes.euyl for gode bakbyted.
Ha Lord, my God, ne forsake me nouȝt, and ne depart nouȝt fram me.—Ha: —ne: —ne.
Lord God of myn helþe, vnderstonde in-to myn helpe.vnderst.] take hede.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 39, MS.PSALM 38 (39).
DIV2.P: Ich seid, Y shal kepen my vertuȝ, þat ich ne trespas nouȝt in my tunge.—ne: with.
Ich sett kepyng to my mouþe, þer-whiles þat þe synȝer stode oȝains me.
Ich bi-com doumbe, and [was meked, and] helde me stylle fram godes; and my sorowe is newed. bicom . . . godes] was dum & ych was meked & ych was still fram godenes: was made newe.
Myn hert wex hote wiþ-inne me, and fur bigan to brenne in my þouȝt.in my mynde fure schal berne.
Ich spak wyþ my tunge, Make, Lord, knowen to me myn endyng,Lord, make myn ende know to me.
And þe numbre of my daies which it is, þat ich wite, what þynge me lackeþ.And] & make know to me: know what fayleþ to me.
Se! þou settest myn daies mesurable, and my substaunce as nouȝt to-fore þe.Lo.
For-soþe ich manMS. am. liuiand ys al manere of vanyte.am] man: —of.
Man for-soþe in likenes [passeþ]; ac in vayn he hys tribled.For-soþe man in ymage passeþ bot: sturblyd.
He gadered tresours, and he wote neuerto whom he shal gaderen hem.gadreþ: note—neuer.
And which is nou myn abydyng? nouȝt our Lord? and my sub|staunce ys to þe.ab.+wheþer: to] at.
De-fende me fram alle wickednesses; þou ȝafMS. h (dotted out) ȝaf. me reproce to þe vnwis.wykkydnes: reproue: +man.
Y by-com dumbe, and ne oponed nouȝt my mouþe, for þou it made; do oway fram me miMS. in. synȝes.ne] y: opend: in] my.
Ich failedMS. falled. in blamynges for þe strengþe of þyn honde; þou reproceþ man for wickednes.faylyd: strenkeþ: h.+&: reprouyd.
And þou madest his soule to stumblen as a lob; ich man for-soþe is trubled idelliche.for-soþe ych man is sturblyd.
Here, Lord, myn orisoun and my praiere; take my teresMS. trese (expuncted) teres. to þyn eren.L. h.: to] with.
Ne for-sake me nouȝt, for ich am synner at þe and passand, as alle my fadres weren.—ne: am+a.
