Graunte to me, þat ich be wasshen of syne, to-foreTwice to fore in MS. þat ich die; and ich ne shal nomore be dampned.w.] clene: —ne.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 40, MS.PSALM 39 (40).
DIV2.P: Ich abidand þe grace of our Lord a-bode my Lord; and he vnder|stonde (!) me.habydyng: vnsterstode.
And he herd my praiers, and lad me out of þe stenche of uices and fram þe pynes of helle.vices+or of þe water of wrechid|nes: paynnes.
And he stablist my fete in stedfastnes, and dresced my goynges.sett.
And he laide gode worde in my mouþe, dite to our Lord.put.
Many shul sen and douten andMS. an hon (struck out) and. hopen in our Lord.
Blisced be þe man, of which þe name of our Lord his his hope, and ne haþ don no uanites, ne fals wodnesses oȝains his lawe.ne haþ] he haþ: wodnes.
Lord, my God, þou dost many woundres; and þer nis non, þat is lich to þe in þy þouȝtes.My Lorde Godd: madest: nis] is.
Ich shewed and spak þyn wondres vn-to men; and myn wordes ben multiplied wyþ-outen noumbre.ben] wer.
Þou ne woldest sacrifie non offrynge wyþ-outen vertu; þou madest for-soþe vnderstondyng to me.—ne: s.] sacrifice: f.s. þou.
Þou ne askedest nouȝt offrand for synne; þan seid ich, Se! y com to þe.—ne: cum.
Wryten it is of me in þe comaundement of þe lawe, þat ich do þy wylle; ha mi God, ich it wolde, and þy lawe amiddes myn hert.com.] heste: ha . . wolde] y wolde it (it is added over the line) my Godd.
Ich shewed þy ryȝtfulnes to many trew; Lord, y ne shal nouȝt defenden myn lippes; þou it wyst.r.+in a grete church: trew+men se: —ne: þou wyst it well.
Y ne hyd nouȝt þy ryȝtfulnes in myn hert, ich seidei added over line. þy soþenes and þyn helþe.—ne.
Ich ne hiddeMS. bidde. nouȝt þy mercy and þy soþenes fram þe michel conseil of þe vntrew.Y hyd: much: of vntrew men.
Ne do nouȝt, Lord, þy mercy fer fra me; þy mercy and þy soþenes alway han y-takeMS. haby (or haly?) take; b and y are written very close together. me.—Ne: haby] han.

For yueles, þat [no] noumbre is of, han i-cumpassedMS. ham cump., or for han cump. without i-? me; myMS. wyþ. wickednesses token me, and y ne myȝt nouȝt, þat ich seyȝe hem.euyl thynges þat+no: han closyd me my w.: —ne: þat ich s.] se.
Þe wicked ben multiplied vp þe heres of myn heued; and mynheued and myn twice in MS. hert haþe for-saken me.w. + men: of] on.
Plese it, Lorde, to þe, þat þou defende me; loke, Lord, for to helpe me.Lord pl. it: —for.
Ben hii confounded, and waxen hij asshamed to-gideres, þat sechen my soule, þat hij don fram þe.þat hij don] to do it.
Ben hij turned oȝayn & asshamed, þat wyllen iuels to me.
Beren hij hastilocheo corrected from y. her confusion, þat saien to me, Alas! alas!
Alle þat sechen þe, hij shul gladen vp þeMS. me. and ioien; and saien hij euermore, þat louen þyn helþe, Be our Lord heried.MS. heued.hij shul . . . me] be þai glade vp þe: ioie+þay: heryed.
Ich am for-soþe beggand and pouer; our Lord ys bisi of me.F. s. ych am a beggar a. p.+&.
Þou art myn helper and my defendour; ha my God, dwelle nouȝt.tary.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 41, MS.PSALM 40 (41).
DIV2.P: Blisced be he, þat helpeþ þe nedeful and þe pouer; our Lord shal de-liuere hym fram iuels atte daye of iugement.þat+vnderstondeþ or: at þe: dome.

Kepe hym our Lord, and quike hym: he shal make hym blisced in erþe, and he shalt nouȝt ȝyf hym into þe pouste of hys enemys.quike . . .] make hym qwyk & he schal noȝt ȝyf þeMS hym (struck out) þe. into þe power of h. e.
Our Lord be to hym helpe up þe charge of his sorowe; þou, Lord, turned alle his sharpenes in his sykenes.
Y seid, Lorde, haue mercy on me; hele my soule, for ichaue sinned to þe.
Myn enemis seiden iuels to me, whan he shalle dien, and his name shal peris.
And ȝif myn enemy entred in-to my hous, þat he seiȝe me, he spak idel þynges; his hert gadered wickednes to hym.schuld se: þinges+and.
He went out, and spak in þat ich þynge.
Alle myn enemys grucched oȝains me, and þouten iuels to me.
Hij stablisshe[d] þe wicked worde oȝayns me, þat his to wyte,MS. me (expuncted) wyte. ȝyf he þat slepeþ arise nouȝt and go.sett—þe: wytt.
For þis man was of myn pes, in whom ich hoped; hij þat eten min loues, herieden vp me supplauntynge oþer puttyngoþer putting is underlined. out.For+he: —suppl. oþer.
Haue þou, Lord, mercy on me, & arere me; and hiji.e. y (ego). shal ȝelden [hem] her mede.Lord haue m.: y schal ȝelde+hem.
Ich wist by þis þynge, þatou woldest me; for myn enemy ne shal nouȝt ioien up me.—ne.
Þou for-soþe toke me for vn-loþ-fulnes, and confermed me in þy siȝt wyt-outen ende.F. s. þou.
Blisced be our Lord, God of Israel, fram þe worled into þe worledMS. worded.; be it don, be it don.world: world.

DIV2.HEAD: Not numbered in MS.PSALM 41 (42).
DIV2.P: As þe hert de-siret to þe welles of waters, so de-sired my soule to þe,After þe, a word is erased. Lord.desireþ: desireþ.
And my soule þrefe (!) vnto God, welle liueand, whan ich shal cum and apere to-fore þe face of God.—And: afyrsteþ (!) to Godd a lyfyng well: and] y schal.
Mi teres were to me loues day and nyȝt, þer-wyles þat man seid to me ich day, Where hys þy God?þat man] yt is.

Ich by-þouȝt of þe þynges, and priked in me my soule; for hyi.e. y (ego). shal passen in-to þe stede of purgatorij ful of pines, riȝt vn-to heuen.of þe] þise: prikkyd: hy]y: purgatorie: paynes into þe hous of Godd þat is into h.
Þe soune of þe ioiand ys in þe voice of ioie and of shrift.of ioiyng: of ioiyng.
Ha þou my soule, why ertou sori, & why trubles tou me?O: heuy: sturbelistow.
Hope in God, for y shal ȝete shriue vnto hym; he his helþe of my gost and my God.MS. my god and my gost.ȝyt: vnto] to: God] goste: gost] Godd.

Myn soule is trubled vn-to my seluen; for-þy, Lord, y shal be þenchand on þe, God, of þe tur[n]ing of folk of þe londe of Jordan and of þe folk of þe littel hille of Hermon.sturblyd to: be-þenche: turn|yng: 1. folk+or.
Helle blameþ þe fendes for þy deþ of þe croice.blameþ—þe: þy] þe.
Alle þyn lorde-shippes and þy techynges passeden up me.
In daie our Lord sent his mercy and on nyȝt his confort.In+þe: in.
Lord, þe oreison of my lif is to þe; ha Lord, y sai, Þou ert my taker.—ha.
Whi hastou forȝeten me, and whi am ich sory, þer-whiles þat myn enemy tourmenteþ me?to-whyls.

Þer-whiles þat myȝtes ben frusced, myn enemys, þat trublen me, reproued me;myȝtes ben fr.] my bones or m. beþ brokeAbove and between the r and o there is a stroke like a long comma. or proschyd: sturbleþ.
Þer-whiles þat hij seiden to me vuch daye, Were is þy God?say: by all days.
Ha þou my soule, whi ar-tou sori, and whi trubles tou me?O: sturblestow.
Hope in God, for i shal ȝit schryue to hym; he his helþe of mi gost and my God.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 42, MS.PSALM 42 (43).
DIV2.P: Iugg me, Lord, and defende my cause fram folk nouȝt holy, and defende me fram þe wicked man and þe trecherous. Lorde deme me.
For þou art Gode, my strengþe; whiMS. wiþ; or for wi? puttestou me out? and whi goe ich sorwand, þer-whiles þat myn enemy tourmenteþ me?Godd: whi putestow.
Sende out þy lyȝt and þy soþenes; hij ladden me out, and ladde men me in-to þy holi hylle and in-to þy tabernacles.2. out] fram: lad me to into þine: into] in.
And y shal entre unto Goddes auterMS. goddessauter (ss on erasure).; to God, þat makeþ glade my ȝingþe.MS. þing þe.Goddes auter: ȝouþe.
Ha God, my God, y shal schryue me to þe in þe in-mast of myn hert; ha þou my soule, whi ertou sori, and why trublestou me?O þou Godd: inermast: o: sturblestow.
Hope in God, for ȝete y shal shryue to hym; he is helþMS. holi. of my gost and my God.ȝyt schal ych: holi] helþe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 43, MS.PSALM 43 (44).
DIV2.P: Ha God, we herden wyþ our erenMS. eȝen (dotted out) eren.; our fadres telden vsO þou Godd: tolde.
Þe werke, þat tou wrouȝt in her daies and in olde daies.
Þyn honde desparplist þe folk, and þou settest hem; þou tour|mentedesto added over line. folkes, and puttedest hem out of here pride.disparplid—þe: turmen|did (!) folk: put.
For hij ne shul nouȝt haue þerþe in swerde, and her myȝt ne shal nouȝt sauen hem,—ne: in] with: —ne.
Ac þy god-hede and þy myȝt and þe liȝt of þy face; for þou plesed to hem.Bot: godhode: þe] þi.
ÞouMS. vn. þy-self art my God and my kyng, þat sendest helþes to Jakob.Vn] þou: God] kyng: kyng] Godd: sentest.
WheMS. who. shul chace oway our enemys þurȝ force in þe, and we shul despysen in þy name þe arisand oȝains us.Who] we: þe ar.] men rysyng.
For y ne shal nouȝt hopen in my waityng; and my swerde ne shal nouȝt sauen me.—ne: —ne.
For þou sauedest vs [fram hem þat turmented vs], and þou con|founded hem þat hateden vs.sauyd vs+fram hem þat tur|mentyd vs: þat h.] hatyng.
Whe shul ben heried in God al day, and whe shul shryue in þy name in þe worled.

For-soþeMS. for foþe. þou puttedest us now oway,After oway follows an e, which is dotted out. and confoundedest us; and þou, God, ne shal nouȝt go out in our vertuȝ.For-soþe: put: confundyd: —ne: schalt.
Þou turnedest vs by-hynde rygge efter our enemis; and hij þat hated vs rauissed vs to hem selue.byh. r.] a-bache.
Þou ladest vs as shepe of metes; and þou desparplist vs amonge folkes.lad: disparpled.
Þou seldest þy folk wyþ-outen pris; and multitude nas nouȝt in chaungynges of hem.& þer was no m.
Þou laidest us in liknes to folkes, stireing of heued in folkes.steryng.
Þou settest us repruseMS depruse. to our neȝburs, vndernimyngHere an e follows, but is dotted out. and scorne to hem þat ben in our cumpas.depruse] reproue: scornyng.
Aldai my shame is oȝains me, and confusion of my face haþ couered me.
Fram þe voice of þe reproceand and þe oȝains spekand, fram þe face of þe enemy and of þe pursuand.of man reprouyng & aȝene spekyng+&: —and of þe.
Alle þes þynges comenMS. to men. up us; and we ne forȝate þe nouȝt, and we did nouȝt yuel in þy testament. come: —ne.
And our hert ne departed nouȝt oȝain-ward; and þou bowedest þyn bysties fram þy waie.—And: —ne: paþes.
For þou lowed vs in stede of turment; and shadew of deþ couered vs.in+þe.
Ȝyf we forȝate þe name of our Lord, and putten forþe our hondes to a strange God,Lorde+Godd: put.
It is to witen, ȝif God shal nouȝt asken þes þynges; for he knewe þe hidynges of þe hert.preuy þinges.
For we ben slayn al dai for þe; we ben holden bi as shepe of slaȝtter.MS. scaȝtter.slaȝtter.
Arise vp, Lord; whi dwellestou? arise vp, and ne put vs nouȝt oway in ending.tarystow: —vp: —ne: in+þe.
Whi turnestou þy face oway? þou for-ȝetest our mesaisMS. me fais. and our tribulacioun.mysays.
For our soule is lowed in poudre, and our wombe is deuoured to-gideres in þerþe.to-gyder in erþe.
Arise up, Lord, and helpe vs; and bigge vs aȝayn for þy name.bigge vs aȝ.] deliuer vs.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 44 (45).
DIV2.P: Myn hert put out gode worde; y saye my werkes to þe kynge of glorie.p. o.] schewyd: ioie.
My tunge is penne of þe scriuayn swiflich (!) wrytand.is+þe: swyftelych.
Fair artou, Christ, in fourme to-fore mennes sones; grace is shaddeMS. sbadde. in þy lippes; for-þy blisced God þe wyþ-outen ende.sbadde] chade: þerfor he blyssyd þe Godd.
Be þou girded wyþ þy myȝt, aldermyȝtfullichest, up þy folke.moste myȝtfulyche.
Ȝyf entent godelich, and go forþe, and regne in þy cumlichenes and in þy fairnes,

For soþnes and softnes and riȝtfulnes; and þy pouste shal laden þe wonderfulliche.Instead of the last e the MS. has a stroke as commonly used as an abbreviation for n.softnes] mekenes: pouer: lede—þe.
Þy manaces ben sharp; folk shul fallen vnder þe vnto þe hertes of þe kynges enemys.scharp+&: into.
Ha God, þy sege is in þe worlde of worldes; þe ȝerde of drescingMS. deescing. is ȝerde of þyMS his. kyngdome.O: dressyng is þe ȝerd of þi k.
Þou louedest riȝtfulnes, and hatest wickednes; þer-for God, þy God, anoint þe wyþ oil of ioie to-for þy felawes.louyd riȝt and hatyd: anoynetyd.
Myrre and gutt and smel ben of þy uestment, of þy housesMS. bones. of heuen, of which þe gode soules delitedenMS. delitende. þe in þyn honur.sm.] swete sm.: vp þi cloþing of þe houses: delityd.
Þe quene stode at þy ryȝt half in gildan cloþyng, encompassed alabouten wyþ selcouþnesse.riȝt hondes in glyt (!) cl. en|closyd a-boute wyþ diuersnes.
Here þou, soule, and se, and bowe þyn ere, and for-ȝete þy fole þoȝtes and þe substaunces of þy fader.foly: substance.
And þe kyng shal couait þyMS. þe. fairhede; for he is þe Lord, þy God, and [þe folk shul worþship hym].þi fayrehode: and + þe folke schal wyrschip hym.

[And þe sones of Tyre & alle þe ryche of] þe folk shal praien þy semblant in ȝyftos.The verses 13 and 14 are written in one in the MS.And þe sonnes of Tyre & all þe ryche of þe folke schal pray þi chere in ȝiftys.
Alle his glorie wyþ-innen hym is of þe soule of God of grete ioies, couered a-boute wyþ meruailous þynge.glorie]ioie: meruolus þinges.
Maidenes shal be brouȝt to God efter hym, and hys next shul ben brouȝt to þe.
Hii shul ben brouȝt in-to gladnes and ioie, and shul ben brouȝt in-to þe ioie of God.
Sones ben born to þe for þy fadres; þou shalt stablisse hem princes vp alle þerþe.for þy] to (dotted out) fore þe: sett.
For-þy þe folkes shul shriue to þe wyþ-outen ente (!) in þy world of wordles (!).folk: ende+&: þe: worldes.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 45, MS.PSALM 45 (46).
DIV2.P: Our Lord is refut and vertu, helper in tribulacioun, þat founde vs to michel.vertu+&: þat + haþ: muche.
Þer-fore we shul nouȝt douten, þer-whiles þat þerþe shal be trubled; þe mounteins shul be born in-to þe hert of þe see.
Þe waters souned, and ben trubled; þe mounteins ben trubled in his strengþe.—þe m. ben tr.
Þe deluuþRead duluuy? gladeþ þe hous of heuen, þe almyȝtful halwed Noe and his.d.] grete flode: halowed+his tabernacle þat is.
God ne shal nouȝt be stired in-middes þys wonyng; God shal helpen hym erlich in þe morwenyng.—ne.
Men ben trubled, and kyngdoms ben lowed; God ȝaf his vengaunce, and þerþe is stired.sturblid: mouyd.
Þe Lord of vertuȝ ys wyþ vs; our taker ys God of Jacob.
Comeþ, and seþ þe werkes of our Lord, which he sett wonders vp þerþe.þat haþ sett.
Doand oway batail vnto þende of þerþe, he shal de-foule bowe and breke armes and brenne þe sheldes in þe fur.he] &: defuyle.
Abideþ and seþ, for ich am God; y shal be heȝed in folk, and y shal be heȝed in erþe.enhyed among: enhied: in+þe.
Þe Lord of vertu is wyþ us, þe God Iacob hisThe MS. repeats wyþ after his. our taker.vertues: Godd+of: —wyþ.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 46 (47).
DIV2.P: Ȝe alle folk, plaieþ wyþ hondes; gladeþ to God in voice of ioie.ioieþ with+ȝour: h.+&.
For our Lord ys heiȝe, dredful, and michel kyng vp al þerþe.michel k. vp] grete aboue.
He made folkes vnderlynges to us, and men he leid [vnd]erMS. leider. oure fete.He cast vnder to vs nacions, & vnder our f. he layde men.
He ches to vs hys herytage, þe fairnes of Iacob, which he loued.MS. loueþ.louyd.
God steȝ up in swete songe, and our Lord in uoice of trumpe.in sw. s.] with ioie.
Syngeþ to our Lord; syngeþ; syngeþ to our kyng, syngeþ.
For God his kyng of alle þerþe; singeþ wiseliche.
God shal regne vp men; God shal sitten vp his holi sege.men+&: sege] sete.

Princes of folkes ben assembled wyþ God of Abraham;Instead of the last a, the MS. has the usual abbreviation for ra. for þe stronge goddes of þe erþe ben gretliche an-heȝed.þe princes of folk beþ gadred.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 47 (48).
DIV2.P: Ou[r] Lord is michel [& worþi to be praysed] in þe cite of our God, in hys holy mounteyn.Our: grete+& worþi to be praysyd.
Þe mount Syon is founded in joie in alle þerþe; þe sides of þe norþe is þe cite of þe grete kyng.
God shal be knowen in his house, as he shal take it.when.
For se! þe kynges of þe erþeFor se þe kynges of þe erþe twice in MS., but the corrector has struck it out once. ben assembled; hij acordeden in on.
Hij sehen in swich manere, and ben amer-uailed; hij ben trubled and stired, dre de toke hem.sehen in sw. m. and] seyng so: sturbled: st.+&.
Þer ben sorowes as of þe [berand] child; and þou [s]halt defoulen þe folk of Thars in grete vengeaunce.þe] a woman beryng: schalt defoile.
We seȝen so as we herden in þe cite of our Lord; God founded hit wyþ-outen ende.We seȝen . . . herden] So as we herd, so we seiȝ in þe cite of our Lord of vertus.
God, we han taken þy mercy amiddes þe holi fante of þi temple.—taken: fonte.
Ha Lord, efter þy name, so þyn heriinge ys in þe londe of erþe; þy lawe is ful of ryȝt-fulnes.O: þe erþe.
Deliten þe folk of Syon, and ioien þe children of Jude, Lord, for þy iugementȝ.domes.
Cumpasseþ Syon, and clippe it; telleþ to folk, hardenedMS. hardeneþ. in hert.Goþe aboute, & beclipeþ it & t in þe toures of it to folk herd þe hertes.
Sett ȝour hertes in his vertu, and ȝeueþ his ryȝtes, þat ȝe tel it to þe woniand in heuen.ryȝtes] ryches: tell it in an oþer kynred þat is to hym dwellyng in h.
For here is our GodMS. lord (expuncted) god. wyþ-outen ende in þe worled of worldles (!); and he shal gouerne vs in heuens.

DIV2.HEAD: Not numbered in MS.PSALM 48 (49).
DIV2.P: Ȝe al men, hereþ þes þynges; hei.e. ȝe. alle þat wonen in herþe, vnder|stondeþ wyþ eren.he] ȝe: in erþe.
Ȝe, al erþelich and mennes sones, ben to-gider in on riche and pouer.men.
My mouþe shal speke wisdome, and þe þouȝt of myn hert quaintise.mynde: quayntenes.
Y shal bowe myn ere in parabiles, and shal open in þe sauter myn purpose.ensaumples &+y.
Whi shal ich doute in þe daie of iugement? þe wickednes of myn hele shal go a-bout me.dome: go about] enclose.
Hii, þat affien hem in her vertu and in þe mychelnes of her riches, gladen.beleueþ or trusteþ — hem: gretnes.

Broþer ne biggeþ, man shal raunsoun, he ne shal nouȝt ȝeuen to God his quemeyng.The MS. has a q with a stroke over it as is elsewhere used to abbreviate an n.ne b.] biggyþ noȝt: —ne: quemyng (MS. q with an e over it).
And for þe pris of his raunsoun he shal trauail wyþ-outen ende; and ȝete he shal liuen euermore.
He ne shal nouȝt se þe deþ, as he haþ sen þe wise dyand; þe vnwyse and þe fole shal perissen to-gidres.—ne: haþ sen] schal se: to|geder.
And hij shal laten her riches vn-to stranges, and her biriels shul ben her houses wyþ-outen ende.strangers: hous.
Her tabernacles ben in kynde and kynde; hij shul clepen her names in her erþes.londes.
And as man was in honur,MS. homur. he ne vnderstode nouȝt; he his liche to meres vn-wyse, and he is made liche to hem.honour: —ne: is likkynd to bestes.
Þys herMS. ys (expuncted) her. way his sclaunder to hem; and efter hij shul plesen uiciouselicheMS. uicoūseliche; cf. uicōse in the Latin text. in her mouþe.
Hij ben don in helle, as shepe ben to-gidres in flok;MS. folk. and þe fende shal tourmenten hem.to-geder: flok.
And þe riȝtful shul lord-shippe vp hem in ioie; and her helpe shul bycomen olde fram her glorie in helle.lordsh.] haue lordschip: ioie.
For-soþe God shal bige oȝain my soule fram þe pines of helle, whan he haþ taken me.paynes.
Ne doute þe nouȝt, whan man his made riche, and whan þe glorie of his hous his multiplied.Ne doute þe] Drede þou: ioie.
For whan he shal dyen, he ne shal nouȝt take al þynges; ne his glorie ne shal nouȝt descenden wyþ hym.—1. ne: 2. ne] no: ioie: —3. ne.
For þe soule of þe gode shal ben blisced in his liue, and he shal reioys to þe whan þou hast wele don to hym. reioie: don to] do.

Þe wicked shal entren unto þe progenie, uel, oþer, kynde,The last three words are underlined with red ink. of his faders, and he shal se no liȝt wyþ-outen ende.Notabile written in margin by a later hand.in-to: uel oþer] or þe.
As man whas in honur, he ne vnderstode nouȝt; he his likened to meres vn-whis, and he ys made liche to hem.Whe[n]: —ne: was lyk|kynd to vnwyse bestes.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 48, MS.PSALM 49 (50).
DIV2.P: Our Lord, God of goddes, spak, and cleped þerþe.
Fram þe sonne arisyng vn-to þe going a-doune, þe spece of his fairnes is of Syon.vnto . . . adoune] into þe fallyng.
God shal comen aperteliche, our Lord; and he ne shal nouȝt be stylle.—ne.
Fur shal by-gynne to brenne in his siȝt, and grete tempest shal ben in his cumpasse.
He cleped þe heuen fram a-bouen, and þerþe for to iugen his puple.
Hei e. ȝe. god, assembleþ ȝe to hym his halwen, þat ordeine his testa|ment vp sacrifices.—He god: Gadreþ: ordey|neþ: sacrifice.
And þe heuens shul tellen his riȝtfulnes; for God his iuge.schew.
Here ȝe, my folk of Israel; and hy shal speken, and witnes to þe; y, God, ham þy god.hy] y.
Y ne shal nouȝt repruue þe in þy sacrifices; þyn offrynges for-soþe ben alway in my siȝt.—ne: reproue: sacrifice.
Y ne shal nouȝt taken chalues of þyn hous, ne kiddes of þyn flokkes.—ne: no.
For alle þe wilde bestes of þe wodes ben myn, þe meres and þe oxen in þe mounteins.þe meres and þe] kyne &.
Y knew alle þe foweles of heuen, and þe fairnes of þe felde is wyþ me.know: foweles] folkes.
Ȝyf ich haue hunger, y ne shal nouȝt saie to þe; for þe world and þe fulnes of it is myn.haue h.] schal hungre: — ne: plenteusnes þer-of.
Ne shal ich nouȝt ete bulles flesshe, ne drynke kiddes blode?—Ne: ne] non.
Offre to God sacrifice of heryynge, and ȝeld to þe alderheȝest þyn uowes.alderh.þyn u.] hyest þi wonnes.
And clepe me in daie of tribulacioun; and y shal defende þe, and þou shalt worship me.in+þe: wyrschip.
God for-soþe seide to þe synȝer, Whi tellestou my ryȝtfulnes,The MS. has myȝtfulnes instead of my ryȝtfulnes. and takeþ my testament by þy mouþe?F. s. Godd: telestow my riȝtfulnes.
Þou for-soþe hatedestMS. haddest. discipline, and þou kest my wordes by|hynde rygge.Fo (!) soþe þou hatyd lore —rygge.
Ȝyf þou sest a þef, þou ran wyþ hym, and laidi added over line. þy porcioun wyþ spouse-breches.seiȝ: ȝerne: put: wonteres.
Þy mouþe wex ful wyþ malice, and þyn tunge songe treccheries.was: of: spake gyle.
Þou sittand spak oȝain þy broþer, and þou settedest sclaundre oȝains þe sones of þy moder; þou dest þes þynges, and ich helde me stille.aȝens: put: son: dyd þise.
Þou wendest wickedleche, þat y shal be lich to þe; y shal reproue þe of þy susposeing, and y shal stablis iugumen oȝayn þy face.wende + wykkydnes or: supposyng: put dome.
Ȝe þat for-ȝeteþ God, vnderstondeþ þes þynges, þat he ne dampne ȝou nouȝt, and þat þer be non þat defendeþ ȝou.for-ȝete: þis: —ne: defende.
Sacrifice of heryyng shal honour me; and þer is þe waie þer y shal shewen to hym þe helþe of God.sacrif.] þe s.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 49, MS.PSALM 50 (51).
DIV2.P: Ha mercy on me, God, efter þy mychel mercy.Godd haue m. on me: grete.
And efter þe mychelnes of þy pites do way my wickednes.gretenes: mercyes: do away.
Whasshe me more of my wickednes, and clense me of myn synne.More-ouer wasch me fram: fram.
For ich knoweMS. knewe. my wickednes, and my synne ys euermore oȝains me.know.
Ich haue synned to þe alon, and ich haue don iuel to-fore þe, þa-tou be made ryȝt-ful in þy wordes, and þatou ouercum whan þou art iuged.made r.] iustified: schalt deme.
Se! for ich am conceiued in wickednesses, and my moder conceiued me in synnes.wykkydnes.
Se! for þou loued soþenes; þe vncerteyn þynges and pryue of [þy] wisdom þou made to me apert.preuy of+þi: opyn to me.
Þou sprengest me, Lord, wyþ þy mercy, and y shal be made clene; þou shalt purifieMS. purisie, with a long s. me, and y shal be made whyȝte vp snowe.Lord þ. sprenged me: wasch: whytter þan.
Þou shalt ȝeue ioie and gladnes to myn heryng,MS. beryng. and þe mylde dedes of my hert shul gladen.heryng: meke.
Turne þy face fram myn synnes,MS. synmes. and do oway al myn wickednes.synnes.
Ha God, make in me clene hert, and newe þou a ryȝt gost in myn hert.O: m. cl. h. in me & make new a riȝte g.
Ne putt me nouȝt fram þy face, and ne do nauȝt o-way fram me þyn holy gost.—Ne: —ne.
Ȝelde to me gladnes of þyn helþe, and conferme me wyþ þyn holy gost.Latin and English omitted.
Y shal techen þe wicked þyn wayes, and þe wicked shul ben conuerted to þe.turned.
Ha þou God, God of myn helþe, deliuer me of sinnes,MS. fines. and my tunge shal gladen þy ryȝtfulnes.O: synnes: gladen] wyr|schip.
Lord, þou shalt open myn lippes, and my mouþe shal tellen þyn heryyng.t.] schewe.
For ȝyf þou hade wolde, ich hade ȝeuen sacrifice; forsoþe þou ne shalt nouȝt deliten in sacrifices.Fo (!): —ne.
Trubled gostMS. god. is sacrifice to God; þou, God, ne shal nouȝt despisen þe hert sorowful and meke.A sturbled goste: þou . . . despisen] Godd dispise þou noȝt.
Do blisfullich, Lord, to þy chosen in þy gode wille, þat þe gode be confermed in heuens.L.do beniglich(!): confirmyd: heuen.
Þan shal tou take sacrifice of ryȝt, seruice, and honours; hij shul þan setten godenesses to-fore þy throne.godnes: trone.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 50, MS.PSALM 51 (52).
DIV2.P: Ha þou wicked, whi gladestou in malice, þat art myȝtful in wickednes?O: ioiestow.
Al day seid þy tunge vnryȝtfulnes; þou dost treccherie as a rasour sharp sauaand (!).þouȝt: as a scharp rasour þou did gyle.
Þou louedest malice up blisfolhede, more to speken wickednes þan euennes.vp bl.] more þan mekenes &.
Þou louedest [alle] trubland wordes in fibel tunge.louyd all wordes of casting doune in gyleful tung.
Þer-for shal God destruen þe on ende, and shal draw þe vp bi þe rotes out of þyMS. þe. tabernacle and þy rote fram þerþe of liueand.on] into þe: þi t.
Þe ryȝtful shul sen þe iuels of þe wicked, and hij shul douten hem; and hij shul leȝen vp hym, and shul sayen, Se þe man þat ne sett nouȝt God his helper.drede: hym] hem: —ne: helpe.
[B]vt he hoped in þe multitude of his riches, and he was michel worþ in his vanite.Bot:—þe: worþi.
Ich am in Godes hous as oliue fructifiand, ich hoped in þe mercy of God wyþ-outen ende in heuens.as an olyf beryng frute.
Y shal shryue to þe in þe world, forMS. twice for. þou it madest; and y shal abyde þy name, for it ys gode in þe syȝt of þyn halwen.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 51, MS.PSALM 52 (53).
DIV2.P: Þe vnwysMS. wn (struck out) vnwys. seid in his hert, God nis nouȝt.is.
Þe wicked ben corrumped and made loþeliche inMS. and. wickednesses; þer nys non þat doþ gode.and wick.] in her studes or in her wykkydnes: is: gode+þer is noȝt to one.
God loked fram heuen vp mennes sones, þat he se, ȝyf any be vnder|stondeand oþer sechand God.or.

Al loutedeno corrected from e. to-gidres fram godnes; hij ben madeMS. maden. inprofitable; þer nys non þat doþ god, þer nys non vn-to on.All þay lowtyd to-gyder f. godenes+&: made vnprofitable: is: is noȝt to one.
Ne witeþ nouȝt hij alle, þat wirchen wickednesses, þat deuouren my folk as mete of brede?wit: wykkydnes+&.
Hij ne cleped nouȝt God; þer hij tre[m]bleden for drede, þer no drede nas.—ne: —þer: tr.] were agast: was.
For God wasted þe bones of hem þat plesen to men; hij ben con|founded, for God haþ despised hem.her bones þat plesed.
Who shal ȝyf of Syon helþe to Israel? whan our Lord haþMS. had. tourned þe wrocchedhede of his folk, þe kynde of Iacob shal gladen, and þe folk of Israel shal ioyen.haþ: wrechydnes.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 52, MS.PSALM 53 (54).
DIV2.P: Ha God, makeMS. maked. me sauf in þy name, and iuge me in þy uertu.O Godd make: deme.
God, here my praiere, and take in þyn eren þe wordes of myMS. þy. mouþe.with: eres: my.
For strange arysen oȝains me, and stronge soȝt my soule, and ne sett nouȝt God to-forn her syȝt.straunge menaros: str.+men: —ne.
Se! for God helpeþ me, and our Lord is taker of my soule.Lo.
Turne oway iuels fro myn enemys, and departe hem in þy soþenes.
Y shal sacrifye to þe wyþ gode wylle, and shryue to þy name, Lord; for it is gode.s. wylfullych to þe.
For þou deliuered me of ichan tribulacioun, and myn eȝe despised vp myn enemys.ichan] all.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 53, MS.PSALM 54 (55).
DIV2.P: Ha God, here myn oreisoun, and ne despise þou nouȝt my praiere; vnder-stonde to me, and here me.O: —ne: —þou.
Ich am made sori in my haunteyng, and am tribluled (!) fram þe voice of myn enemy, and of þe tribulaciouns of þe sinȝers.vsyng & y am sturbled: tri|bulacyon: synner.
For hij bowed wickednisses to me, and hij were derend to me in ire.wykkydnes: heuy.
Myn hert his trubled in me, and drede of deþ fel vp me.sturblyd.
Drede and quakeyng comen vp me, and derknesses couered me.derknes.
Who shal ȝyf me þe ȝyftes of þe holi gost? and y shal fleȝe to heuen and resten þer?
Se! ich fleand fram God wyþ-drowe me fram hym, and ich woned in iuels.And ych with-drow me fram him flying fram God.
Ich abode hym þat made me sauf of my litelhede and of þe per|secucioun of þe gost.fram my litylhode.
Ouer-þrawe hem, Lord, and de-parte her tunges; for ich seiȝ wickednes & oȝain-sigging in þe cyte.se: in+in.
Wickednes shal cumpasse hym day and nyȝt vp his walles, and trauail and vnryȝtfulnes amiddes of hym. enclose.
And usure and trecherie ne failed nouȝt in his waies.gile: —ne.
For ȝyf myn enemy had missaidSecond i added over line. me, for-soþe ich had suffred.y schuld had (!) suffyrd.
And ȝif he, þat hated me, had spoken gret þynges vp me, par-chaunce, ich had hid me fram hym.par-auentur.
Soþeliche þou, God, art man of on hert, and my lader and my knower.For-soþe: —man: knowen.
Þou man, þat tou-gadrestou gra (gra is, however, expuncted) gadres. wyþ me toke swete metes: we ȝede in in Goddes hous wyþ on assente.þou man toke sw.m.to-gadres w. me.
Cum þe deþe vp þe yuel, and descenden hij into helle al liueand.Cum—þe: wykkyd+men: fall.
For wickednisses ben in her woninges in-middes of hem.wykkydnes beþ.
Ich for-soþe cried to our Lord, and our Lord saued me.For-soþ ych.
Y shal tellen at euen and at morwen and at mydday, and y shal nempnen þe heryyng of God; and he shal here my voice.at morow atte mydday & atte euen: schw (!).
He shal bigge oȝain my soule in pees fram þe wicked, þat comen nere me þurȝ iuel; for hij were wyþ me a-monges many gode.among.
God shal heren me and lowen hem, þe which is to-fore þe wordles.
For chaunge nis nouȝt to hem of her iuel lif,iuel lif twice in MS. and hij ne drad nouȝt God; he putt forþe his vengeaunce in-to ȝeldyng.is: —ne.
Hij defouled his testament, and hij ben departed fram þe ire of his myȝt; and his hert neȝed ire oȝayns hem.MS. hym.diffoiled: be: n.] broȝt neȝe: hem.
Hys wordes ben molist up oile, and na-for-þa (!) hij ben dartes.softer þan: neþeles.
Man, cast þyn hert up our Lord, and he shal norisen þe; he ne shal nouȝt ȝeuen euermore meltynge to þe ryȝtful.—ne.
Þou, God, for-soþe shalt laden hem into þe pitteOr pute. of deþ.F. s. þou Godd: put.
Men defouled wyþwyþ twice in MS. dedelich synne and þe trecheroustrecherorousus, MS. ne shul nouȝt han half her daies; for-soþe, Lord, ich shal hope in þe.Men of synnes & gyleful men schal.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 54, MS.PSALM 55 (56).
DIV2.P: Haue mercy on me God, for man haþ defouled me; þe fende trubled me, feȝtand alday oȝayns me.defoilid: haþ sturblyd.
Myn enemys defouled m[e] alday, for many were feȝtand oȝains me.defoilid: m] me.
Y shal drede þe fram þe heȝt of þe daye; y for-soþe shal hope in þe.& for-soþe y.
Hiji.e., y (=ego). shal hery my wordes [in God, ich hoped in God; y ne shal nouȝt dreden,] what manes flesshe doþ to me.Hij] y: wordes+in Godd ych hopid in Godd y schal noȝt drede.
Alday þe wicked acurseden myn wordes oȝains me; alle her þoutes ben in iuel.
Hij shul wonen in helle, and þer hij shul hiden hem; and hij shul kepen mi d[e]-fouleing.MS. mid fouleing.my defoulyng.
As hij tempteden my soule, for nouȝt þou shalt make hem sauf; and þou shalt bring to nouȝt þes folkes in þyn ire.þise folk.
Ha God, ich telde my lyf to þe; þou laidest min teres in þy syȝt.O: schewd: sett.
As in þy bihest shul þan myn enemys be turned oȝain-ward.shul . . . enemys] myn enemys schal þan.

In wat daye þat ich cleped to þe, se! ich am aknowLast word of the line. The expression is miswritten for ichaua know, ich haue knowen, cf. ich haua songen, Ps. 70, 25. þat þou art my God.clepe: lo: haue know.
Y shal herien worde in þe, God, y shal heryen worde in þe, Lord; ichMS. ich ich. hopede in þe, God; y shal nouȝt drede, what man doþ to me.Y] Lord y.
Ha God, þy desires benMS. len? in me, for which y shal ȝelde to þe heryynges.—Ha: beþ: schald.

For þou deliuered my soule fram helle and myn fete fram slydynge, þat ich plese to-fore God in þe lyȝt of hemMS. repeats þat ich plese to-fore god in þe lyȝt of hem. þat ben saued.helle] þe deþ of hell.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 55, MS.PSALM 56 (57).
DIV2.P: Haue mercy on me, God, haue mercy on me; for my soule affieþ in þe.Lord: trusteþ.
And ich shal hope in þe myȝt of þy grace, þer-whiles þat my wickednesses passe.wykkydnes.
Y shal crye to þe God alderheȝest, to God þat did wele to me.Godd hiest: well.
He sent his sone fram heuen, and deliuered me out of helle, and ȝafBefore ȝaf the MS. has ha, which has been struck out. in reproceinge þe defouland me.into reproue men defoilyng.
God sent fram heuen his mercy and his soþenes, and deliuered my soule fram sharpnes of tourmentes of fendes; and ich dwelled trubled.sturblyd.
Mennes sones han her werkes hard and sharp, and her tungesAfter tunges a superfluous and follows. benHere hard is expuncted. sharp swerdes.Men: tunges—and.
Be þou, God, anheȝed vp þe heuens, and þi glorie inMS. and. alle erþe.enhyed vp—þe: ioie in all þe erþe.
Mennes sones diȝten gnares to myn fete, and tempted my soule.Men sonnes dyȝtyd grynnes.
Hij daluen a diche to fore my face, and fellen hem seluen þer-inne.delue.
Myn hert ys diȝt to þe, God, myn hert is diȝt; and y shal synge, and sai a salme.
Þou my glorie, arise þou; sautriei added over line. and harpe, arise; y shal aryse in þe morwenynge.ioie: sauter.
Y shal schryue to þe, Lord, in folkes, and saie to þe a songe in men.in men] among folkes.
For þy mercy his heried vn-to þe heuens, and þy soþenes vn to þe cloudes.heried] made grete: vnto— þe.
Be þou, God, anheȝed up þe heuens, and þy glorye in al erþe.vp heuens: ioie vp.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 56, MS.PSALM 57 (58).
DIV2.P: Ȝyf ȝe speke in alle þyngesy on erasure. ryȝt, ȝe mennes sones, iugyȝt ryȝtfullich.For-soþe ȝyf ȝe speke riȝt|lych in all þ.: mensonnes demeþ.
For ȝe wirchen wickednesses in our hertes in erþe; ȝour hondes wirchen vnryȝtfulnes.wickydnes: our] ȝour: erþe+ &.
Þe synȝers ben aliened fer fram þe wombe; hij erreden fram þe wombe; hij spoken fals þynges.2. wombe+&.
Her wirship is efter þe wickednes of þe serpent, as of aspide def and stoppand his eren.wirsh.] wodeschip: wickedn] likenes: as . . . st.] & of þe defe aspyde stoppyng: eres.
Þe which ne shal nouȝt here þe voice of þe charmeand, and of þe makand uenym charmeand wiselich.—ne: þe venum maker.
God shal de-foulen her teþe in her mouþe; our Lord shal breke þe uttemast iuels of þe wicked.ottermast.
Hij shul by-comen noȝt as water ernand; our Lord shal shewe his myȝt, þerwyles þat hij ben madeAfter made an n is erased. vnstable.v on erasure.ȝernyng: þerwyles] to.
Þe wicked shul ben wasted as wax þat melteþ; þe wreche of God fol vp her werkes, and hij ne seiȝ noȝt her saueour. fell: —ne.
Er þat ȝour synnes vnderstonde þe dampnacioun euerlastand, þe fur of vices shal deuoren hem as liueand in ire.Or: þe] ȝour.
Þe ryȝt-ful shal gladen whan he seþ þe vengeaunce, and he shal wasshen his hondes in þe blode of þe synȝer.
And man shal saie for-soþe, Ȝyf frute be to þe ryȝtful, for-soþe God is iugeand hem in erþe.demyng.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 57, MS.PSALM 58 (59).
DIV2.P: Ha my God, defende me fram myn enemis, and deliuere me fram þe ariseand oȝains me.—Ha: defende] deliuer: þe] men.
Defende me fram wirchaund wickednes, and saue me fram men defouled wiþ dedelich sinnes.þe] men: men . . . sinnes] syn|ful men.
Se, for hij token my soule; þe stronge fel oȝains me.Lo: soule+&.
Ne my wickednes, Lord, ne my sinne; ichHere ram is expuncted. ran wiþ-outen wickednes, and dresced þis worde.Ne] Noþer: ne] no: synne+bot: ȝerne.
Aryse, Lord, in myn oȝain-erning, and se; and þou, Lord, art God of uertuȝ, God of Israel.in-to my course.
Ȝif entent to uisiten al folkes; ne haue þou nouȝt mercy on alle þat wirchen wickednes.visytyng: ne] &.
Hii shul ben turned at euen, and shul suffren hunger as hundes; and hij shul cumpassen þe cite.atte: go abowte.
Se, hij shul speken in her mouþe, and sharpnes of wordes his in her lippes; and hij shul saien, Who herd it?
And þou, Lord, shalt scornen hem, and þou shalt bringe to nouȝt alle folkes.
Y shal kepe to þe myn strengþes, for God is my taker, my God; his mercy shal come to-fore me.
God shewed miȝt to me vp myn enemys; Lord, ne sleMS. she. hem nouȝt, þat þe folk ne forȝete me nouȝt.—ne: sle: —ne.
De-part hem in þy uertu; and þou, God, my defendour, do hem oway fram yuel.
For þe trespas of her mouþe and þe worde of her lippes ben þe wyckedMS. kycked. taken in her pride.lippes] mouþe: wykkyd takyng.
And of her waryinge and of her lesyng hij shul ben shewed in her endyng.werying.
And hij ne shul nouȝt ben saued in þe ire of endeing; & wyten hij þat God shal lordship Iacob sones and þe cuntres of þerþe.—ne: lordship . . . and] haue lordeschipe of I. sonnes & of.
Hij shul ben departed at euen, and hij shul suffren hunger as hundes, and hij shul gon a-boute þe cite.atte.
For-soþe y shal syngen þy strengþe, Lord, and erliche heȝen in þy mercy.enhyȝe—in.
For þou art made my taker and my socour in daiMS. sai (with a long s). of my tribulacioun.day.
Ha my helper, y shal synge to þe, for þat þou, God, art my taker, my God, my mercy.O: my Godd+&.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 58, MS.PSALM 59 (60).
DIV2.P: Ha God, þou hast put us oway fram þe, and þou hast destriued us; þou art wroþ, and þou haddest pite of us. —Ha: destruyd: on.
Þou stired þerþe, and trubled it; hel þeMS. helþe. contriciouns of it, for it is stired.trubled] sturbled: hele þe: mouyd.
Þou shew[ed]est hard þynges to þy folk for synne, and þouHere ha has been expuncted. ȝaf us a drink of þe biternes of prikkyng.shewed: pr.] compunccion.
Þou hafi.e. ȝaf. tokenyng of wisdom to hem þat dreden þe, þat hij shuld fle fram þe corrupcioun of synne.haf . . . shuld] ȝaf to men dred|yng þe holynes of wysdome þat þay drede þe & þat þay.
Þat þyn loued ben deliuered fram iuel, make me sauf for þy ryȝthalf, and here me.with þi riȝt honde.
God spak in his halwe, Y shal delyten, and y shal departen drie|hede, and y shal meten þe ualaie of tabernacles.in] by: drynes.
Galaad ys myn, and Manasses is myn, and Effraim is þe strengþe of myn heued.M.—is.
Judas ys myn kynde, Moab is þe enterete of myn hope.MS. hopie, of which the i is dotted out.kyng+&: e.]holenes.
Y shal shewe my vengeaunce in Ydume; strange be subiectes to me.straungers beþ sugettes.
Who shal lade me in-to a cite warnist, who shal lade me in-to Ydume?warn.] ywarnyd &.
Nouȝt þou, God, þat put us away fram þe fende, þou, God, ne shal nouȝt gon out in our vertuȝ?Nouȝt] Wheþer noȝt: —ne.
Ȝyf us, Lord, helpe of tribulacioun, for helþe of man is ydel.mannes helþe is vayne.
We shul do uertu in God, and he shal brynge to nouȝt þe trubland vs.þe trubl.] men sturbelyng.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 59, MS.PSALM 60 (61).
DIV2.P: Here, God, my praier, and understounde myn oryson.understonde+to.
Ich cried to þe fram þe cuntres of þerþe, þerwhiles þat myn hert was anoied; þou heȝedest me in stablenes.þerwhiles þat] to: & þou hydest.
Þou laddest me out, for þou art made myn hope; þou art tour of stre[n]gþe fram þe face of þeHere an n has been expuncted. enemy.hope+&: strengþe.
Y shal wonen in þy tabernacle in þe worldes; y shal be defended in þe couering of þy mercyes.2. shal] scha (!).
For þou, my God, herdest myn oreison; þou ȝaf heritage to þe dredand þy name.orysun+&: þe] men.
Þou shal casten dayes up þe daies up þe kynge, and his ȝeress corrected from g. vn-to þe daye of kynde & kynde.of þe kyng: into.
He woneþ wyþ-outen ende in þe syȝt of God; who shal sechen his mercy and hys soþenes?
Y shal saye þus a songe to þy name in þe world ofHere follows wol, which however is expuncted. world, þat ich ȝelde [myn] a-vowes fram daie to daie.þus a] so: ȝelde+myn.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 61 (62).
DIV2.P: Ne shal nouȝt my soule be vnder-lout to God? for in hym hys myn helþe.— Ne: vnderl.] suget.
For he ys my God and myn helþe & my taker; y ne shal no more dreden.— ne: drede no more.
Þer-whyles þat ȝe fallen into holy chyrche, ȝe al sle þe in-nocent liggand to hym, as to a wal þat þe morter [is] putt out.To-whyls: into] aȝens man or: a+bied: morter is put away.
Þe wicked for-soþe þouȝten to putt oway my god dede, and ich vnderstode her pryuetes; hij blisced me wyþ her mouþe, and waried me wyþ her hert.F. s. þe w.: her p. ych vnder|stode: cursyd.
Ha þou my soule, be þou subiecte for-soþe to God, for of hym ys my suffraunce.O: suget — for soþe.
For þat he is my God, my saueour, myn helper, y ne shal nouȝt passen out of his comaundement.sauyour+&: —ne.
Myn helþe is in God and my glorie; God ys þe wille of myn helpe; and myn hope is in God.ioie.
Ha, hei.e. ȝe. alle assemble of folk, hopeþ in hym, heldeþ out to-forn hym your hertes; God ys our helper wyþ-outen ende.Ha he] ȝe: congregacion of pepyll: heldeþ] schedeþ.
For-soþe mennes sones ben idel, mennes sones ben liȝers in balaunces, þat hij deceiuen of idelnes in þat ich þynge.men: men: balance: de|sayue: —ich.
Ne wyl ȝe nouȝt hopen in wickednes, and ne wil ȝe nouȝt couaite rauyns; ȝyf riches flowe to you, ne wil ye nouȝt sett your hert to hem.— Ne: ne wil . . . rauyns] couayte ȝe noȝt raueynes: — ne.
God spak o-nes to þynges, ich herd hem, for þat þe myȝt of God is; and, Lord, to þe is mercy, for þou shalt ȝelde to ichon efter his werkes.ons þise two þinges.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 62 (63).
DIV2.P: Ha God, my God, ich wake to þe of lyȝt.O: fram.
My soule coueitedMS. couerted. to be wyþ þe, and my flesshe to þe ful many-fold.couayteþ.
In wylde lond and out of way ani.e. and. drye in swyche manere, ich shewed me to þe [in] holy þynge, þat ich seiȝe þy vertu and þy glorie.an . . . . manere] & dry þus: þe+in: ioie.
For þy mercy is better vp lybbeinges; myn lippes shul heryen þe.lyues.
Se, y shal blisce þe in my lyf; and in þy nameHere follows an erasure of three letters. y shal lift up myn hondes.
Be my soule fulfyld as of flour and of grece; and my mouþe shal heryen þe [wyþ] lippes of gladnes.As myne s. is f. with fatnes & plenteusnes—and: þe+with.
So was ich þenchand on þe up my bedde, y shal þenche on þe in þe morwenyng; for þat þou was myn helper.beþencher of.
And y shal gladen in þe coue[r]ing of þy mercies, my soule haþ drawen efter þe; þy ryȝt syde toke me.coueryng: dr.] drow: syde] honde.

For-soþe þe wicked tempted my soule in vayn, and hij shul entren in-to þe deppest of þe erþe; so hij shul be ȝeuen in-to sharpenes of vengeaunce, soHere follows an h, which has been dotted out. shal hij ben att þe parties of fendes.tempyd (!): ȝefe into+þe.
Þe kynge for-soþe shal ioien in God, alle þat hopen in hym shul ben heried; for þe mouþe of þe spekand wicked þynges ys stopped.F. s. þe k.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 61, MS.PSALM 63 (64).
DIV2.P: Here, God, my praier, whan ich praie; defende my soule fram þe drede of þe enemy.praye+&.
Þou defendest me fram þe felawe-shippe of þe wicked, fram þe multitude of þe wirchand wickednes.defendid: feleschyp: wickyd+&.
For hij whetted her tunges as swerde; so hij maden her manaces þyng bytter, þat hij turmenten þe vnwemmed in hidels.manes a bytter þing: þe vnfiled man in priuetes.
Hij shul turmenten hym sudeinlich,MS. sudenilich. hij shul nouȝt dredenhij shul nouȝt dreden twice in MS.; hij fastened to hem iuel worde of me.sudanlych.
Hij telden þat hij hidden falsnisses, and saiden, Who shal sen hem?grynnes or falsnes &+þay.
Hij soȝten wickednisses; þe sechand faileden in her secheyng.MS. sechenyng.sechenyng] secheyng.
Þe man ryȝtful shal neȝen to holi hert, and God shal ben heȝed.r. man: cum to+an: enhied.
Þe turmentes of þe wicked ben made her deþ, and her tunges ben made vnstable oȝains hem.MS. me.me] hem.
Alle gode men þat sehenProbably only a blunder instead of seȝen. hem in her malices, weren trubled; and ich man drad hem.seȝg: malesses: sturbled.
Þe gode telden þe werkes of God, and vnderstonden hishis is followed by an h, which is expuncted. dedes.gode+men: vnderstode.
Þe ryȝtful shal gladen in our Lord, and he shal hopen in hym; and al ryȝtful of hert shul ben heried.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 64Ps. 62, MS. (65).
DIV2.P: Ha God, heryyng by-comeþ þe in Syon; and to þe shal boweBlunder for vowe. be ȝolden in Jerusalem.O: be-semeþ: vow: ȝeld.
Here my praier; icha flesshe schal come to þe.Here+Godd: ych mannes kynde.
Þe wordes of þe wicked vailed more vp vs; and þou shal be mercy|ful to our wickednesses.wykkydnes.
Blisced be þeþ on erasure. man þat þou ches and toke; he shal wonen in þyn hallis.
We shul be fulfild of þe godes of þyn hous; and þiMS. þe. temple ys holy, wonderful in euennesse.þi t.
Ha God, our helþe, hereMS. hele. us; þou art hope of alle þe cuntres of þerþe and fer in þe see;O: helþe] heþ (!): hele] here.
Makand redy þe mounteins in þy vertu, girt wyþ myȝt; þat trubleþ þe depnes of þe see, þe soune of hys flodes.gyrd: sturbleþ.
Alle þe men þa[t] wonen in cuntres, shul ben trubled, and shul dreden of þyne toknes of þe out-going of morwen; and þou shalt deliten in þe euenyng.þa] þat: sturbled: tokenes—of: of þe+þe.
Þou uysited þerþe, and made it fayre, and multiplied, for to make it ryche.viset: made—it.
Þe flude of God ys fulfild of waters; þou, God, made radi her ernyng for so ys his makyng rady.ȝernyng.
Fylland hys ryuers,MS. ryueils. multiplie þou his buryon; he shal delyten in hys guters ekand.ryuers: burgunnynges+&: encresyng.
Þou shalt blisce to þe time of þe ȝere of þy de-bonairte; and þy feldes shul be fulfild of plente.blys—to: —of þy: de|bonourte.
Fair þynges of þe wyldernes shal by-comen fat, and þe woniand in þe mounteins shul ben fulfild of ioie.þe won.] men dwellyng: hylles.

Þe rammesMS. raynes. [of shepe ben cloþed wyþ flese, & þe valeys shul] waxen ful wyþ wheten; folk shul crien and saien heriyng for ioye.þe . . . wheten] þe rammes of schepe beþ cloþd with flese & þe valeys schall wex full of whete.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 63, MS.PSALM 65 (66).
DIV2.P: Ha alle þe londe, ioie to God, and saie songe to his name; ȝyf glorie to hisGod . . . glorie to his twice in MS. heryynge.Ha . . . ioie] All ȝe men in þe world ioie ȝe: saiþ: ȝeuyþ ioie.
Saiþ to God, Ha Lord, what þyn werkesMS. wer werkes. ben dredeful; þyn enemys shul liȝen to þe in þe multitude of þy uertu.Say: o.
Alle þerþe anoure þe, God, and synge to þe, and saie songe to þy name. anoureþ—þe.
Comeþ and seþ þe werkes of God dredeful in counseiles vp mennes sones;seþ] sayþ.
Þat turneþ þe see in dryhede: hij shul passen þe flode on fote; þer shal we glade in hym.into drynes.

Þat lord-shipeþ [wiþ-]outen ende in his vertu: his eȝen loken vp men; hij þat madeHere men follows, which is dotted out. hem asper, ne be nouȝt heȝed in hem-seluen.þat lordsh.] He þat lordschipeþ with: scharp: —ne: enhied.
Ȝe folk, blisceþ ȝour God, and makeþ þe voice of his praiere herd;
Þat sett my soule to lif and ne ȝaf nouȝt my fete in styryng.—ne: into steryng.
For þou, God, proued us; þou assaid us wyþ fur as siluer is proued.proued us+&: is assayd.
Þou laddest us in-to a gnare, and laidest tribulacions on our rygge, and settest men vp our heuedes.gryn.
We passed by fur and water, and þou laddest us into coleyng.MS. toleyng.refreschyng.
Y shal entren in-to þyn hous in offrendes, and y ne shal ȝelde to þe myn avowes,MS. abowes. þat myn lippes distincted to þe.offerynges: —ne: auowes: distinkt.
And my mouþe spak in my tribula cioun.
Y shal offren to þe merȝþ offrendes wyþ encensMS. entens. of shepe, and y shal offren to þe oxen wyþ kyddes.offrie: merȝþ] þe best: offerynges: incense: offrye.
Ȝe alle þat drede God, comeþ and hereþ; and y shal tellen ȝou hou many godes he did to my soule.—God.
Ich cried to him wyþ my mouþe, and y gladed vnder my tunge.ioied.
Ȝyf ich seiȝ wickednes in myn hert, our Lord ne shal nouȝt here me.se: —ne.
For-þy God herd me, and vnderstode þe voice of my praier.þer-for.
Blisced be God, þat ne did nouȝt oway myn orysoun ne hys mercy fram me.—ne: ne] no.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 64, MS.PSALM 66 (67).
DIV2.P: God haue mercy on vs, and blisce vs, and lyȝt hys face vp us, and haue mercy on vs;alyȝt.
Þat we knowe þy waie in erþe, by þyn helþe in alle men.by] & be: among.
Shryue to þe, God, þe folk; shryue to þe alle folk.Godd, be þe f. schryfe to þe, & all f. be schryfe to þe.
Deliten þe folk and gladen; for þou iugeþ þe folk inHere follows he, which is expuncted. euenhede, and dresceþ þe folk in erþe.Glade: ioie: demest: euen|hode.
Shryuen, God, þe folk to þe, shryuen to þe alle folkes; þerþe ȝaf hys frut þurȝ hys grace.Godde schryue þe folk to þe, & all folk Godd schryue to þe: þurȝth þi.
God, our Lord, blisce ous; blisce vs, God, and dreden hym alle þe cuntres of þerþe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 65, MS.PSALM 67 (68).
DIV2.P: Arise, God, and be hys enemys wasted; and flen hij þat hated him fram his face.flye: hateþ.
De-failen hii, as smoke faileþ; as wex melteþMS. meltel. fram þe face of þe fur, ryȝt so perissen þe synȝers fram þe face of God.as smoke faileþ] a smeke (!) fayleþ &: melteþ.
And eten þe ritful þe frutes of lyf, and gladen hij in þe siȝt of God, and delyten hij in gladnes.frute: delyten] ioie.
Syngeþ to God, and says a MS. and. songe to hys name; makeþ way to hym þat steȝe vp þe doungoing of þe sunne; Lord hys his name.says and s.] sayþ a songe: stieþ.
Gladeþ ȝou in hys syȝt; hij þat iugen þe innocens shul ben put oway fram þe face of hym, fader of faderles and iuge of widues.demeþ: faderles+chyldren: of þe wedous.
God is in hys holy heuen, God þat doþ þe gode wonen on hysThis is a corrupt form of the genitive onis. custum in hys hous;on hys] of on.
Þat ladeþ out þe bonden in strengþe, also hem þat stenchen, which þat wonien in biriels.in] with: —which: woneþ.
Ha God, as touMS. astou. went out in þe syȝt of þy folk, as touMS. astou. passed in sharpnesses of peines,O: hastow: astow: scharp|nes.
Þe erþe hys styred; for þe heuens dropped þurȝ þe grace of þe face of þeþe added over line. God of Synay, of þe face of God of Israel.—face: Synay+and.
Ha God, þou shalt depart wilful raine to þerþe, and it is made vnstable; þou for-soþe madest it.O: for-soþe þou made.
Þyn bestes shul wonen þer-in; ha God, þou madest rady to þe pouer in swetnes nedful þynges.—ha.
Our Lord shal ȝeuen worde to hem þat tellen forþe þe gospeles þourȝ mychel vertu.
Ha kyng of vertu of loued of loued, of þe grace of þyn hous to departen þe spuyles.O: þe grace] faire grace: forto: spoles.

Ȝyf þat ȝe liuenMS. finen. bitwix þe lawes of þe olde testament and þe new, þe wil of þe [olde is] seluered, þat his to saie fainteliche made; bot þe lawe of þe last testament, þat hys, þe nywe, ben in palenes of gold, þat hys to saye, ben att þe wyl of God.lyf be-twene: seluered] olde Godd is syluerd: pallour.
Þer-whiles þat þe fader of heuen iuge vp þat lawe, þe folk kepand her soules shul ben made whyte as snowe in þe heuen, þat hys, GoddesMS. gogged. hous ful of ioies.þat lawe] þe law: Goddes hous+hous.
Þe heuen ys ful of ioyes, þe heuen ys plentiuous; ha ȝe folk, where|to loke ȝe in-to þe heuens ful of ioies?plentiful: o.
Þe heuen in which it is wele likeand to God to wonen in it; for our Lord shal whonen þer wyþ-outen ende.heue (!).

Þe wonyng of God hys .x. þousand multipliand þousandes of gladand; our Lord ys in Here hys follows, which, however, has been dotted out. hem in hys trone and in hys holy wonynge.The loop at the g has been erased and an e written instead.
Þou, Lucifer, steȝe on heȝe, and toke wrechedhede in fallyng into helle; þou toke vp-braydynges of men.styed: wrechedhode: hell+&: reproues.
For hi, þat bi-leued nouȝt in God, our Lord, ne woned nouȝt þer.our] hour: —ne.
Blisced be our Lord in þys daye; ich daie þe Lord of our helþes shal maky vs prospre waye.ich] & ech: make vs a gode way.
God ys our God to make us sauf; and þe passion of þe deþ of our Lord ys of our Lord.to make] of makyng.
God for-soþe shal breken þe pouste of hys enemys and þe strengþe of þe fairhede of þe goand in her trespasses.ss on erasure.pouer: enenemys (!): fayrenes: þe] men: trespas.
Our Lord seide to þe folk of Basan, Y shal turnen þe, y shal turnen þe into þe vengeaunce of slaȝter,
Þat þy fote be dipped in blode, and þe tunge of þyn houndes be dipped of it as þyn enemys.of it as] þer-of as of.
Ha God, men seȝe þyn dedes, hij seȝen þe dedes of my God, my kyng, þat his in holy heuen.O: seȝe] se.
Þe princes ioient com to-fore to þe syngandMS. synigand. amiddes ȝounlinges tabores.ioynyd: syngyng: ȝong|lynges tabouresters.
Ȝe men, blisceþ God in chirches, to our Lord of þe mercy of hys folk of Israel.
Þer hys Beniamyn, þe ȝong man, in passyng of þouȝt.
Þe princes of Iudaof iuda of juda in MS. ben her ladres, þe princes of Zabulon and þe princes of Neptalym were þer.leders: Nyptalym.

Ha God, sende grace to þy vertu, and conferme þys þynge, þat tou wirches in vs; þat hys to wyten, þatMS. þan. tou be born þat we may be sauydMS. said. þurȝ þe.O: confirme: wychest (!): þan] þat: said] sauyd.
In þy temple of Ierusalem shal kynges offren to þe ȝyftes.

A gaderyng to-gidres of stable folk, þat ben in þe law of our Lord, blameþ þe sacrifice of ydolatries, þat hij þat ben of ryȝt byleue shete out of her cumpainie hem þat maken maum-metries.shete] put: cumpany: mau|metries.

Ha God, waste þe folk þat wyl batails;MS. latails. legats shul cumen out of Egipte sleand þe Echiopenes; Echiepeienes shul fallen in seruage vnder þe Egipciens for her synne.O: batayles: Ethiopenes Ethiopenes.
Ha ȝe folk of kyngdomes of erþe, syngeþ to God, syngeþ to our Lord.O.
Syngeþ to God, syngeþ; þat steȝe vp heuen of heuen at þe est.—2. syngeþ: styeþ: atte est.
Se, he shal ȝeue to hys voice voice of vertu; ȝeueþ glorie to God vp Israel; hys heryng and hys vertu ys vp þe cloudes.ioie: herying.
God is wonde-ful (!) in hys halwen, þe God of Israel; he shal heueInstead of ȝeue. vertu and strengþe to hys folk; blisced be God.wonderful: ȝeue.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 66, MS.PSALM 68 (69).
DIV2.P: Ha God, mak me sauf; for temptaciouns entred vn-to my soule.O: —me.
Ich am ficched in þe gnare of synȝe, and substaunce nis nouȝt.fest: grynn: is.
Ich come to riches of þe world, and cuuaitisMS. ciruaitis. ablynt me.couatice ablent.
Ich trauailed criand, my chekesMS. cheked. ben made wery, myn eȝen failed, þer-whiles þat ich hoped in my God.chekes: —þat: hepid (!).
Hij þat hated me wyþ wylle ben multiplied oȝains myn heued.w.w.] wylfullych: beþ+beþ: mult.+aboue þe heres of myn heued or.
Myn enemys þat pursued me wrongfullich ben conforted; ich ȝelde hem þan þeMS. þe þe. þynges þat ich ne bi-namMS. nebi nam. hem nouȝt.þe þe] in: —ne.
Ha God, þou wost myn vnconandnes, and my trespasses ne ben nouȝt hid fram me.O: wote: vncunnyng: —ne.
Lord, ne ben hij nouȝt aschamed in me þat abiden þe, Lord of vertuȝ.—ne: habydeþ.
Lord, God of Israel, hij þat sechen þe ne be nouȝt counfounded vp me.— þe ne.
For ich suffred for þe reproces, confucioun couerd my face.reproues+&: confusion.
Ich am made strange to my breþer and pilgrime to þe childer of my moder.broþerin: chyldren.
For þe loue of þyn hous susteined me, and þe reprucesThere is a horizontal stroke through the lower part of the p. of þe repruceand þe fellen vp me.reproues of men reprouyng.
And ich fasted for þe helþe of my soule, and þat hys made to meMS. come. in reproceing þurȝ mani.Andich . . . soule] & ych helyd my soule with fastyng: come] to me: reproue per (!).
And ich made þe haire my cloþyng, and ich am made to hem into p[ar]ables.here: parables.
And þe pouer þat were in her pouerte spaken oȝains me; and þe riche þat diden her glotenie maden o me fables.MS. fabled.pouert: of me fables.
For-soþe, Lord God, ich helded my praier in þe time of þyMS. my. quemeing.put oute m. pr.+to þe: þi quememyng(!).
Here me for þefor þe repeated in MS. michelnes of þy mercy and þe soþenesþ on erasure. of þyn helþe.gretenes.
Defende me fram synȝe, þat y ne be nouȝt fastened þer-in; deliuer me fram hem þat hated me, and fram þe temptaciouns of fondes (!).—ne: of þe fendes.

Þe pines of helle ne turment me nouȝt; ne depenesSecond e added over line. ne dou-oure me nouȝt; ne þe fende ne destreingne nouȝt on me his mouþe.paynes: —ne: me . . . do|uoure]: noȝt me no þe depnes deuour: no: ne destreingne nouȝt] distrue me noȝt or constreyne.
Here me, Lord, for blisful ys þy mercy; loke to me efter þe mychilnes of þy pytes.mekefull.
And ne turne nouȝto corrected from a. þy face fram þy childe; here me hastilich, for ich am trubled.—ne: —nouȝt: sturbled.
Ȝyf kepe to my soule, and deliuer it of synȝe, and defende me oȝain myn ene-mys.aȝens.
Þou wost my reproceyng and my confisioun (!) and my shame.MS. shante.wote: reprouyng: confusion: schame.
Alle þat trublen me, ben in þy syȝt; my hert abode reproce and me-sayes.sturbleþ: reproues: mysays.
And ich susteined reproces þat were made sori; and he nas nouȝt, and hyMS. hene. ne fond nouȝt hym þat conforted hym.reproues: was: hene ne] y: conforte me.
And þe wicked ȝauen to me iuel for gode, and in my nede hij com|passed me wyþ reproceynges.enclosed: reproues.
Be her malice made in dampnacion to-fore hem, and in ȝeldyng andHere a y follows in the MS., which spoils the sense. in sclaunder.—y.
Ben her eȝenHere make has been dotted out. made derke, þat hij ne seiȝ nouȝt, and her rigge alwaies into croked þynges.—ne: se: in crokednes.
Helde vp hem þyn yre, and þe vengeaunceMS ven vengeaunce. of þyne yre take hem.Schede.
Be her wonyng made wylde; and þer ben non þat wone in her tabernacle.be þer: tabernacles.
For hi pursuden hym þat tou smote, and hij laiden sorow up sorow of hys woundes.þat] &.
Sett wikkednes vp her wickednes, þat hij ne entren nouȝt in-to þy ryȝtfulnes.—ne.
Ben hij don out of þe boke of liueand, and ben hij nouȝt wryten wyþ þe ryȝtful.ryȝtf.+men.
Ich am pouer and sorowand; ha God, þyn helþe toke me.—ha.
Y shal hery þe name of God wyþ songe; and y shal heryen hym wiþ heryyng.
And þat þyng shal plesen to God vp sacrifice of a ȝonge chalf bryngand out hornes and clees.
Sen þe pouer and gladen; secheþþ on erasure. our Lord, and our soule shal liuen.glade+þay: seche: ȝour.
For our Lord herd þe pouer, and he despised nouȝt þe cheson.chosyn.
Hereen hym þe heuens and erþe, þe see and alle þynges crepand in hem.Heryeþ: —þe: —þe.
For God shal make sauf þe folk of Syon, and þe seges of heuen shul ben fulfild.þe seges] setes.
And hij shul wonen þer, and hij shul purchasen it in heritage.gete it by h.
And þe sede of his seruauntes shal haue it; and hij þat louen his name shal wonen þer-inne.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 67, MS.PSALM 69 (70).
DIV2.P: Ȝeue kepe, God, to my helpe, and haste þe, Lord, to helpe me.Godd take kepe.
Hij þat tempten my soule ben to-gidres confounded and asshamed.tempe (!): conf. to-gyders.
Hij þat willen [me] iuels ben turned oȝainward, and ben asshamed.wyll me euyll: be þay asch.
Hij þat sayen to me, Sorow! sorow! ben hij turned by-hynde ryggeMS. rynge. and asshamed as sone.byhynde..sone] bacheward & a. on one.
Hij þat sechen þe, gladeMS. gladen, the n, however, being expuncted. and [in] þe ioie; and sayen hij alway þat louen þyn helþe, Be our Lord heried.& —[in] þe.
Ich am for-soþe nedeful and pouer; Lord, helpe þou me. F. s. ych: hepe (!).
Þou art min help and my delyuerour; Lord, neMS. me. dwelle þou nouȝt.delyuerer: —me.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 68, MS.PSALM 70 (71).
DIV2.P: Lord, ich hoped in þe; ne be y nouȝt confounded wyþ-outen ende; deliuer me, and defende me fram iuel in þy ryȝtfulnes.—ne.
Bowe to me þyn ere, and saue me.saue—me.
Be þou to me defendour in God and in stede warnist, þat tou make me sauf.
For þou art made my fastenynge and my socour.—made: fastnes: refute.
Ha my God, defende me fram þe honde of þe synȝer, and fram þe honde doand oȝains þe lawe, and of þe wicked.O: honde doand oȝ. þe] doyng aȝens þi (!).
For, Lord, þou art my paciencie(!), and þou art, Lord, myn hope fram myn ȝouþe.paciens.
In þe ich am confermed of þe wombe, and þou art my defendour.confirmyd: wombe+of my moder wombe.
My songe isis added over line. euer in þe; ich am made wonder to many; and þou art stronge helper.art+a. 9. herying: ioie.
Be my mouþe fulfild of hereyng, þat ich synge alday þy glorie and þy gretnes.
Ne cast me nouȝt oway in time of elde, and ne forsake me nouȝt, whan my uertu failleþ.—Ne: age: —ne.
For myn enemys saiden to me, and hij þat kept my soule made conseil in on;hij þat] þat (added over line) þai.
Saiand, God haþ for-saken hym; pursueþ him, and takeþ hym, for þer nys non þat defendeþ hym.forsake hym+þat: is.
Ne be þou nouȝt, God, fer fram me; ha my God, loke into mynMS. twice God fer . . . myn. helpe.—Ne: —ha.
Ben þe bacbitand my soule confunded, and failenMS. fainlen. hij; ben hij couerd wyþ confusyon and shame, þat sechen iuel to me.fayle: euyls.
Ich for-soþe shal hope in þe, and y shal grant to þe my uoice vp alle þyne heryyng.F. s. y.
My mouþe shalle shewe þy ryȝtfulnes, and ich daie þyn helþe.scwe (!).
For ich ne knew no lettrure; y shal entren in-to þe myȝttes of our Lord; ha Lord, y shal þenchen of þyn onliche riȝtfulnes.—ne: þi myȝtes: —ha lord: on.
God, þou tauȝtest me fram my ȝouþe, and vnto now y shal tellen forþ þy wonders.w.+& (!).
And vnto vlde and elde, God, ne forsakea corrected from o. þou me nouȝt,age & age: —ne.
Þer-whiles þat ich telle þyn helpe to ich a kynde þat hys to comen.ic ha] ech.
Ha, God, þou shewest þy myȝt and þy ryȝtfulnes vn-to þe heȝest þynges, þat tou madest grete and wonderful; ha, God, who his liche to þe?O: shewyd: —ha.
Hou many tribulaciouns, many and wicked, shewedestou to me? and þou turned quiked me; and þou laddest me eft fram þe dep-nes of þerþe.schewstow: eft] eftson.
Þou multiplied þyn heryynge, and þou turned conforted me.
For y shal shryue to þe in wordes of songe þyn soþenes; ha God, y shal syngen to þe in harp, þou art þe holi of Israel.—ha.
My lippus shul gladen whan ich haua (!) songen to þe, and al-so my soule, þat tou bouȝt oȝain.haue: —oȝain.
Bote my tunge shal þenchen alday þy riȝtfulnes, as hij, þat sechen me withMS. wich. iuel, han ben counfounded and asshamed.wich] with.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 69, MS.PSALM 71 (72).
DIV2.P: Ha God, ȝyf þoMS. þou, the u being expuncted with two dots. þy iugement to þe kyng and þy riȝtfulnes to þe kynges sone,—Ha: þou: dome.
To iuge þe folk in ryȝtfulnes and þe rebels to þe [in] iugement.deme: rebell to þe in dome.
Take þe gode pees to folk and þe [ryȝtful] ryȝtfulnes.& þe+riȝtful.
He shal iugen þe rebels of þe folk, and shal make sauf þe gode childer of þe rebels, and he shal meken þe fals chalangeours. deme: chalagours (!).
And þe ryȝtful shul dwellen wyþ God and to-fore his trone in kyndes of kyndes.in kynde.
He shal descenden as rain into floes and as droppinges droppand on þerþe.into a flees: dropes droppyng.
Ryȝtfulnes and waxing of pees shal arisen, to þat þe soule of Crist be don oway fram hys body.plenteousnes: —oway: hys] þe.
And he shal lord-ship fram þe see [to þe see], and fram þe flode vnto þe termes of þe world.haue lordeschip: se+to þe se.
Þe EchiopesThe second e is added over the line. shul fallen to-for hym, and his enemis shul likken þerþe.Ethiopens.
Þe kynges of Thars and yles shal offren to hym ȝyftes; þe kynges of Arabum and of Saba shul bryngen to hym ȝyftos.Tarsis.
And alle kynges shal anouren hym, and alle men shul seruen hym.honour: seruy.
For þat he deliuered þe pouer fram yuel of þe myȝtful, and þe pouer, to wham nas no helper.—þat: fram+þe: was: helpe.
He shal spare þe pouer and þe mesais, and make sauf þe soules of þe pouer.misays.
He shal raunsoun her soules fram vsures and wickednes; and her name shal be worþshipful to-forn him.her] he: vsureres &+fram: worschypfull.
And he shal lyue, and hym shal bi ȝeuen of þe seruice of gode; and hij shul worþship hym alway þer-of and bliscen hym aldaye.be ȝif: wyrschyp.
Stablenes shal be in erþe amonge þe gode of þe world; þe frut of þe world shal wexen atte Goddes wille, and þe werkes of þe ryȝtful shul florissen in heuen as hay of þerþe.atte] at.
Be his name blisced in heuens; hys name shal lasten to-fore þe sunne.MS. sunme.dwel: sunne.
And alle þe kyndes of þe erþe shul ben blisced in hym, alle folk shul heryen hym.
Blisced be our Lord, God of Israel, þat doþ wondres al on-liche.
And be þeMS. þy. name of his maieste blisced wyþ-outen ende; and alle þerþe shal be fulfild of his maieste; be it don, be it don.þy] þe: fulf.] blyssyd.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 70, MS.PSALM 72 (73).
DIV2.P: Hou gode his þe God of Israel to hem þat ben ryȝtful of hert.—þe: —of Israel.
Myn fete for-soþe ben nere stired; myn ouȝtMS. my nouȝt.-goinges ben neȝe helded out.F. s. my f.: —nouȝt: neȝh sched out.
For ich loued þe vp wicked, seand pees of synȝers.
For abideing nis nouȝt inMS and. her deþ, and fastenyng nys nouȝt in her pines.is: 1. and] in: is: peynes.
Þe ryȝtful ne ben nouȝt in trauail of þe wicked, ne wyþ wicked men ne shul hij nouȝt ben turmented.—ne: no: ne . . hij] þay schal.
For-þy helde pride hem; and hij ben couerd wyþ her wickednes and vndebonerte.pride helde: vnbonerte.
Her wickednes ȝede forþe as of grees; hij shul be born in-to þe talent of her hertes.
Hij þouȝten and spake wyckednisses, and hij spak wickednesses on heȝt.wykkydnes: wykkydnes in heȝht.
Hij sett her mouþe to þe heuen, and her tunges passeden in herþe.—þe: tung past in erþe.
For-þy shul my folk be turned here, and ful daies shul be founden in hem.þer-for.
And þe wicked seiden, Hou is God, and ȝif wisdom be on heȝt?
Se þes synȝersy corrected from u.; and þe wexand in þe world hadden riches. incresyng: perchast.
And ich seide, For-þy ich made min hert ryȝtful wyþ-outen acheson, and ich wesshe myn hondes amonge þe vnwemmed.þer-fore: cause: innocentes.
And ich was turmented al daye, and my chastisynge was in þe morowening.chasteseyng: mornyng.
Ȝyf ich seid, Y shal tellen in þys maner, se, ich repruued þe in kynde of þyn chosen.in þ. m] þus: lo: reproued: —in.
Ich wende þat ich knewe hym in þat trauail is to-fore me,
Þer-whiles þat ich entre in-to þe sanctuari of God and vnder-stondeHere follows and, which is expuncted. in her endynges.þer-whiles] To: endynges] last endes.
For-soþe þou sett þe wicked for trecheries; þou cast hem oway, þer-wyles þat hij were anheȝed.MS. andheȝed, with the first d dotted out.gyles: —hem: to-whyls — þat: arered.
Hou ben hij made in desconforte? hij shul faillen sudeinliche, and shul perissen for her wickednes.into.
Lord, as sweuen of men risand oȝains þyn heuen, þou shalt bringen her ymage to nouȝt.Lor: dremyng.

For myn hert is enflamned, & myn kidnaresThe r differs in shape from either of the usual forms of that letter in the MS., and almost looks like an i with an accidental dot at the right side of the upper end. ben chaunged; and ich am b[r]ouȝt to noȝt, and ich ne wist it nouȝt.inflammyd: kydners: broȝt: —ne.
Ich am made atte as a mere wyþ-outen resoun, and ich am a[l]way wyþ þe.at þe: beste: alway.
Þou held my ryȝt honde, and þou laddest me in þy wille, and þou toke me wyþ glorie.ioie.
For wat þynge ys to me in heuen, and what wolde ich of þe up þerþe?—what.
My flesshe failed, and myn hert; þe Gode of myn hert, and my part hys wyþ God wyþ-outen ende.
For se, hii þat ben alloined þan fram þe shul perissen; þou lest alle þat don hordom wyþ-outen þe.lo: aloyned: loste: fornicacion.
For-soþe god þyn[g] it is to me to drawMS. toward. to God and sett myn hope in our Lord,gode—þyn it: toward] to draw.
Þat ich shewe alle þyn prechynges in þe passyng of þe soules of þe saued.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 73 (74).
DIV2.P: Whi, Lord, put þou us out on ende? þyn ire ys wroþe vp þe men of þe world?into þe ende.
Be þou by-þenchand of þy gaderyng, þat touHere follows hadd, which is however expuncted. hate-dest fram þe bygynnyng.hatedest] hadd.
Ha God of heuen, þou bouȝt oȝain þe synȝes of mannes kynde, in which heuen þou wonest in þat kynde.MS. kymde.O: kymde] kynde.
Lyftft on erasure. þyn hondes oȝain þe pride of þe wicked on ende; hou michel his þe weried enemy in holy þynge!into þe ende: wer.] wickyd: holynes.
And hij þat hated þe, gloried hem in-myddes of þy passion.—And: glorified: þy] þe.
Hij sett her toknes,toknes repeated in MS. and ne knewe hem nouȝt as in his passyng vp sweuen.—ne: dreme.
Hij forsoken hijs teching as þourȝ þe wickednes of her hertes in pride, and laid it vnder þourȝ mys-bileue.þurȝt: þurȝh+wickydnes & þurȝh.
Hij aliȝtediȝ corrected from u. at þe fur sanctuari, and defouleden in erþe þe tabernacle of þy name.fure+þe: defoiled.
Here kynreden seiden to-gidres in her hert, Make we resten in erþe alle þe solempne daies of God.kynrede.
We ne seȝe nouȝt our toknes, þer is nomore no prophete; and hij ne shul no more knowe vs?—ne: —ne.

Þyng toHere me follows, but has been expuncted. witen, God, þat þyn enemy shal reproce þe, þe aduersarie draw out þy name in-to ende. Godd, how longe schall þine e. reproue þe? þe adu. makeþ þin n. in vayne into þe e.
Where-to turnestou þyn honde and þy ryȝt-half in-to ende in-middes of þy bosome.MS. be some.riȝt honde into+þe: amiddes —of: bosum.
For-soþe our kyng hys to-fore þe werldes; he hashas is preceded by an a, which is how|ever expuncted. wroȝt helþe amiddes þerþe.
Þou confermed þyn halwen in þy uertu, and croused þe myȝt of fendes in peynes.conf. þ. h.] confirmyd þe world: of þe fende.
Þou to-brake þe pouste of þe fende, and ȝaf hym mete to þe folk of Ethiope.t corrected from c.þou brake: pouer.
Þou brake þe welles and þe brokes, and þou dried þe flodes of Echan.b.] reueres: Ethan.
Þe day ys þyn, and þe nyȝt ys þyn; þou forgedest þe dawyng and þe sunne.made þe mornyng.
Þou madest alle þe cuntres of þerþe, somer and veir; þou formedest þo þynges.made: vere: f. þo þ.] made þese.
Be þo þenchend on þysHere sy follows, but has been struck out. þynge; þe enemy reproued þe, our Lord, and þe folk vnwyse en-engred þy name.Be þou þencher of: en engred] engredyd.
Ne ȝyf nouȝt to þe fendes þe soules shryuand to þe, and ne for-ȝeteMS. fort ȝete. þou nouȝt into ende þe soules of þy pouer.—Ne: fendes—þe: know|legyng: —ne: forȝete—þou: into+þe: þe pouer+men.
Loke to þy testament, for þat hij þat ben cuuaytyse in erþe benHere follows tm (expuncted). fulfild of werkes of wickednes.for—þat: couatise: fullyd—of werkes.
Þe made mylde ne ben nouȝt turned confus; þe pouer and þe misais shul herien þy name.þe meke manMS. mand, d being dotted out. confused be noȝt t.
Arise, God, iuge my cause; be þou þenchand of þyn repruces of hem þat ben alday of þe vnwys.iuge] & deme: be þ. þ.] be|þenche: reproues.
Ne for-ȝete nouȝt þe werkes of þyn enemys; þe pride of hem þat hateþ þe, mounteþ euermore.—Ne: mounteþ] ascendit(!).

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 72, MS.PSALM 74 (75).
DIV2.P: Ha God, we shal shriue to þe; we shul shriue and clepe þy name.—Ha: clepe+in.
We shul tellen þy wondres; whan y shal take tyme, y shal iugen ryȝtfulnesses.deme riȝtfulnes.
Þe erþe his made melting, and al þat wonen in it; [y] confermed my stablenes.dwellyþ þer-in & ich confirmyd.

Ich seide to þe wicked, Ne willeþ nouȝt do wicked-lich; and ich seid to þe trespassand, Ne willeþ an-heȝe ȝour heuedes.The first e is corrected from o.Ne willeþ] wyll ȝe: þe] men: —ne: wyll ȝe noȝt enhiȝe ȝour heued.
Ne willeþ an-heȝe ȝour heued on heȝe, ne willeþ nouȝt speke wickednes oȝains God.—Ne: Wyl ȝe noȝt enhiȝe: ne w. n. sp.] & spekeþ noȝt.
For þat noiþer of þe est, ne out of þe west, ne of þe wilde mounteins; for God ys iuge.—þat: noþer: no—out: no.
He mekeþMS. makeþ. hym, and heȝeþ hym, for þat grace ys in þe honde of our Lord ful of sharpenes medeledThe last e is added over the line. wyþ lyþenes.mekeþ: ful medeled with scharpnes of swetnes.
And he bewedThe first e is corrected from o. fram þys to þys; his iugement forsoþe nys nouȝt made littel; alle þe synȝers of þerþe shul han þer-of.bowed: dome: is.
Y shal tellen for-soþe þe ryȝtfulnes of our Lord in þe world, and y shal syngen to þe God of Iacob.F. s. y.
Y shal breken alle þe heuedes of sinȝers; and þe heued of þe ryȝtful shul ben anheȝed.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 73, MS.PSALM 75 (76).
DIV2.P: God ys knowen in þe Iude, hys grete name is in Israel.Ieurye h. n. is g.
And his stede is made in pees, and hys wonyyng ys in heuen.wonyng.
Þere he brake myȝtes; bowe, swerde, shelde, and bataile.
Þou art aliȝtand wonderfullich of mounteines euer lastand; and alle þe vnwise of hert ben trubled.al.] liȝtyng: sturbled.
Alle þe vnwys men perissed þurȝ her pynes, and hij ne founde nouȝt of her godenes in her hondes.paynes: —ne: of—her.
Ha þou God of Jakob, hij þat diden sinȝesinȝ corrected from un. of pride perissed for þy blamyng.—Ha.
Þou art dredeful; and who shal stonden oȝains þe fram þan in þy vengeaunce?with-stonde þe.
Þou madest iugement herd fram heuen; and mannes kynde trembled, and held hem stylle.dome.
Whan God ros in iugement, so þat he shuld make sauf al þe milde of mankynde.dome: milde] meke.
For cosinage of man shal shriue to þe, and þe holinesses of þoȝtes shal don grete honur to þe.c.] þouȝt: holines of þouȝte.
VoweþMS. Boweþ. and ȝeldeþ to þe Lord, your God, ȝe alle þat bringe ȝiftes in his cumpas,Voweþ: ȝeld.
To þe dredeful and to hym þat doþ oway þe gost of princes; to þe dredeful at alle þe kynges of erþe.of þe erþe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 74, MS.PSALM 76 (77).
DIV2.P: Ich cried wyþ myA g follows but is expuncted. voice vn-to our Lord, wyþ my voice to God; and he vnderstode me.vnto] to: me] to me.
Ich by-souȝt God in þe daye of tribulacion wyþ myn hondes, and by nyȝt oȝains hym, and nam nouȝt deceiued.and nam] y am: desayued.
My soule for-sake to be conforted; ich was bi-þenchand on God, and ich delited; and ich was adrad, & my gost failed.for-soke.
Myn eȝen toke wakeinges, ich was trubled, and y ne spake nouȝt.wakynges+&: stur-bled: — ne.
Ich þouȝt elde daies, and ich had in mynde ȝeres euerlasting.
And ich biþouȝt by nyȝt in myn hert, and ich traualed and clensud my gost.biþouȝt] þouȝt.

Þynge to witen, ȝif God shal put owai my gost wiþ-outen ende, oþer he ne sett nouȝt þat heMS. adds be after he. ȝit be more pleisant?þynge . . . ȝif] weþer: put] noȝt cast: or he schal noȝt sett: — ȝit be: plesyng.
Oþer he shal kerue oway on ende his mercy fram kinde vn-to kynde?ket away into þe e.: into.
Oþer God shal forȝeten to haue mercy, oþer he shal holde his mercyes in his wraþþe?
And ich seid, Ich by-gan nov; þis is þe chaungeinge of þe heȝe ryȝthalf.heȝe r.] riȝthalfe of þe hyȝe Godd.
Ich was bi-þenchand of þe workes of our Lord; for-þy y shal be bi-þenchand fram þe bi-gynnyng of þi meruailes.
And y shal þenchen in alle þyne werkes, and y shal vse in alle þy fundynges.vsie: fyndyngis.
Ha God, þy way his in holy; who is grete God as on God is? artou God þat doþ wonders?—Ha: holynes: on] grete oure: artou G.] þou Godd art.
Þou made þy uertu knowen to folkes; and þou bouȝtest in þy myȝt þy folke, þe childer of Jacob and of Joseph, þe whiche loued þe.folk: f.] pepill: &—of.
Ha God, men seȝen þe, and dreden; and þe wicked ben trubled, dredand wheþer þou be God oþer non.—Ha: dreden . . . non] douted wheþer þou wer Godd or noȝt and þe w. beþ sturbled.
Þe gretnes of þe soune of men ȝaf voice to þe, and þe derked in þy lawe ȝaf voice to þe. derked] derk men: þy] þe.
For þyHere werkes follows, but is expuncted. wreches passen þe voice of þy manaces in cumpase.wr.] werkes: manace.
Þy shi[n]-ingesThe final s is written on erasure. liȝteþ þe world,MS. worled, but e is expuncted. and mankynde is stired, and his trubled.þe schynynges liȝted: —his.
Þy techinge and þy amonestinge ben in þe world in many men; and þyn dedes ne shul nouȝt ben knowen.amoneschyng: —þe: —ne.
[English omitted.]þou lede oute þi folk as schepe in þe kepyng of Moyses & Aaron.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 75, MS.PSALM 77 (78).
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe mi folk, vnderstondeþ my lawe, boweþþ on erasure of n; then an o follows, which is expuncted. ȝour eren to þe wordes of myn mouþe.—Ha: law+&: e.] here.
Ich opened mouþe in parables, and y shal speke proposes fram þe bygynnyng.Y schal openye my m.: pur|poses.
Hou many þynges we knewen and herden, & our faders told os MS. toldos.hem.herde & knewe: teld vs.
Hij ne ben nouȝt hid fram her sones in an oþer kynde,—ne: be.
Telland þe herieing of our Lord and his vertu and his wondres, þat he did.vertus.
And he stired witnes in Iacob, and sett lawe in Israel.st.] arerid.
[Translation omitted, as also the Latin of the next verse.]How many þinges he sent to our faders to make knowyng to her childer.
Þe childer, þat shul be born and arisen, shulMS. soul. tellen to her childer,[Latin and English omitted.]
Þat hij sett her hope in God, and ne for-ȝete nouȝt þe werkes of God, & seche is comaundementȝ;—ne.
Þat hij ne be nouȝt made as her faders wicked kyndeMS. kymde. away modeRead and wemode? of hert.—ne: kynde: aw. m.] & scharp.
Kynde þat ne dresced noȝt his hert, and his gost nis nouȝt trowed wyþ God.—ne: nis] as: trowyng.
Mennes sones of Effrem,MS. Effremm, the latter m being expuncted. bendand bowe and sendand, ben turned oȝain in daie of bataile.bendyng+her.
Hij ne kept nouȝt þe testament of God, and hij ne wold nouȝt gon in his lawe.—ne: —ne.
And hij for-ȝaten his gode dedes & hijs wondres,Here follows weche, which is dotted out. which he shewed to hem.þat.
He dede wondres in þe londe of Egipt to-fore her fadres, in þe felde of Thaneos.
He brake þe see, & lad hem out, and sett þe wateres as in a gourde.
And lad hem out in a cloude of daie, and alle þe niȝt in lyȝtyng of fur.cl. of+þe.
He brake þe stone in desert, and watered hem as in michel depenes.
And he broȝt out þe water of þe ston, and broȝt waters as flodes.
And ȝete hij laiden her force to synnen to hym, and stired in ire þe heȝe in dride stede.hyȝ+Godd: drye.
& hij tempteden God in her hertes, and hij asked me[te] to her willes.mete.
And hij spak iuel of God, and seiden, Ne myȝt nouȝt God diȝten bord in wildernes.—And: —ne: ordeyne+a.
For he smot þe ston; and waters ran out, and welles tokenMS. to hem. waters.to hem] toke.
Þyng to wyten, ȝyf he myȝt ȝyf brede oþer dyȝt borde to hys folk.þyng . . . ȝyf] weþer: myȝt+noȝt: o. d. b.] or ordeyne mete: pepill.
For-þy God herd þes wordes, and for-bare þe forsaid þynges; and fur is aliȝt in þe childer of Jakob, & ire aros in þe childer of Israel.þer-for: forb.] toke away.
For þat hij ne bileued nouȝt in God, ne hoped nouȝt in his helþe. —ne: ne] &.
And he comanded to þe cloudes abouen, and opened þe ȝates of heuen.com.] hote.
And he rained to hem manna for to ete, and ȝaf hem brede of heuen.—for.
Man ete brede of aungels, and God sent hem mete and drynke to wille.
He bare ouer þe wynde of þe souþe fram þe heuen, & brouȝt in þe winde of Affryk in his vertu.fram—þe.
& he rained vp hem pudre, flesshes, and volatils feþered as grauel of þe se.v.] wyld foule.
And hij fellen amiddes her castels and abouten her tabernacles.Here and in other places where the word occurs, er is abbreviated by a stroke through the upper part of the b.castelles—and.
And hij eten, and ben fild greteliche; and he ȝaf hem her desire, and hij ne were nouȝt deceiued of her desire.—ne: dessayuyd.
And ȝete was her mete in her mouþe; and þe ire of God steȝe vp hem.ascendid.
And he sloȝe her fatt, and destourbed þe chosen of Israel fram vengeaunce.fatt+bestes: desturbled.
And ȝit hij sinned in alle þes þynges, and netrowed noȝt in his wonders.—ne.
And her daies faileden in vanite,MS. vainte. and her ȝeres wyþ hastyng.vanite.
And as he sloȝt hem, hij soȝten hym, and turned oȝain, and com to him in þe daweing.sloȝe.
And hij bi-þouȝten hem þat God is her help, and þe heȝe God his her oȝain-bigger.
And hij loued him in her mouþe, and liȝed to him in her tunges.
And her hert [nas nouȝt riȝt wyþ hym, & hij ne ben nouȝt] holden trewe in his testament.hert+was noȝt riȝt with hym & þai be noȝt.
He is forsoþe merciable, and he shal be made helpe to her sinȝes, and he shal nouȝt for-don hem.
And he wex so þat he did owai his ire, and he ne aliȝt nouȝt al his ire;—ne.
And bi-þouȝt hym þat hij ben flesshe, gost going and nouȝt turneing oȝain.And+he.

The London MS. begins this verse with a large ornamental initial letter, and a later hand has accordingly added the number 76 in the margin.Hou oft hij greued hym in wildernesMS. wildelnes.; hij somond him in ire in dryhede.wyldernes: sett: drynes.
And hij ben conuerted, and temptedd God, and greueden þe holi of Israel.
Hij ne byþoȝt hem nouȝt of his help in þe daie þat heMS. hem, but the m is dotted out. bouȝt hem fram þe honde of þe trubland hem;ne byþ. hem] be-þouȝt: dis|turblyng.
As he sett in Egipt his toknes, and his wondres in þe felde of Thaneos.
And he turned her flodes in-to blode, and her raines þat hij ne shul nouȝt drynk.—ne: schuld.
