He sende in-to hem hounde-fleȝes, and ete hem; and þe frosche, and he sprad hem abrode.sent: spr. h. abr.] disparpild hem.
And he ȝaf her frute to þe lef-worme, and her trauails to þe grashope.fruyte: l.w.] ruste or lefe|worme: trauayles.
And he sloȝe her uines wyþ hail and her mulbery-trews wyþ rim-frost.mulbury tres: horefroste.
He ȝaf her meres to hail and her habbeinges to fur.He] & he: bestes: posses|sions to þe fure.
He sent in-to hem þe ire of his indignacioun, indignacioun and ire, & tribulacioun in his sendeingesMS. seideinges. bi wicked aungels.hem—þe: ind. ind.—and: sendynges.
He made waie to þe issu of his ire, and neMS. ne ne. spared nouȝt her soules fram þe deþ, and he shette her meresMS. medes. in deþ.vschseu: ne ne] he: medes] bestes.
And he smote alle þe firstborn in þe londe of þe Egipt, þe first frutes of alle her trauails in þe tabernacles of Cham.
And he did owai his folk as shepe, and smote hem as a folk in desert.
And he lad hem in hope, and hij ne drad nouȝt; and þo see couered her enemys. —ne: þe.
And he lad hem in-to þe mounteines of his halweinge, in-to þe mounteine þat is ryȝthalf purchased.holynes: hys riȝthonde won.
And heh on erasure. kest oway folk fram her face; and in lott he parted to hem þe londe in a corde of distribucioun.departyd.
And he did wonen in her tabernacles þe kindes of Israel.made: kynde.
And hij tempteden and greueden þe heȝe God, and ne kept nouȝt his witnisses.temped (!): — ne: wytnes.
And hiihii corrected from he. turned hem, and hij ne kept noȝt þe couenaunt, as her faders ben turned into iuel maner.and — hij ne.
And hij somened him in-to ire in her folies, and to en-vie hij cleped hym in þynges made wiþ fingirs.sett: with þynges made in careuyngges (ges begins a fresh line).
God herd her folies, and refused hem, and brouȝt Israel greteliche to nouȝt.foly.
And he putt oway þe tabernacle of Silo, þe tabernacle þer he woned in me[n].in me] among men.
And he ȝaf her vertu into wreched-hede, and here fairhede in þe hondes of þe enemy.wrechydnes: fairehode into.
And he shett his folk in a swerde, and despised hisMS. hif. heritage.in] to-geder with: his.
Fur brent her ȝongelinges, and her maidens ne ben nouȝt sorweand.— ne.
Her prestes fel in swerde, and her widowes ne were nouȝt wept þer-fore.— ne.
And our Lord is stired as slepand & as drynkand, drunken of wyn.
And he smote his enemys in þe hynder ende, and ȝaf to hem repruces wyþ-outen ende.reproues.
And he refuled þe tabernacle of Ioseph, and he ne ches nouȝt þe kynde of Effren.MS. offren.refusid: — ne: effrem.
Ac he ches þe kynde of Iuda, þe mount Sion, which he loued.Bot: wh.] þat.
And he bigged his holines in vnicorns in þe stede, þat he made in heuens.in v.] as an vnicorne: heuen.
He ches Dauid his seruaunt, and toke hym vp out of þe flok of shepe; and holi chirche toke hym,hym—vp: holi ch.] fram be|hynde hem he.
To fede Iacob, his seruant, and Israel, his heritage;
And he fed hem in þe in-nocenceMS. in nocente. of her hertes, and lad hem in þe vnderstondynges of her hondes.innocence: hert.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 77, MS.PSALM 78 (79).
DIV2.P: Ha God, folk wyþ-outen lawe com fram þe londe of Vs into þyn heritage, into Iude; and hij filden þyn holy temple, and sett Ierusalem in þe kepeing of a maner of folk þat was cleped Pomos.O: defoilyd.
Hij laiden þe dede bodis of þiMS. his. seruauntȝ mete to þe foules of heuen, þe flesshe of þyn halwen to bestes of þe erþe.Hij] þa: his] þi: heuen+&: holy men to + þe.
Hij [s]hadden her blode as water a-bouten Ierusalem; and þer nas non þat biried hem.sched: was: schuld bery.
We ben made in reproceing to our neȝburȝs, scornynge and desceit to hem þat ben in our cumpasse.reprouyng: in our c.] aboute vs.
Vn-to wham, Lord, artov wroþe on ende? þi luf shal be alyȝt as fur.How long, Lorde, schaltow be wroþe into þe ende: loue.
Helde þyn ire into þe folk þat ne knewe nouȝt þe, and in-to kyngdomes þat ne cleped nouȝt þy name. — ne: into þe k.
For hij slowen Iacobes childer, and descounforted his stede.made his st. dissolate.
Ne þenche þou nouȝt on our old wickednes; sone take þy mercyes vs, for we ben made michel pouer.
Ha God, our helþe, helpe vs; and deliuer vs of iuels, Lord, for þy glorie of þy name; and for þy name, Lord, be mercyable to our synȝes.þe ioie.
Þat our enemys ne saien nouȝt peraunter in folkes,Here follows an s, which is expuncted. Wher is her God? and wex it knowen in kynde to-fore our eȝen.— ne: among folke: be it know among nacions.
Þe wreche of þe blode of þyn seruauntes, þat his shad, þe waimentynge [of þe] fetered entre in þy syȝt.w.+of men.
Efter þe gretnes of þy myȝt þou shal welden þe sones of þe slain.schalt haue: of men slaw.
And ȝelde to ourHere follows lord, but it is expuncted. neȝburs seuen double in her bosme her lackinge, wich, Lord, hij repruced þe.seuenfolde: reproue þat þai reprouyd þe Lorde.
For-soþe we, þy folk and shepe of þy fold, shul shryue to þe in þe world.&+þe.
In kynde [ and kynde ] we shul tellen þyn heryynge.k.+& kynde: heryng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 79 (80).
DIV2.P: Ha þou God, þat gouernest Israel, vnderstonde þat ladeþ Ioseph meke as shepe.O: as+a.

The English of this verse is written twice in the MS., the above text being preceded by: þou þat sitest vp cherubyn (the last three words are struck out by the corrector with red ink, but have no dots) be þou made apert to-fore Effraim, Beniamyn and Masse (!); but over the first word of this passage the corrector has written va, and over the last one cat (vacat).Þou þatFollowed by sist, which is expuncted. sittest up cherubyn, be þou made apert to-fore Effraim, Beniamin, and Manasse.
Stire,MS. Stird. Lord, þy myȝt, and cum, þat tou make us sauf.Styr.
Ha God conuerte vs, and shewe þy face, and we shul ben sauf.O: turne.
Lord, God of vertu, þer-whiles þou wraþþest vp þe prayer of þy seruaunt,vertus to-whyls.
Þou shalt conferme vs in sharpnes of teres, and þou shalt ȝif vs waymentynge in mesure.confirme.
Þou sett vs in ȝain-siggeing to our neyburs, and our enemys scorned vs.into aȝeynesiggyng.
Ha God of vertuȝ, conuerte vs, and shew þi fac, and we shul be sauf.MS. fauf.turne: safe.
Þou broȝtest out þe .xij. kindes of Israel to Iacob sones out of Egipt, and kest hem out of þe felawship of men wiþ-outen law,MS. saw. and settest hem in þe londe of bihest.cast: cumpanye: saw] lawe.
Þou was lader of wai in þe siȝt of Joseph, and sett her sones; and þerþe fulfild her childer.
Þe out-going of him couerd þe mounteins, and her childer þe heuens of God.goyng oute.
Þe kinde of Iacob sprad his childer vn-to þe see, and hisFollowed by her (expuncted). seruauntes vn-to þe flode.vnto—þe.
Whi suffrestou, God, his stablenes ben destrued, and alle þat passen iuel waie de-foulen it?Godd whi sufferst þou: be: defoilid.
Þe pride of hym haþ for-don hym, and þe onliche deuel of en-vie haþ bounden him.
Ha God of vertu, be þou turned; and loke fram heuen, and se and visite þis kynde.
And make hym þe which þy myȝt fourmed; and [loke] vp mennes sones which þou confermedest to þe.þe w.] þat: &+loke: men sonnes þat þou confourmyd.
Aliȝt þou þe fur, and dampne and for-lese þe iuel fram þe iugement of þy godhede.þou þe] with: þi dome.
Be þyn helpe made vp þe man of bliscing, and up mennes sones,Followed by a w, which is dotted out. which þou fastened to þe. men sonnes þat þ. made fast.
And we depart nouȝt fram þe; and þou shalt quiken vs, and we shul klepe þy name.make qwyk.
Lord, God of vertuȝ, turne vs and conuerte vs, andFollowed by swe (expuncted). shewe us þy face: and we shul be sauf.—and conuerte vs: —us.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 79, MS.PSALM 80 (81).
DIV2.P: Gladeþ to God, our helper; singeþ to God of Iacob.h.+&.
Takeþ a song, and heueþRead ȝeueþ. to hym liȝtnes, sautre glad as wyþ ioie.ȝif: gl. as] gladyng.
Gladeþ to hym in new seruise of songe, in the noble daie of ȝour solempnite.
For þat þis comaundement is in Israel, iugement is to God of Iacob.
God sett þis þynge witnes in Ioseph, as he shuld passen out of þe londe of Egipt; he herd þe tunge þat he ne knew nouȝt.—ne.
He turned his wille fram sinnes;MS. seruies. his hondes serued in treuþe.seruies] synnes: seruyed.
Þou, man, clepedest me in tribulacion; and ich deliuered þe, and her þe in hid anguisses; ich proued þe atte water of oȝainsiggeinge.—and her þe: in þin anguys in priuyte+&.
Here þou my folk, and y shal saie þe: ȝif þou, folk of Israel, haue herd me, fals God ne shal nouȝt be in þe, [ne þou] ne shal anoure non oþer God þen me.—ne: no þou schalt honour: but.
For ich am þe Lord, þy God, þat lad þe out of þe fendes bonde; open þy mouþe, and y shal fille it wyþ wordes.fulfill.
And my folk ne herd nouȝt my uoice, and þe folk of Israel ne ȝaf no kepe to me.—ne: ne ȝaf] toke.
And ich lete hem go efter þe desireThe first e is cor|rected from i. of her hertes, & so shal hij gon in her fyndynges to nouȝt.—And: hert.
Ȝif my folk had herd me and þe folk of Israel had gon in my waies,&+ȝif.
Par auenture ich had for nouȝt lowed her enemys and sett myn honde vp þe trubland hem.MS. den.auentour: sturblyng hem.
Þe enemys of our Lord leȝe to hym, and her pine shal be in helle.lyed: payne.
And he fed hem wyþ flour of whete, and wyþ hony of ston he fulfild hem.hony-stone: fillyd hem full.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 80, MS.PSALM 81 (82).
DIV2.P: God stode in þe synagoge of þe fals goddes; for-soþe he brouȝt to nouȝt þe fals goddes amidward.of—þe: goddes+&: —þe.
To whom iugen ȝe wickednes and taken þe charge of synȝes?How long deme: takeþ.
Iugeþ þe nedeful and þe moderles, ryȝteþ þe meke and þe pouer.Demeþ: iustifieþ.
Defendeþ þe pouer and þe nedeful, and deliuereþ hem fram þe vengeaunce of þe synȝer.veniaunce.

Hii ne [wyst nouȝt] ne vnderstode nowit, and hii ne gon in vn|conandnes; alle þe foundementȝ of þe erþe shul ben stired oȝainnes hym.Þai wyst noȝt, no vnderstode noȝt witt, & þai go in vncunnyngnes all—þe: mouyd.
Y seyd, Ȝe ben Goddes, and ȝe alle childer of þe heȝest.all+beþ.
Ȝe shul dyey corrected from e. for-soþe as men, and ȝe shul falle as on of þe princes.
Arise þou, God, and iuge þerþe, and þou shalt en-heretien in alle folkes. deme: enherite among all folke.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 81, MS.PSALM 82 (83).
DIV2.P: Ha God, who shal be liche to þe? ne stille þou nouȝt, ne [be] þou, God, nouȝt destourbed.O: ne stille . . . dest.] be þou noȝt still no be desturbyd.
For þin enemys saiden yuel, and hij þat hated þe, aheȝed her heuedes.enhyed.
Hii maden wicked conseil vp þy folk, and þouten iuel to þin halwen.
Hii seiden, Comeþ, and depart we hem fram men, and ne be nouȝt þe name of Israel in minde.—ne: Isr.+more.
For hij þouȝt to-gidres onlich oȝains me, and hij ordeined testament in þe tabernacles of þe Ydumens and of Ysmaelites.of Ydumenes & of þe Ysmae|letes.
Moab & Agareni, Gebal, Amon, & Amalech, cum-linges wyþ þe woniand in Tyre.cum-linges] alienes: wonnyng.
For Assur com wyþ hym, and hij ben made helpers to Lothes childer.ben] were.
Do toMS. co. hem as to Madian and Cisare, and as to Iabin in þe broke of Syon.co] to: & to C.
Hij perissiden in Endor, and hij ben made as dunge of þe erþe.hij ben] were.
Sett her princes as Oreb and Ȝeb and Ȝe-bee and Salamana,
Alle her princes þat seiden, Welde we in heritage þe sanctuari of God.her] þer: w.] haue.
Ha þou my God, sett hem as a whele and as stuble to-fore þe face of þy wynde.O: þy] þe.
As? MS. al. fur þat brenneþ þe wode, and as lowe brennand þe mounteins,As: liet.
Þou shalt pursuen hem in þyn vengeaunce, and þou shalt trublen hem in þyn ire.
Fulfil her face wiþ wicked losMS. wicked des.; and sechen hij, Lord, þy name.des] los: seche.
Ben hij asshamed and trubled in þe world of world; and ben hij confounded, and perissen hij,sturbled: þe w. of w.] heuen: hij] hey (!).
Þat hij know þat Lord ys þy name; þou alon art heȝest in al erþe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 82, MS.PSALM 83 (84).
DIV2.P: Ha Lord of vertu, ful luuesum ben þyn tabernacles; my soule coueiteþ, and failed in þe halles of our Lord.O: vertus how louyd beþ.
Myn hert and my flesshe ioiden in God liueand.lyfyng Godd.
For þe sparow fonde hym an hous, and þe turtel nest, þer she liggeþ her briddes.founde: turtil + his: leggeþ.
Þyn auters, Lord, beþ of vertuȝ, þou art my kyng and my God.
And hij ben blisced þat wonen in þyn hous, hij shul herien þe in heuen.be: hous + &.
Blisced be þe man of whom þe help is of þe; he ordeined steiȝenge in his hert, in þe valei of teres, in þe stede þat he sett.ascension.
For þe berar of þe lawe shal ȝeue blisceinge to God; hij shul go fram vertu to vertu, and þe God of goddes shal be sen in þe heuen.þe b.] þe þe berer: seȝe: —þe.
Lord, God of vertuȝ, here myn orison; ha God of sones of Iacob, take it wyþ þyn eren.vertu: of þe sonnes: eres.
Ha God, our defendour, se and loke in-to þe face of þy preste anoint wyþ creme.O: anoite.
For o day is better in þy ioies vp a þousand ioies of þe wicked.þan.
Y ches to be cast out o þe hous of my God more þan to wonen in þe tabernacles of synȝers.o] of.
For God loueþ mercy and soþenes, our Lord shal ȝyf grace and glorie to þe gode.
He ne shal nouȝt depriue hem of goddes, þat gon in innocente; ha Lord of vertuȝ, blisced be þe man þat hopeþ in þe. —ne: clennes o.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 83, MS.PSALM 84 (85).
DIV2.P: Lord, þou blisced þyn erþe, þou turnedest oway þe chaityfs of þe childer of Iacob.erþe+and: wrechidnes.
Þou for-ȝaf þe wikednes of þy folk, and hilled alle her synȝes.þy] þe: hylid.
Þou litteled al þin ire, and turned hem fram þe ire of þyn indignacioun.
Conuerte vs, Lord, our helþe, and turne oway þyn ire fram vs.Conuerte . . helþe] Godd our h. turne vs.
Þyng to witen ȝyf þou shalt be wraþed to vs wyþ-outen ende, oþer þou shal put þyn honde fram kinde to kind?þyng . . ȝyf] waþer: l. schalt+noȝt.
Þou, God, turned shalt quiken vs, and þy folk shal gladen in þe.qu. vs] make vs qwyk.
Shew to vs, Lord, þy mercy, and ȝiue us þyn helþe.ȝif+to.
Y shal here what þyng our Lord spekeþ in me; for he shal speke pes in his folk,
And vp his halwen and hem þat ben turned to hert.
For-soþe his helþe is nere honde to hemMS. ben. þat douten him, þat glorie won in our erþe.nere . . . gl.] neȝ to hem þat douteþ h. þat his ioie.
Mercy and soþnes mett wyþ hym; ryȝtfulnes and pes ben kist.
Soþenes ys born of þerþe, and ryȝtfulnes loked fram þe heuen.fram—þe.
For our Lord shal ȝiue bliscednes, and our erþe shal ȝeuen his frut.
Ryȝtfulnes shal go to-fore hym, and shal sett his go-inges in his waie.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 84, MS.PSALM 85 (86).
DIV2.P: Lord, bowe þyn ere, and here me; [for ich am wrecched & pouer].me+for ich am wreched & pouer.
[Kepe my soule,] for ich am holi; ha mi God, make sauf þy seruant hopand in þe.For] Kepe my soule for: o: my.
Haue mercy on me, Lord, for ich cried to þe al dai; glade, Lord, þe soule of þy seruant, for ich lifted to þe, Lorde, my soule.lift+vp.
For þou, Lord, art soft and de-boner, and of mychel merci to alle þo þat clepen þe.d.] meke: all men clepyng þe.
Take, Louerd, myn orison in þyn eren, and vnder-stonde þe voice ofFollowed by mercy (expuncted). my praier.Lord: with: eres.
Y cried to þe in þe daie of my tribulacioun, for þou herdest me.
Lord, non is lich to þe in goddes, and non is efter þyn werkes.
Lord, al folk þat tou madest shul comen and anour to-fore þe and glorifie þy name.anour] honour.
For þou art grete, and þou artMS. nart, but the n is dotted out. on God doand wonders.grete+& makeyng wonderful þinges: onlich Godd—d.w.
Lade me, Lord, in þy waie, and y shal entre in þy soþnes; glade min hert, þat it drede þy name.
Lord, my God, y shal shryue to þe in alle my hert, & glorifien þy name wyþ-outen ende.
For þy mercy is grete vp me, and þou defended my soule fram þe deppest helle.
Ha Lord, þe wicked aros vp me, and þe sinagoge of myȝtful soȝten my soule; and hij ne sett nout þe in her syȝt.—ne.
For þou, Lord God, art pityful and merciable, suffrand and of michel mercy and soþefast.merc.+&.
Loke to me, and haue mercy on me; ȝif comauntdement to þy child, and make sauf þe sone of þyn hondemaiden. —and: hondemayde.
Make wyþ me tokne in gode, þat hii þat haten me se and be con|founded; for þou Lord halp me, and conforted me.tokyng: helpid.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 85, MS.PSALM 86 (87).
DIV2.P: Our Lord loueþ þe soules of his cosen vp al þe heȝest kinde of Iacob; þe foundementes of hym ben in þe holy heuens.chosyn: kyndes: in—þe.
Ha þou holi soule, cite of God, glorious þynges ben said of þe.vp þe.
Y, God, shal þenchen of Raab and Babilon, witan me and nouȝt trowand in me.witan . . . trow.] knowyng me & leuyng noȝt.
Se, straunge and Tyre and þe folk of Ethiope, hii weren þer, and destrued hem.Lo.

Þynge to wyten þat man shal saie of þeMS. þe so, but so is expuncted. holi soule, and man shal gladen in þat, and þe heȝest foundedMS. foundest. it?þynge . . . þat] For: schal+noȝt: man . . . it] whþer (!) þe hiest Godd haue made it.
Our Lord shal tellen in scriptures of folk and of princes and of þe honours þat weren in hym.
Wonynge, Lord, ys in þe as ofMS. os with a round s.alle gladeand.os] of.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 86, MS.PSALM 87 (88).
DIV2.P: Lord God of myn helþe, ich cried to þe in þe daie and in þe nyȝt to-fore þe.in day & nyȝt.
My orison com into þy siȝt; bow þyn ere to my praier.Cum myn orysun: syȝt+&.
For my soule is fulfild of iuels, and my lyf drow to helle.fulf.] fild: drow] come neȝ.
Ich am vnderstonden wyþ þe falland in-to helle, and ich made as a man ded wyþouten helpe, fre amonge þe ded.þe] men: a man ded] man.
As þe de-fouled wyþ synȝes beand in her beriels, of whiche þou art nouȝt þenchand no more, and ben put fram þyn helpe.defoiled: þou . . . more] þer is no more þouȝt.
Hij deden me in þe lowest [helle], in derknes, and in þe shadow of deþ.put: lowest+hell: in—þe.
ÞiMS. þe. wraþþe ys confermed up me, and [þou] broȝtest vp me alle þyne assautes.þe] þi: fast: &+þou.
Þou madest my knowen fer fram me, and hij sett me to hem in wlateinge.my kn.] me knowen men: into abhominacion.
Ich am ȝeuen in langour, and y ne went nouȝt out fram hym; min eȝen languissed for me-sais.MS. me saif.into sorow: —ne: angwyssed (g added over line) for mysays.
Lord, ich cried to þe al dai; ich bred out min hondes to þe bisechand mercy.b.] spred: praying+þi.
Þyn[g] to wyten ȝyf þou shal do wondres to þe ded, oþer leches shul arerenMS. cireren. hym, and shul shryuen to þe?þyn . . . ȝyf] Wheþer: schalt+noȝt: arere hem.
Þyng to witen ȝyf anny shal tellen þy mercy in byriels and þy soþenes in forleseing?þyng . . . ȝyf] Wheþer noȝt.
Þynge to wyten ȝyf þy wonders shul ben knowen in derkenes and þy ryȝtfulnes in helle?þynge . . . ȝyf] Wheþer noȝt.
And ich, Lord, cried to þe, and mynLast word of the line. The y's are always dotted, but here the y decidedly has a long stroke over it instead of the dot. oreison shal erleche cum to-fore þe.
Why, Lord, puttestou oway myn oreison, & turnest fram me þy face?putestow.
Ich am pouer and in trauails fram my ȝyngþe; ich am heȝed for|soþe, am lowed and trubled.ȝougeþe: soþe—am.
Þyn ires passeden in me, and þy dredefulnisses trubleden me.wraþes: gastnes.
And hij compassed me ich dai, as þe water goþ aboute þerþe; hij enuironed me togidres.cumpast: as—þe: enclosed.
Þou drowe fram me frend andHere follows ȝe, which is expuncted. neȝbur, and my knowen fram mysais.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 87, MS.PSALM 88 (89).
DIV2.P: Y shal synge wyþ-outen ende þe mercyes of our Lord.
Y shal tellen þy soþenesses in my mouþe fro kynde to kynde. soþnes.
For þou seidest, mercies shulden owayInstead of alway. ben edefied in heuens wyþ|outen ende; þy soþenes shalt ben diȝt in hem.mercye schal be edified with|oute e. in h.
Ich ordeined my testament to myn chosen; and y swore to Dauid, my seruant, Y shal diȝten þi sede vnto wiþ-outen ende.—vnto.
Y shal edefien þi sede in kyndes to kindes.sete fram k. into k.
Lord, þe heuens, shul hy graunten þyn wondres & þy soþnesses in þe chirche of halwen?MS. lawe.þe] þi: hy gr.] knowlege: soþnes: lawe] halowen.
For who shal be euenned to our Lord in cloudes? he shal ben liche to God in Goddes chosen.euenned] made euen: amonge þe chosen of Godd.
God, þat his glorified in þe conseil of holi, he is grete and dredful vp alle þat ben inin is added over the line. his cumpas.halowen.
Lord God of vertuȝ, who ys lich to þe? Lord, þou art myȝtful, and þy soþnesse ys in þy cumpas.
Þou lord-shippest þe pouste of þe seo, þou for-soþe pesest þe stiryng of hys flodes.þou hast lordschip to þe power: see—þou: slakest: mouyng of þe f. þer-of.
Þou lowedest þe proud as þe wounded, and þou departedest þyn enemys in þe pouste of þy vertu.made low: power.
Þe heuens ben þyn, and þe [erþe] is þyne; þou founded þe world and his plente, þe norþ and þe see þou four-modest.þe+erþe: wrold: made.
Thabor & Hermon shal gladen in þy name; þy pouste ys wyþ myȝt.þe power.

Be þiMS. þe. strengþe fastened, and be þyn helpe MS. be þou helped, of which the d is dotted out. an-heȝed; MS. and heȝed. ryȝtfulnes and iugement ben þe diȝteyng of þe sege of God.þi: made faste & be þin help enhied: beþ ordenaunce of his sete.
Mercy and soþenes shul go to-fore þy face; blisced be þe folk þat conen gladyng.cunne.
Þe ryȝtful, Lord, shul gon in þe lyȝt of þy face, and shul gladen aldai in þy name; and hij shul ben anheȝed in þy ryȝtfulnes.L. þe r.
For þou art þe glorie of her vertu; and our ioie shal be heryed in þy wele-quemand,ioie: enhyed: w.q.] plesyng.
For-þy þat our vp-steiȝeing ys of our Lord and of our kyng, þe holy of Israel.For . . . vpst.] For our takyng: kyng þe h.] holy k.
Þan spake þou in syȝt to þy holy, and saidest, Y sett help in þe myȝtful, and heȝedMS. heȝest. myn chosen inMS. and. my folk.& þou sayde: hyed: and] in.
Ich fonde Dauid, my seruant, and y stablyst hym in myn holy mercy.sett.
For my strengþe shal helpen hym, and my pouerte shal con|ferme hym.pouerte] power: confirme.
Ne þe enemy ne shal nouȝt profiȝt in hym, ne þe fende ne shal nouȝt sett strengþeMS. areng þe. forto anoien hym.—1. Ne: —2. ne: —4. ne: strengþ to noie.
And y shal departent hys enemys fram his face, and y shal turne in fleinge alle þat hatenhate in, MS. hym.depart: hate in] hateþ.
And my soþenes and my mercy is wyþ hym, and hys ioie shal ben heȝed inMS. and. my name.soþnes: heȝed and] enhied in.
And y shal sett hys strengþe in gode, and [in] hys conabletes his helpe.& in hys couenabletes.
He cleped me, Þou art my fader, mi God, and taker of myn helþe.
And y shal sett hym frest biȝeten, heȝe to-fore þe kynges of erþe.first beȝetynAfter beȝetyn a g is erased.: of+þe.
Y shal kepe to him wyþ-outen ende; my mercy and my testament shal be leal to hym.trew.
And y shal setten his kinde in þe heuen, and his trone as þe daie of heuen.
Ȝyf his childer for-soþe haue for-saken my lawe, and ne haue nouȝt gon in my iugement,F. s. ȝif h. ch.: —ne: domes.
Ȝyf hij haue de-fouled my ryȝtfulnesses, and haue nouȝt kept my comandementȝ:defoiled.
Y shal uisite in chasteing her wickednesses, and her synȝes in vengeaunce.wykkydnes.
Y shalt nouȝt departen fram hym my mercy, ne y ne shal nouȝt anoien hym in my soþenes.schal: y—ne.
And y shal noȝt file my testament, and þe wordes þat gon out of my lippes y shal nouȝt maken vain.foule.
Y swor ones in my holi, Ȝif y liȝe to Dauid, his kinde shal last wyþ-outen ende;
And his trone as þe sunne in my siȝt, and as þe mone parfit wyþ|outen ende; and his witnes shal be trewe in heuen.
For-soþe þou putted oway and despised þe gode, and putted owai fram þe þi Crist.
Þou dest owai þe testament fram þy seruant, and filed in erþe his sanctuari.dest] turnyd: filed—in erþe.
Þou destrued alle his soþenes, and laid dredand his stedfastnes.his] þe: laid dr.] settest drede.
Alle þe passand her way rauist hym, and so he hys made reproce to his neȝburs.þe] men: reproue.
Þou heȝed his helpe of þe wrekand hym, and made ioiful al his enemys.þe wr.] men castyng doune: glade.
Þou dest oway þe helpe of his defens, and þou ne halp hym nouȝt in bataille.dyd:—ne: halp] help.
Þou destrued hym fram clennes, and þou hurteled his sege in erþe.sete.
Þou made littel þe daies of his tyme, and turnedest hym in confusion.
To wham, þou Lord, þou turneste on ende? þy wraþe shal bren as fur.How longe: turnest þou þe into e.
By-þenche þe, wat is my substaunce; þyng to wyten ȝif þou setted in uaine alle mennesones?þyng . . . ȝif] wheþer: sett+ noȝt: —in: men sonnes.
Which man ys yt þat shal lyuen and nouȝt se þe deþ, and shal defende his soule fram þe strengþe of helle?Who is þat man þat schal lif and+schal.
Where ben, Lord, þyn old mercies,es on erasure. as tov swore to Dauid in þy soþenes?Lorde where beþ.
Lord, be þou bi-þenchand of þe repruce of þy seruauntȝ, which repruceing ich held in my bosom of many men;reproue: þat—repruceing.
Þe which þyn enemys, Lord, reproced, þat reproued þe chaungeing of þy prest a-noint wyþ creme.L. þe wh. þ. e.: reprouyd: anoite.
Blisced be our Lord wyþ-outen ende; be it don, be it don.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 88, MS.PSALM 89 (90).
DIV2.P: Lord, þou art made socour to ous fram kynde to kinde.
To-fore þat þe mounteins were made, oþer þerþe were fourmed and þe werld, þou art God fram þe world vnto þe world wyþ-outen ende.þe erþe+or þe world: — and þe w.
Ne turne þou nouȝt into mildnes; and þou seidest, Ȝe childer of men, turneþ ȝou.—ne: mekenes.
For a þousand ȝeres ben to-fore þyn eȝen as ȝisterdai, þat is passed.
And þe kepyng o nyȝt, þat for nouȝt ben had, shul be her ȝeres.o] of.
Passe he as gresse in þe mornyng; florische he in þe mornyng, and passe; falle he at heuen, and harden and wax he drie.foloresch: atte euen: harde.
For we failed in þyn ire, and we ben desturbed in þyn vengeaunce.
Þou laidest ouro corrected from v. wickednesse in þy siȝt; ourHere follows lord, which is expuncted. world ys in liȝtyng of þy chere.
For alle our daies faileden, and we failed in þyn yre.
Our ȝeres shal þenchen as þe lob, þe daies of our ȝeres in þe seuenti ȝere.þe lob] grauel: in þe] in hem schal be.
For-soþe ȝyf eȝti ȝere ben in myȝtes, þe more ouer hem shal beMS. ben, but n is expuncted. trauail and sorowe.be: þe] þer.
For mildnes com þer-on; and we shul be wiþnumen.mekenes come aboue: with|nym.
Who knew þe myȝt of þyn ire, and to tellen þy wraþe for þy drede?knoweþ: þe wraþe of.
Make so þyn helpe knowen, and þe lered of hert in wisdome.
Lord, be þou turned vnto nov, and be þou bidlich vp þy seruantes.v.n.] hidertoward: prayable.
We ben fulfild erlich of þy mercy, we shul gladen and deliten in alle our daies.gladen] galde (!).
We gladed in þe daies, in which þouHere lord followed, but is expuncted. lowed us for þe ȝeres in which we seiȝen iuels.dayes in+þe.
Loke to þy seruauntes and to þyn werkes, and dresce her sones.
And þe shynyng of our Lord God be vp vs, and dresce vp us þe werkes of our hondes, [and dresce þe werkes of our hondes.]hondes+& dress þe warkes of our hondes.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 89, MS.PSALM 90 (91).
DIV2.P: He þat whoneþ in þe helpe of þe heȝest, he shal dwelle in þe defens of God of heuen.
He shal saie to our Lord, Þou art my taker and my refut; mi God, y shal hopen in hym.
For he deliuerd me fram þe trappes of þe fendes and fram asper word of men.gryn: scharp.
And he shal shadow þe wyþ hys shulderis, and þou shalt hope vnder hys feþers.truste: feders.
Þe soþenes of hym shal cumpas þe wyþ shelde, and þou ne shalt nouȝt doute of þe drede of nyȝt,—ne.
Of temptacioun waxand in daie, fram nede goand in derkenes, fram þe curs of þe fendeHere follows biȝt, dotted out as well as scored through. bryȝt shynyng.
A þousand temptaciouns shul fallen fram þiMS þe. syde, and ten þousandes fram þy ryȝthalf; þe deuel for-soþe ne shal noȝt comen to þe.þi sydes: þouȝand: —ne.
Þou shalt se for-soþe wyþ þyn eȝen, þou shalt se þe ȝeldyng of synȝers.eȝen+and: reward.
For þou, Lord, art myn hope, and þou setted þy refut alderheȝest.a.] hiest.
Yuel ne shal nouȝt com to þe, and turment ne shal nouȝt com nere þy tabernacle.—ne: —ne: —com.
For he sent to his aungels of þe, þat hij kepe þe in alle þyn waies.
Hij shul bere þe in hondes, þat tou ne hirt nouȝt perauenture þy gost wyþ vices.tou. . . vices] per auentur þou hurte noȝt þy goste or fote with vice or atte stone.
Þou shalt gon vp queintisMS. quenitis. and godenes, and þou shalt de-foule þe fende and helle.qu.] wysdome: defoile.
For he hoped in me, and y shal deliuer hym; y shal defenden hym, for he knew my name.—and.
He cried to me, and y shal here hym; ich am wyþ hym in tribulacioun, y shal defend him and glorifien hym.
Y shal fulfillen hym wyþ lengþe of daies, and y shal shewe hym min helþe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 90, MS.PSALM 91 (92).
DIV2.P: Gode it is to shryue to our Lord, and heȝestlichȝ (expuncted) heȝefflich. singe to þy name; It is gode: hilich.
For to tellen erliche þy mercy and þy soþenes by nyȝt;
In þy .x. comaundementȝ, wyþ songe and harpe.
For þou, Lord, delited vp me in þy makeing; and y shal gladen in þe werkes of þyn hondes.
Hou michel, Lord, þin werkes ben heried; her þoutes ben ful michel deped.Lorde, so much þi w. beþ made grete, her þouȝtes beþ to much depe.
Þe man vnwys ne shal nouȝt knowen, and þe fole ne shal nouȝt vnderstonde þes þynges.þe vnwys man—ne: —ne.
Whan synȝers ben born as hay multipliand, and alle þat wirchen wickednisse apered,
Þat hij dyen in þe world of worldes, þou for-soþe, Lord, art heȝest wyþ-outen ende.for s. þou.
For se, Lord, þyn enemys shul perischen, and alle þat wirchen wickednes shul ben sprade abrode.on brode.
And my voice shal be anheȝed as horne of þe vnycorne, and myn elde and mercy plentifous.as+þe: age.
And myn eȝe despised min enemys, and min ere shal here þe wordes of hem þat arysen oȝains me, and of wicked.
Þe ryȝtful shal floris as palme, and shal be multiplied as cedres of Libani.ceder of þe Libane.
Þe plauntedte on erasure. in þe hous of our Lord shul flurissen in þe halles of þe hous of our Lord.þe pl.] & schal be sett: I. Lorde+&.
Hij shul be ȝete multiplied in elde plentifous, and hij shul ben wele likand, þat hij tellen þe gode.age of plente. 15. nys] is.
For þe Lord, our God, is ryȝtful, and wickednes nys nouȝt in hym.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 91, MS.PSALM 92 (93).
DIV2.P: Our Lord regned,MS. regneþ. and cloþed hym wyþ fairenes; our Lord is cloþed in strengþe, and þer-wyþ he girt hym.regnyd & is cloþyd(!) fair|nes: cloþd—in.
For he fastened þe world, þat ne shal nouȝt be stired.f.] made: —ne: mouyd.
Ha God, fram þan ys þy sete made redy; þou art honourd of þe world.sete] sett.
Þe flodes, Lord, heȝed þe, þe flodes an-heȝed her voice.h. þe] arered hem: arered.
Þe flodes an-heȝed her flowynges fram þe voices of mani waters.arered.
Þe shewe-inges of þe se ben wondurful, our Lord ys wonderful on heȝt.se] waters: in heȝt.
Þy wytnes ben made ful wele to louen; holines, Lord, bisemeþ þyn hous into lengþe of daies.w. tol.] trouable: bis.] semeþ: into+þe.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 92, MS.PSALM 93 (94).
DIV2.P: God ys Lord of vengeaunces; God of vengeaunce did frelich.vengeaunce] vengances.
Þou þat iugest þerþe, be þou an-heȝed, and ȝelde ȝeldeinge to þe proude.demest: ȝeldeinge] reward.
Unto wham, Lord, þe synȝers, vnto whan þe synȝers shul gladen?Hou longe, Lorde, schal þe synnars glade, & iterum.
Hij shul saie and speken wickednes, alle shul speken þat wirchen vnryȝtfulnes.
Hij loweden, Lord, þy folk, and trauailed þyn heritage.Lorde þai lowed.
Hij slowen wydowes and straunge, and slowen þe moderles.straungers: m.+chylder.
And hij seiden, Our Lord ne shal nouȝt sen it, ne þe God Iacob ne shal nouȝt vnderstonde it.—ne shal nouȝt: —ne: Godd+of: —ne.
Ha ȝe nouȝt wyse in þe folk, vnderstondeþ, and ȝe foles, by-comeþ sumtyme wyse.—Ha: ȝe vnwys amonge.
He þat sett ere, ne shal nouȝt here; oþer he þat feined hys eȝe, ne seþ nouȝt?sett e.] his ere setteþ: —ne: or: —ne.
He þat chastieþ men, ne shal nouȝt reprucen; þe which techeþ mani coninge?—ne: man cunnyng.
Our Lord wote þe þoȝtes of men, for hii ben ydel.
Lord, blisced be þe man þat tou hast lered, and hast tauȝt hym þy lawe.Lor: þe] þat.
Þatou asswage hym fram iuel daies, þer-whiles þat dicheþRead diches or diche. be doluen to þe synȝer.slake: dicheþ] þe diche.
For our Lord ne shal nouȝt put owai his folk, and he ne shal nouȝt for-sake hys heritage.—ne: —ne.
Þat whiles þat ryȝtfulnes be turned into iugement, and alle þoCorrected from þe. by hym, þat ben of ryȝtful hert.þ. w.] Vnto þe tyme: dome.
Who shal arisen wyþ me oȝains þe wicked? oþer who shal stonde wyþ me oȝains þe wirchand wickednes?
Bot ȝyf our Lord for-þi had holpen me, my soule nere honde had woned in helle.helpid: nere] neȝ.
Ȝyf ich seid, My fote is stired, Lord, þy mercy halp me.mouyd: helpid.
Efter þe michelnes of my sorowes in myn hert, þy confortes gladeden my soule.
Þyng to wyten ȝyf sege of wickednes draweþ to þe, þat feineþ sorowe in comaundement?þyng . . . ȝyf] weþer: dr.+ noȝt: commaundementes.
Þe wicked couayted dampnacioun in þe soule of þe ryȝtful, and condempned þe blode of þe innocent.couayt d. aȝen þe: dempned.
And our Lord is made to me in refut, and my God into helpe of myn hope.
And he shal ȝelde hem her wickednes and spradden hem in her malice, and Gode, our Lord, shal departen hem.spradden] he schal sparpill: & Godd+& Godd.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 93, MS.PSALM 94 (95).
DIV2.P: Comeþ, glade we to our Lord, singe we to God, our helþe.Commeþ+&.
Take we forþe his face in shryȝt, and singe we to hym in songes.Ocupie we his f. in schryft: psalmes.
For God ys a grete Lord and grete kyng vp alle goddes.
For in his hondes ben alleMS. be ualle. þe cuntreis of þerþe, and al þe heȝnes of þe mounteins ben of hym.beþ all: —al.
For þe se is his; and he made hit, and his hondes founded þe drihede.hondes f. þe d.] made drynes.
Comeþ, anore we, and synge and [wepe] we to-fore our Lord, þat made us; for [he] hys þe Lord our God,Cum ȝe, & honour we, & fall we doune, & wepe we to-for: hys] he is.
& we þe folk of his pasture and þe shepe of his honde.
Ȝyf hei.e. ȝe. han herd to-daie his voice, ne willeþ ȝe nouȝt harden ȝour hertes,ȝe: ne . . . harden] will noȝt hard.
As in taryinge efter þe dai of temptacioun in desert.tar.] voidyng.
Þer [ȝ]our fadres tempteden me, hii proueden and seiȝen my werkes.our] ȝoure.
And y whas wroþe to þat kynde by fourty ȝere, and seide alwai, Hij erren in hert.
& þes ne knew nouȝt myn waies, as ich swore in myn ire, ȝyf hij shul entren in-to my rest.—ne.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 94, MS.PSALM 95 (96).
DIV2.P: Syngeþ to our Lord a new songe; ha alle erþe, syngeþ to our Lord.—ha alle] all þe.
Syngeþ to our Lord, & blisceþ hys name, and telleþ his helþe fram dai to daie.
Telleþ amonge men his glorie, and his wondres to alle folkes.ioie: folk.
For our Lord ys michel and worþshipful and dredeful vp alle godes.aboue all goddes.
For alle þe goddes of men ben fendes, our Lord for-soþe made þe heuenes.f. s. our L.
Shrift & fairnes ben in hijs siȝt, holines and heriyng ben in his halwing.halowen.
Þe cuntreis of men, bryngeþ to our Lord, bringeþ to our Lord glorie and honour, bringeþ glorie to our Lord and to his name.Ȝe cuntres: ioie: ioie.
Bryngeþ offryndes, and entreþ into his halles, and anoureþ our Lord in his holines.offerynges: honoureþ.
Alle þerþe be stired fram his face; say ȝe, men, to folkes þat our Lord regned.mouyd.
For he amended þe world, þe wich ne shal nouȝt be styred; he shal iuge þe folkes in euennesse.þe w. ne] þat: mouyd: deme.
Gladeþ ȝe heuens, and ioie þerþe, and be þe see and hys plente stired; þe feldes shul gladen, and alle þynges þat ben in hem.Glade þe h.: and h. pl. st.] in his plente mouyd.
Þan shul alle þe trews of þe wodes gladen of þe face of our Lord, for he comeþ; for he comeþ to iugen þerþe.trows: ioie: deme.
He shal iuge þe world in euenesse, and þe folk in soþenesse.deme: in his soþnes.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 95, MS.PSALM 96 (97).
DIV2.P: Our Lord regneþ; glade þerþe, and ioien many yldes.haþ regned: yles.
Cloudes and derknes ben in his cumpasse, ryȝtfulnes and iugement ben þe amendement of his sege.dome.
Fur shal gon to-forn hym, and brenenr on erasure. hys enemys abouten hym.
Hys liȝtyngens aliȝted þe world; he seiȝe, and þe erþe ys styred.liȝtynges a.+to: seȝt: mouyd.
Þe mounteins melted as wax fram þe face of our Lord, al þe erþe fram þefram þe twice in MS. face of our Lord.al] & all.
Þe heuens telden his ryȝtfulnes, and al þe folkes seȝen his glorie.schewed: folk seȝ: ioie.
Ben hij alle confounded þat anouren y-magerie & þat gladen in her maumetes.anouren . . . &] honoureþ grauen ymagerye & þai: maumemetries (!).
Alle ȝe hys aungels, anouren hym; þe folk of Syon herd God and ioied.honouret.
And þe doȝters of Iude gladed, Lord, for þy iugement.domes.
For þou, Lord, art heȝest up alle þe erþe; mychel þou art heȝed vp alle þe godes.all goddes.
Ȝe þat loue our Lord, hateþ iuel; our Lord kepeþ þe soules of his halwen; and he shal liuer hem fram þe pouste of þe synȝer.deliuer: p.] honde.
Lyȝt hijs sprongen to þe ryȝtful, and ioie to þe ryȝtful of hert.spr.] ryse. 13. halowen.
Gladeþ, þe ryȝtful in our Lord, and shryueþ to þe mynde of hys halwyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 97Ps. 96, MS. (98).
DIV2.P: Ȝe men, syngeþ to our Lord a newe songe, for he haþ don wonder|ful þynges.
He saued to hym þe helpe of hys chosen and hys holi pouste.pouer.
Our Lord made hys helþe knowen, and shewed hys ryȝtfulnes in syȝt of men.
He þouȝt on hys mercy and on hys soþenese added over line. to þe hous of Israel.

Alle þe contre-hysRead contreis. of þe erþe seȝen þe helþe of our Lord God; hei.e. ȝe. alle þerþe, ioieþ to God, and syngeþ and gladeþ and ver-saileþ.contre hys] cuntres: —Lord: —he: ioie: singeþ—and: vers.] psalmeþ.
Syngeþ to our Lord in harp and in voice of psalme, in trumpes beten and voice of trumpes of horne.harpe+in harpe: of tr.] of trumpe.
Gladeþ in þe syȝt of þe kyng, our Lord; be þe se stired and hys plente, þe world, and hij þat wonen þer-inne.in—þe: mouyd: þere world.
Þe flodes shul ioien togidres wyþ honde, and mounteins shul gladen of þe syȝt of our Lord; for he comeþ to iuge þerþe.and] þe: deme.
He shal iuge þe world in ryȝtfulnes, and þe folkes in euennes.deme.

DIV2.HEAD: Ps. 97, MS.PSALM 98 (99).
DIV2.P: For þat our Lord regned, wraþ-þen þe folkes; þou þat sittest up cherubyn, by þe erþe styred.þe folkes wraþed: by] be: mouyd.
Our Lord ys grete in heuen and heI.e. heȝe, hiȝe. vp alle folkes.he] hyȝ.
Shryuen hij to þy grete name, for it ysAfter ys, MS. has dede deleted. dredeful and holi; and þe honour of þe kyng loueþ iugement.Be þai chryf.
Þou dittest dresceinges, and þou madest iugement & ryȝtfulnes in Iacob sones.diȝtest: iugement: Iacobes.
And heȝeþ þe Lord, our Lord, and anoureþ þe shamel of hys fete, for hit is holy.A. h.] Enhieþ: honoureþ: stole.
Moyses and Aaron wyþ her prestes, and Samuel amonges hem þat clepen hys name.
Hij clepeden our Lord, and he herd hem; he spake to hem in a piler of a cloude.
Hij keptten hysMS. hyȝt. witnesses and þe comaundement þat he ȝaf to hem.kept his wyttnes: commaunde|mentis.
Ha Lord, our God, þou herd hem; þou, God, was mercyful to hem and byginnand to wreke in alle her fyndeynges.O our Lorde Godd: hard: b. to wr.] auengyng.
And heȝeþ þe Lord, our God, and anoureþ hym in hys holy heuen; for þe Lord, our God, ys holy.A. h.] Enhieþ: honoureþ.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 99 (100).
DIV2.P: Ha alle erþe, gladeþ to God, serueþ our Lord in gladnes.Ha alle] All þe: Godd+ &: o.L.] Godd.
Entreþ in his syȝt in ioie.
Weteþ þat our Lord he is God; he made us, and nouȝt we us seluen.Weteþ] Wyt ȝe.
We ben hys folk and þe shepe of hys pasture; entre hys ȝates in shrift, and schryueþ to hym in hys temple in songes.entreþ: songes] ympnes.
Herieþ hys name; for our Lord ys milde, hys mercy ys wyþ-outen ende, and hys soþnesse ys in kende and kinde.meke.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 100 (101).
DIV2.P: Lord, y shal synge mercy and iugement to þe; y shal versail and vnderstonde in wai unfiled, whan þou shal come to me.versail] psalme: vnfulyd.
Y ȝede in þe innocens of myn hert, amiddes þe wylle of myn hert, in-middes myn hous.Notabile in margin, written by a later hand.inn.] clennes: amiddes] amyd.
Y ne sett nouȝt to-fore myn eȝen þyng vnryȝtful, and ich hated þe trespassynges.—ne: vnr. þyng: þe tr.] men trespassyng.
Wicked hert ne come nouȝt to me; y ne knew nouȝt þe wicked bowand fram me.—ne: —ne.
Y ne pursued hym þat bacbiteþ priuelich hys neȝbur.—ne: bakbyted.
Y ne ete nouȝt wyþ þe prude eȝe, and wiþ hert þat ne may nouȝt be fulfild.—ne: and] no: with+þe: —ne.
Myn eȝen ben to þe trew of þerþe, þat hij sit wyþ me; þe goand in vnfiled wai, he serued me.
He þat [doþ] pride ne shal nouȝt wonen amiddes myn houus; he þat spekeþ yuel, y ne dresced hym nouȝt in þe syȝt of myn eȝen.þat+doþ: —ne: amyd: —ne.
Ich sloȝe in þe mornyng alle þe synȝers of erþe, þat y shuld departent out of our Lordes cite alle þe wirchand wickednes.of+þe: departe.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 101 (102).
DIV2.P: Here, Lord, my praiere, and my crye come to þe.Lord here.
Ne turne þou nouȝt þy face framFollowed by þe, which is dotted out. me; in wich daie þat ich be trubled, bow to me þyn ere.—Ne: am sturbled.
In which daie þat ich had cleped to þe, here þou me hastilich.haue: hastelich.
For my daies failed as smoke, and my bones dried as craukes.smeche.
Ich am smyten as hay, and myn hert dryed; for ich for-ȝate to ete my brede.
Of þe voice of my waymentyngeThe final e is corrected from the loop of g. my bon droȝ to my flesshe.cleued.
Ich am made lich to þe pellican of ones, and ich am made as þe nyȝtrauin in þe euesynges.ones] wyldernes: ouesyng.
Y woke, and made as þe sparowe wonand on inin added above the line. þe hous.wonand on in] wylde in þe helyengSecond e corrected from i. of.
Myn enemys vp-braided me aldai, and hij þat praised me swore oȝains me.vpbrade.
For ich ete my brede as asken, and medeled my drynk wyþ wepyng.
Fram þe face of þe ire of þi indignacioun; for þou liftand me norissed me.þine ire: arered me norisch|yng me.
My daies boweden as shadow, & hijI.e., y (ego). d[r]eied as hai.b.] auanesched: as+a: dried.
Þou, Lord, forsoþe dwellest wyþ-outen ende, and þi mynde is in kinde and in-to kynde.MS. in toknynge to kynde, of which toknynge is dotted and struck out.F. s. þ. L.
Þou, Lord, arisand shalt haue pite of þe folke of Syon; for þe time of hijs mercynge, for þe time comeþ.of þe] of þi: þe+þe: m.] hauyng mercye.
For hijs fastnes pleised to þi seruantes, and hij shul haue pite of his erþe.seruant.
And þe folke, Lord, shul douten þy name, and alle þe kynges of þe erþe þi glorie.ioie.
For our Lord edefied þe heuen, and shal be sen in hijs glorie.Omitted, as it ended with the same word as the preceding verse.
He loked in-to þe oreison of þe meke, and he ne despised nouȝt her praier.—ne.
Be þes þynges wryten in þat oþer kinde; and þe folk þat shal be fourmed shal heryen our Lord.
For he loked fram hys eȝe heuen; our Lord loked fram heuen into erþe;hie.
Þat he herd þe waie-mentynges of þe fettered and vnbinde þe soþenes of þe slain.waylynges: vnbyde (!) þe sonnes of þe men slawe.
Þat hij telle in Syon þe name of our Lord and hys hereinge in Ierusalem.herying.
In acordand þe folkes in on, and þe kynges, þat hii serue to our Lord.seruy.
He answerd hym in voice of his vertou, Telle to me þe fewenes of my daies.
Ne clepe þou me nouȝt oȝayn in þe half dele of mi daies, in kynde and in-to kynde of þe ȝere.—Ne.
Lord, þou founded þerþe atte gynnyng, and þe heuens ben þe werkes of þyn hondes.in þe begynnyng.
Hij shul perissen, þou for-soþe dwellest; and alle shul by-gynne at elden as cloþyng.perisch+&: byg. at e.] wex elde.
And þou shalt chaungen hem as couertour,MS. to uertour. and hij shul be chaunged; þou for-soþe art þat ich, and þy ȝeres ne shul nouȝt failen.couertour: þou . . . ich] f. s. þou art he: —ne.
Þe sones of þy seruauntes shul wonen, and here sede shalt be dresced in þe world.shalt] schal.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 102 (103).
DIV2.P: Ha þou my soule, blisce our Lord; and alle þynges þat ben wyþ|innen me, blisce hys holi name.O.
Ha þou my soule, blisce our Lord; and ne wille þou nouȝt for-ȝete alle his ȝelde-inges; O: —ne: —his: ȝeldyng.
Þe which is merciful to alle þin wickednesses; þe which helþe alle þy sekenisses;sekenes.
Þe which ransoun-neþ þy lif fram deþ; þe which crouneþ þe wyþ mercy and pites;corouneþ: petes.
Þe which fulfilleþ þyMS. þe. desire in goddes; þy ȝengþe shal be made new as of an erne.þi: godes: ȝengeþ: egil.
Our Lord is doandCorrected from deand. mercies and iugement to alle þe suffrand wronge.dome: —þe.
He made hys waies knowen to Moyses, he did to þe childer of Israel her willes.
Our Lord is ryȝtful and merciable and of longe wille and michel merciable.r.] redeful.
He ne shal nouȝt wraþþe him wyþ-outen ende, [ne he ne shal nouȝt manacen wyþ-outen ende.]—ne: ende+& he schal noȝt manace with-oute ende.
He ne did nouȝt to us efter our synȝes, ne he nedid nouȝt follows next, but is expuncted and struck out. ȝeldeþ nouȝt to vs efteref on erasure. our wickednes.—ne: ne he ne] & he.
For efter þe heȝt of heuen fram erþe he streinþedMS. streined with a y or the abbreviation for ur over the interval between n and e. hys mercy vp hem þat dreden hym.strengþid: vp men dredyng hym.
He made fer fram us our wickednes, as þe este departeþ fram þe west.made+as.
As þe fader has mercy on his childer, our Lord is merciable of hem þat dreden hym; for he knoweHere an erasure of several letters follows. [our] faintes.of] to: knew our fayntenes.
He recorded þat we ben pouderMS. prude.; man ys as hai, hys daies ben as floureMS. floures, but s is dotted for deletion. of þe feld, so he shal florissen.were pouder: as a flour: felde+&.
For gost shal passen in hym; and he ne shal nouȝt dwelle, and he ne shal no more knowen his stede.—ne: —ne.
Þe mercy of our Lord is forsoþe fram wyþ-outen [ende vnto wyþ|outen ende] up hem þat dreden hym.with-oute + ende vnto with|oute ende.
And his riȝtfulnes is into child of childer to hem þa[t] kepen his testament.child] childer: þat.
And hij ben remembraunt of his comaundementȝ to don hem.remembryng.
Our Lord shal diȝten his sete in heuen, and his kyngdome shal lord-ship alle.
Ha alle his angeles, miȝtful of uertu, doand his worde, to here þe uoice of hys wordes, blisceþ our Lord.O: angels: blisseþ our Lorde doyng h. w. to his voice to be herd of h. w.
Ha alle his uertu, blisceþ our Lord; ȝe his ministris, þat don hys wille, blisced our Lord.O: vertus: blisced] blysseþ.
Ȝe alle werke of our Lord, blisceþ our Lord in alle stedes of his lordship; ha þou my soule, blische our Lord.werkes: o: blyss+to.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 103 (104).
DIV2.P: Ha þou my soule, blisce our Lord; ha Lord, mi God, þou art greteliche heried.O: o.
Þou clad schryft and fairnes, hiled wyþ lyȝt as wyþ cloþyng,cloþd.
Spredand out þe heuen as a skyn; þe which couered þe alder|heȝestnesMS. alder ȝe (ȝe is expuncted) heȝestnes. wyþ waters;þe w.] þat: alderheȝestnes] hiest þinges.
Þat settest þe cloude þy wendyng up; þat gost vp þe swiftnes of þe wynde;w. up] ascencyon.
Þat makest þyn angeles gostes, and þy ministres sengeand [fur];brennyng+fure.
Þat foundest þerþe vp his stablenes; it ne shal nouȝt be bowed in þe worled of þe worldes.—ne.
Depenes ys hys couertour as cloþyng; waters shul stonde vp mounteines.
Hij shul fle fram þe lackeinge, & hij shul douten of þe voice of þy þonder.l.] blame.
Þe mounteyns steyȝen up, and þe feldes fallen in-to þe stede þat-ou founded to hem.fell: foundeþ.
Þou setted þe terme, þe which hij ne shul nouȝt passe ouer; ne hij ne shul nouȝt be turned oȝain to hilen þerþe.sett: þe w.] þat: —ne: — ne: —ne: hely.
Þou þat sendest welles in valeis; þe waters shul passen amiddes þe mounteines.
Alle bestes of þe felde shul drynken, þe wilde asses shul abiden in her þrest.—þe wilde: ab.] haue byde: fryste.
Þe foules of heuen shullele begins a new linc. whonen vp þat erþe, þe waters shul ȝeuen voice of þe middel of þe stones.
Dewand þe mounteines of þyn ouermor, þerþe shal be fulfild of þe frut of þy werkes.Wateryng: ouermast+þinges.
Þou art bryngand forþe hay to meresMS. mere ci. and grasse to seruice of men;mere ci] bestes: gr.] herbe.
Þat tou brynge forþ brede of þerþe, and wyn glade mannes hert.
Þe tres of þerþe shul be fulfild, and þe cedres of Lyban, which he sette; sparowes shul make þer her nestes.of þe L. þat.
Þe hous of faucouns is her lader, þe heȝe mounteins to hertes, þe ston is refut to heyrouns.yrchounes.
He made þe mone in-to times, þe sonne knewe hys goingdoun.
Þou settest derkenes, and nyȝt ys made; al þe bestes of þerþe shul passen þer-ynne.
Þe whelpes of þe liouns rumyand, þat hij rauissen and aske metes to hem of God.and] þat þai.
Þe sonne ys rysen, and hij ben gadered, and shul be laid in her couches.MS. couthes.arys.
Man shal go forþ to his werke, and to his wircheing vn-to þe euenynge.
Hou michel þyn werkes ben heried, Lord! þou madest alle þynges in wisdome; þerþe is fulfild of þyn habbyng.possession.
Þis see hys michel and large to hondes; þer-inne ben crepand þynges, of which nis no noumbre:þis] þe: is.
Bestes litel wyþ michel; þer shul shippes passen:muche.
Þys dragon þatou fourmedest to by-gylen him: alle abyden, þatou ȝif to hem mete in tyme.made: ha-bydeþ.
Þe ȝeuand to hem, hij shul gaderen; þe openand þyn honde, alle þynges shul be fulfild of godenes.— hij: hondes.
Þe for-soþe turnand owai þy face, hij shul be trubled; þou shal take fram hem þy gost, and hij shul failen, and shul be turned into her poudre.For-soþe þe.
Sende for þyi.e. forþ þy gost, and hij shul be fourmed; and þou shalt make newe þe face of þerþe.for] forþe.
Be þe glorie of our Lord in þe world; our Lord shul gladen in his werkes;ioie.
Þe which lokeþ to þerþe and makeþ it to tremblen; þe which toucheþ þe mounteyns, and hij shul smoken.tougeþ: smeke.
Y shal syngen to our Lord inMS. and. my liif, and synge to my God as longe as ich am.and my] in my.
Be my word to hym ioiful; ich for-sothe shal gladen in our Lord.f. s. y.
Defailen þe synȝers of þerþe,MS. þe þerþe. and þe wicked so þat hij ne be nouȝt; ha, þou my soule, blisce our Lord.Defayle: þe þerþe] þe erþe: —ne: ha] o: —soule.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 104 (105).
DIV2.P: Shriueþ to our Lord, and clepeþMS. clepleþ. his name; telleþ amonges folke hys werkes.clepeþ.
Syngeþ to hym, and psalmeþ to hym; telleþ alle his wondres; be ȝe heried in hys holi name.
Glade þe hert of þe secheand our Lord; secheþMS. adds and here. our Lord, and beþ confermed; secheþ alway hys face.s. —and: confirmede.
By-þencheþ ȝou of his wondres þat he did; & his toknes ben þe iugementȝ of his mouþe.—þe: domes.
Ha þou sede of Abraham, his seruauntȝ; ha ȝe Iacob sones, his chosen,MS. repeats his chosen. biþencheþ of God.O: seruant: o.
He his þe Lord, our God; his iuge[me]ntȝ ben in alle erþe.domes.
He was by-þenchand in þe world of his testament, and of his world þat he sent into a þousand kyndes.in] of.
Which worde he ordeined to Abraham and his oþe to Ysaac.I. to] & (!).
And he stablist þat to Iacob in comaundement, and to þe sones of Israel in testament wyþ-outen ende,sett.
Saiand, Y shal ȝeue þe þe londe of Chanaan in a corde of [ȝ]our herytage.londe] bonde(!): ȝoure.
As yI.e., hy or hij (ei). were in lytel noumbre and her tyliersMS. tyriels. alderfewest:y] þei: tiliers.
And hij passeden fram folk to folk, and fram kyngdom to anoþer folk;
He ne suffred nouȝt man greuen hem, and he repruuedMS. repruuded. kynges fram hem,—ne: reproued k. for.
Saiand, Ne wil ȝe nouȝt touchen my prestes anoint wyþ creyme, and ne wylle ȝe nouȝt weryen in my prophetes.—ne: anoittyd: creme: —ne: curs.
And he cleped hunger vp þe londe of Chanaan, and de-fouled al þe fastnes of brede.defoiled.
Jacob sent þe man Joseph oȝayn his breþer, Joseph was solde to þral þurth hem.aȝens: þraldom þurȝ.
Hij loweden þe fete of Ioseph in fetteres, yren passed þourȝ þe soule of Iacob to þat þe word of Ioseph come to hym.made lowe: yse: come—to.
Þe word of our Lord brent Ioseph; þe kyng Pharaon sent for hym to þe prison, and vnbonde hym of bondes; þe prince of folk did hym of pyne.
He stablist hym lord of hyslord follows, but is dotted out. hous and prince of alle hys habbynge,st.] made: possession.
Þat he lered hys prynces as hym self and tauȝt hys elde quaintyse.schuld lere: schuld teche: olde men wysdome.
And þe fende anoied greteliche hys folk, and fastened it up hys enemys,it] him.
[Latin and English omitted.]& Israel entred in Egipt, & Jacob was tylier in þe londe of Cham.
Þe fende turned þe hertes of þe Egipciens, þat hij hated hys folk and dede trecherie oȝain Goddes seruauntes.of—þe: gyle aȝenes.
Our Lord sent Moyses, [hys] seruaunt, and þat Aaron þat he ches.Moises+his.
HeMS. Be. sett in hym wordes of his toknes and of his wondres in þe londe of Cham.He.
He sent derknisses,n is corrected from e. and made derke þe Egipciens, and ne enegred nouȝt þe wordes of Moyses, —ne: agreued.
He turned her waters into blode, and sloȝe her fisshes.
And her erþe ȝaf frosches in þynges of her kynges gode to parte.frogges.
Moyses seide to our Lord of þe hardnes of Egipciens, and hounde|fleȝes and gnattes comeþ in alle her londes.gnatteSecond t added over line. com.
He settMS. seit. her raynes hail and fur brynand in her londe;sett: rayne: brennyng.
And smote her vynes and her fygers,MS. fyngers. and defouled þe wode of her londe.—vynes a. her: figares: de|foiled.
Moyses seid to our Lord of þe hardnes of Pharaon in þe sones of Iacob, and grashoppes come and breses, of which no noumbre was of.breres: was—of.
And he ete alle þe hai in her londe, and ete al þe fruitOr frutt. of her londe.
And he smote alle þe first biȝetynge of her londe and þe first byȝetyng of alle her trauaile.
And he lad out Iacob sones wyþ gold and syluer, and syke man nas nouȝt founden in alle her kyn-redenis.was: kyndes.
Egipt was glad in þe forþgoing of Iacobes childer, for þe drede of hem touched vp hem.forgoyng: touchyng.
And he shewed cloude in-to her proteccioun and fur, þat it shuld alyȝt to hem by nyȝt.
Hij askeden flesches; and curlu come to hem, and fulfild hem of brede of heuen.of] with.
God brake þe stone, and waters ran out, and flodes ȝede þurȝ drienes.
For he was byþenchand of his holy worde, þe which he had to Abraham, hys childe.
And God lad forþ hys folk wyþ gladnes and hys chosen wyþ ioie.
And he ȝafBefore ȝaf a letter is erased. hem kyngdomes of men, and hij hadden þe trauailes of folkes,
Þat hij kepten riȝtfulnesses and soȝten his lawe.kepe riȝtfulnes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 105 (106).
DIV2.P: Shryueþ to our Lord, for he his God, for in þe world is his mercy.his m.] m.
Who shal speke þe myȝtes of our Lord? he shal make alle hys heryynges herd.
Blisced ben hij þat kepen iugement and don ryȝtfulnes in alle time.
Þenche, Lord, on vs in þe wele-likand of þy folk, and visit vs in þyne helþe,þi wel plesyng.
For to se in þe godenes of þyn chosen, to gladen in þe gladnisse of þy folke, þatou be heried in þyne herytage.þi godenes.
We han synȝed wyþ our fadres, we han wroȝt vnryȝtfullich, and we han don wickednisse.
Our fadres in Egipt ne vnderstode noȝt þyn wondres, and hij were nouȝt þenchand on þe multitude of þyn mercy.—ne.
And hij tariden þe Egipciens wendand vp inin added over the line. þe see, [þe Reed See;] and he saued hem for his name, þat he made his myȝt knowen.se+þe Rede See.
And he wyþ-droȝe þe Reed See, and it ys dried; and lad þe Egipciens in depenes as in þe desert. in—þe.
And he saued þe .xii. kindes of Iacob fram þe honde of þe enemy.
And þe water couerd þe trybuland hem, and þer ne laft nouȝt on of hem.couerde trublyng (men ex|puncted) hem: —ne.
And þe .xij. kindes byleueden his worde and heried his heryyng.
Sone hij faileden, and forȝaten hys werkes, and Here follows suffre, which is dotted out.ne susteined nouȝt hys conseil.—ne.
And hij couaited couaitise in desert, & tempteden God in driehede.couayte couatise: drynes.
And he ȝaf hem her askyng, & sent fulnes in-to her soules.
And hij tariden Moyses in castels & Aaron, þe holy of our Lord.wraþed: holy+man.
Þe erthe ys opened, & swolwed Datham, & couered vp þe gaderyng of Abyron.Dathan.
And fur brent in her sinagoge, & lait brent þe sinȝers.lyet.
And hij madenhym follows, but is expuncted. a chalf in Oreb, & anoured þyng made wyþ fingers.honoured.
And hij chaungeden her glorie in-to þe likenes of chalf etand haye.ioie: —þe: of+a.
Hij for-hatenBlunder for forȝaten. God þat saued hem, þat grete þynges did in Egipt, in þe londe of Cham, dredeful þynges in þe Reed Se.forȝate: Cham+&.
God seid þat he shuld for-done hem, ȝyf Moyses, his chosen, ne had nouȝt stonden in brekeyng in his syȝt;—ne.
Þat he turned hys wraþþe, þat he ne fordid hem nouȝt; and hij had for nouȝt þe londe desiderable.schuld turne: —ne: desir|able londe.
And hij ne leued nouȝt his worde & gruched in her tabernacles, and hij ne herd nouȝt þe voice of our Lord.—ne: beleuyd: —ne.
And he lifted his vengeaunce vp hem, þat he feld hem doun in wildernesse.lif(!).
And þat he out-kest her sede in þerþesMS. inberþes (?), the b being obliterated. and departed hem in kyngdomes.he schuld cast oute: þerþes] nacions: desparple—hem.
And hij ben sacrified to Belphegor, & eten þe pines of þe dampned.sacred: peynes.
And hij taried hym in her fyndynges, and fallyng doun is multi|plied in hem.—doun: in hem before is.
And Finees stode and plesed, & crossyng cessed.pl.] plantyd: crossyng] þe schakyng.
And it is teld to hym in-to ryȝtfulnes in kynde to kynde vn-to euere lastend.putt: in k.] fram k.: vnto e. l.] with-oute ende.
And hij tariden Moyses atte water of ȝainsygeinge, and he ys trauayled for hem þat greued hys gost.And taried at þe water of contradiccion.
And he distincted in his lippes; & hij ne sprad nouȝt men which our Lord seid to hem.depardid—in: ne spr.] sparpeled.
And hij ben meined among folk wyþ-outen lawe, and lerned her werkes, and serueden to her fals ym[a]ges, and þat ys made to hem in sclaunder.mengyd: ymages—and.
And hij sacrifiden her sones and her douters to debleries,Or dobleries.doȝters to fendes.
And shadde blode nouȝt filed, and blode of her sones and her douȝters, which hij sacrified to þe fals ymages of Chanaam.bl. n. f. and bl.] vngilty bl.: which] þat.
And þer[þe] is slaine for synȝes & filed in her werkes, & dede horedome in her fyndeinges.þer] þe erþe: slawe: foiled: fornicacion.
And our Lord wraþed hym in hys vengeaunce oȝains his folk, and loþed hys heritage.
And he ȝaf hem in-to þe hondes of folkes wyþ-outen lawe, and hij þat hated hem lord-shipped hem. lordsh.] had lordschip of.
And her enemys trubled hem, and hij ben meked vnder her hondes; often our Lord deliuerd hem of iuel.maked: oft: deliuereþ.
Hij for-soþe greueden him in her conseils, and hij ben lowed in her wickednisses.F. s. þai: wykkydnes.
And he seȝe whan hij were trubled, & herd her praier.
And he was by-þen-chand on hys testament, & it hym for-þouȝt efter þe multitude of hys mercy.
And he ȝaf hem in his mercies in syȝt of alle þat hadde taken hem.
Ha Lord God, make us sauf, & gader us to-gider of straunge kynredens,to-gader fram str. nacions.
Þat we shryue to þyn holy name, & þat we gladen in þy heryynge.
Be our Lord, God of Israel, blisced of þys world, here and vnto þe world þat euer shal last; & alle þe puple shal saie, Be it don, be it don.folke.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 106 (107).
DIV2.P: Shryueþ to our Lord, for he ys gode, for in þe world ys hys mercy.
Siggen hij nov þat ben bouȝt of our Lord, which he bouȝtMS. brouȝt. fram þe honde of þe enemy, of straunge kyngdomes he gadered hem.brouȝt] bouȝt.
Fram þe rysyng of þe sunneMS. synȝes. vnto þe goynge adoune, fram þe norþe & þe see.sunne: ad.] doune.
Þe childer of Israel erreden in onhede & in dryhede, and hij ne fonde nouȝt þe waie of ioye euer lastand.wyldernes: —ne.
Hungerand & þrestand,Or þrostand. her soule faileden in hem.affrystyng.
And hij criden to our Lord, as hij were trubled, & hij deliuered hem of alle her nedefulnes.MS. herne de fulnes, the u being corrected from another letter.
And he lad hem in þe ryȝt waie, þat hij hedenMiswritten for ȝeden. into ioieMS. ieie. euerlastandȝode: euerlastyng ioie.
Shryue to our Lord hys mercies, & hys wonders to mennes sones.Be our Lordes mercies know to our Lorde: men.
For he fulfild idel soule, and fulfild hungriMS. hunger. soules of godes,hungry soule with.
Sittand in derknes & in shadue of deþ, bonden in wrechedhede [&] in iren.schade: wrechidnes & in yse.
For hij anegreden þe wordes of our Lord, & maden vain þe conseil of þe heȝest.wreþid.
And her hert ys lowed in her trauailes, and hij ben syke; & þer nas non þat halpe hem.was: helpid.
And hij crieden to our Lord, as hij weren trubled, & he deliuered hem of alle her nedefulnisses.as] wen: nedefulnes.
And he lad hem fram derknesses & shadowe [of deþ], & brake her bondes.derknes: schade+of deþ.
Shryue to our Lord hys mercies & hys wonders to mennes sones.Sh.] Be know: men.
For he de[fouled] þe ȝates of brasse, & brake þe lockes of iren.de] defoyled: yse.
He toke hem fram þe waie of wickednes, for hij ben lowed for her vnryȝtfulnes.
Her soule wlated al techyng of helþe, & aproched to þe ȝates of deþ.wl.] had abhominacion: ap. to] com nere.
And hij criden to our Lord, as hij weren trubled; and he deliuered hem of alle her nedefulnisses.sturbled: nedefulnes.
Shryue to our Lord hys mercies, & hys wondres to mennes sones,knoulegeþ: men.
Þat hij [sacrifien] sacrifice of heryynge and telle his werkes in ioie.þai+sacrifie.e on erasure of two letters.
Þe which comen in-to þe see in shippes, makand wercheingeMS. wrecheinge. in mani waters,wyrchyng.
Hij seȝen þe werkes of our Lord, & his wonders in þe depenes.
God seid, & þe gost of tempest stode, & his flodes ben anheȝed.
Hij steȝen vp vnto þe heuens, & fallen a-doun into depnes; her soule quoke in yuels.styed: —þe: fell: schakid.
Hij ben trubled, and hij ben stired as drunken, and alle her wisdomes is deuoured.sturbled: mouyd: wysdome.
And hij criden to our Lord, as hij were trubled; and he lad hem out of her nedefulnisses.when: sturbled: nedefulnes.
And he stablist his tempest in þe wynde, & alle his flodes were stille.stabled.
And hij ioiden, for þe flodes were stille; and God lad hem to þe hauen of her wille.
Shryue to our Lord is mercies, & his wondres to mennes sones.Be know: is] his: men.
And heȝen hij hym in þe chirches of folkes, & heri hym in þe chaier of olde.olde+men.
HeHer MS. sett her flodes in desert & þe goinges of waters in þrust,He: vschus: þurst.
Erþe berand frut in saltmerche for þe wickednesse of þe wonand þer-inne.saltmersche: of men wonnyng.
He sett þe desert in pondes of waters, & þerþe wyþ-outen water at out-goynge of waters.atte þe vschus.
And he sett þerþe hungri, & hij stablist cite of wonyng.stabled+þe.
And hij sewen feldes, and sett vines, & maden frut of birþe.sowed: beryng.
And he blisced hem, and hij ben michel multiplied; & he ne litteled nouȝt her meres.blessed: —ne: bestes.
And hij ben made fewe, & ben trauailed fro þe tribulacion of wicked & fro sorow.
Strif is haldMS. hard. vp þe princes, & þe fende made hem to erren in wilde stede, & nouȝt in þe waie.hard] schad: in way.
And he halpe þe pouer of his mesais, & set þe menȝes as shepe.heped (!): myssays: menȝe.
Þe ryȝtful shul sen & gladen, & alle wicked shal stoppe her mouþe.
Which wise shal kepe þes þynges & vnderstonde þe merciMS. merþi (struck out) merci. of our Lord?What w.+man.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 107 (108).
DIV2.P: Ha God, myn hert hys made redi; myn hert his made redy, & y shal syngen, & y shal psalmen in my glorie.syng &—y shal: ioie.
Aryse sautrie & harpe, and y shal arysen in þe morwenyng.sauter: harp—and: mornyng.
Y shal shryue to þe, Lord, for þe folkes; and y shal syngen to þe for þe kyndes.—Lord.
For þy mercy ys grete vp þe heuens, & þy soþenes is vn-to þe cloudes.vp—þe.
Be þou an-heȝed vp þe heuenes; & þy glorie is vp alle þerþe, þat þyn frendes ben deliuered.ioie.
Make me sauf, & here me for þy myȝt; God spak in hys holy.
Y shal gladen & departen þe dryhede, & y shal mete þe ualeye of tabernacles.dryhode.
Galaad ys myn, & Manasses is myn, Effraym ys þe takeyng of myn heued.
Juda ys my kynge, Moab is þe caudron of myn hope.
Y shal shewe myn hoseing in Ydume; strange ben made my frendes.made] mde(!).
Who shal lede me in-to a cite warnist? who shal lede me in-to Ydume?warnischt.
Noȝt þou, God, þat put vs oway; & þou ne shal nouȝt, God, gon out in our vertuȝ.puttest: —ne.
Ȝyf vs helpe of tribulacioun, for helþe of man ys ydel.
We shal do vertu in God, and he shal bringe to nouȝt our enemis.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 108 (109).
DIV2.P: Ha God, ne haue þou nouȝt stilled myn heryynge; for þe mouþe of þe synȝer & þe mouþeMS. repeats & þe mouþe. of þe trecherous is open up me.O Godd, þou schalt noȝt still myn herying: gileful is opned.
And hij spaken to me wyþ trecherous tunge, and encumpassed [me] wyþ wordes of hating, & faȝten wyþ meFollowed by wylle, which is dotted out. wyþ wille.gyleful: enclosed+me.
For þat þe gode loued me, þe wicked bacbiten me; & ich praied for hem.þe g.] Godd: bakbytyd.
And hij sett to me iuels for godes & hate for my loue.gode.
Stables þe synȝer vp þe wicked; & þe fende stonde at hys ryȝthalf.Sett: stonde þe f.: r. syde.
As he ys iuged, go he out condempned, & be hys prayer made into synȝe.When: demyd.
Ben his dayes made fewe, & anoþer tak his bischopriche.MS. bischop bride.take ane oþer: byschopriche.
Ben hys childer made faderles, & wif widowe.&+his.
Be hys sones made stumbland, & biggen hij; and ben hij outcusten of her woninges.sturblyng: begg: outecaste.
Secheþ þe usurer alle hys substaunce, & þe straunge rauisraines MS. her trauales.Seche: rauische: trauailes.
Ne be nouȝt to hym helper, ne þer ne be non þat haue pite of his moderles.—Ne: ne þer ne be] & be þer.
Be his childer made in-to deþ, & be hys name don oway in o kynde.into o k.
Turne þe wickednes of hys fadres in-to mynde in þe siȝt of our Lord, and þe synȝe of his moder be nouȝt don oway.
Hij ben made al-way oȝains our Lord, & peris [her] mynde fram þerþe, for þat he ne had nouȝt in mynde to do mercy,Be þai: perisch+her: —ne.
And pursued þe gode man, þe mesays and þe biggeand, & to sle man prikked in hert.And+he: mysays: beggar.
And he loued waryynge, & it shal come to hym; and he nold nouȝt blisceing, & it shal be don fer fram hym.curssyng: wolde.
And he cloþed wareing as cloþyng, & it entred as water in-to his in-nermast þinges & as oile in his bones.warying: innermast þ.] en|trailes.
Be made to hym as cloþyng, wyþ which he is [couered, & as a girdel, wyþ which he is] euermore girt.Be] He: euerm. girt] couerd & as a girdel with which he is euer gyrd.
Þis þe werk of hem þat bacbiten me to our Lord, & hij þat speken iuel þynges oȝain my soule.
& þou, Lord, do mercy wyþ me for þy name; for þy mercy is mylde.meke.
Deliuer me of iuel; for ich am nedeful & pouer, and myn hert is trubled wyþ-innen me.sturbled.
Ich am don oway as shadowe, whan it boweþ doun, & ich am shaken out as grashoppes.shaken] smyte.
Myn knowes ben sike ledThus MS., for sikelech, siklich? of fastyng, & my flesshe is chaunged for oile.beþ vnfast for fastyng.
And ich am made to hem vpbraidynge; & hij seiȝen me, & styreden her heuedes.reproue: moued.
Ha Lord, my God, helpe me; make me sauf efter þy mercy.O.
And hij shul wyten þat þys his þyn helpe, and þou, Lord, made it.
Hij shul waryen, and þou shalt bliscen; be hii confounded þat arisen oȝains me, & þy seruant shal gladen.cursse: blise.
Ben hij cloþed wyþ shame þat bacbiten me, ben hij couered wyþ confusion as wyþ double cloþyng.
Y shal shryue michel to our Lord in my mouþe, & y shal herien hym amiddes mani,muche.
Þe wichMS. wicked. stode at þe ryȝt-half of þe pouer in gost, þat he made me sauf fram þe pursuand my soule.w.] whych: r.side: fram men pursuyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 109 (110).
DIV2.P: Þe Lord, fader of heuen, seid to his sone, my Lord, Sitt þou at my ryȝthalf,r. side.
Þer-whiles þat y sett þyn enemys shamel of þy fete.Corrected from fote.—þat: sh.] þe stole.
Our Lord shal sende fram Syon Marie, þe ȝerde of þy vertu; lord|ship þou in-middes þin enemys.lordsh . . . .inm.] forto haue lordschipe amyddes.
Þe bi-ginynge is wyþ þe in þe daie of þy uertu in shinynges of holy, ymade wyþ me of my pouste to-fore Lucifer.holy+men: power.
Our Lord swore, and it ne shal nouȝt forþenchen hym; þou art prest wyþouten ende efter þe order of Melchisedech.—ne.
Our Lord is at þy ryȝthalf, & he shal for-don kynges in þe daie of his ire.r. side.
He shal iuge in kyndes & fulfillenMS. fulfild. fallinges; he shal crouse in erþe þe wicked dedes of mani.deme: fulfil: schake.
He drank in þe way of þe wille of grace, for-þy he heȝed his heued.wille . . . þy] well of þe well of gr. þer-fore.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 110 (111).
DIV2.P: Lord, y shal shryue to þe in al myn hert in þe conseil & in þe gaderyng of ryȝtful.
Þe werkes of our Lord be grete, soȝt in-to alle his willes.
His werkMS. werkes, but es is dotted out. ys shryf and hereing, &MS. in. his ryȝtfulnes woneþ in þe heuen.werkes(!) is schryft: hery|ing &: —woneþ.
Our Lord piteful & merciful made minde of his wondres; he ȝaf mete to þe doutand hym.to men dredyng.
He shal be biþenchand in þe world of his testament; he shal tellen to his folk þe vertu of his werkes.beþencher of his t. into þe w.
Þat he ȝaf hem heritage of men, þe werkes of his hondes ben soþenisse & iugement.ȝif: soþnes & dome.
Alle hys comaundementȝ ben trew, confermedThe second e corrected from o. in þe worled of world, made in soþenes & euenhede.euenhode.
Our Lord sent raunsoun to his folk, & comaunded hys testament wyþ-outen ende.
His name is holy & dredeful, þe biginnyng of wisdome is dredyng of our Lord.dredyng] drede.
Gode vnderstondynge ys to alle doand [hym]; his hereing woneþ in þe heuens.doyng+him (added over line): herying: in—þe.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 111 (112).
DIV2.P: Blisced be þe man þat douteþ our Lord; he shal wil greteliche in his comaundementȝ.dredeþ.
His sede shal be ryȝtful in erþe; þe kynde of þe ryȝtful shal be blisced.be r.] be miȝtful: be+be.
Glorie & riches ben in his hous, & his ryȝtfulnes woneþ in heuens.Ioie.
Lyȝt hys sprungen in derkenes to þe ryȝtful; merciful & reuful & riȝtful.sprong: reuf.] peteful.
Þat man shal be ioieful þat haþ pite and laneþ & ordeineþ his wordes in iugement, for he ne shal nouȝt be stired wyþ-outen ende.dome: —ne: mouyd.
Þe ryȝtful shal be in mynde euerlastand, & he ne shal nouȝt douten of iuel hereing.MS. herieing.—ne: heryng.
His hert is diȝt to hope in our Lord, & his hert is confermed; & he shal nouȝt be stired to þat he despise his enemis.confirmed: mouyd.
He de-parted, & ȝaf to pouer; is ryȝtfulnes wones in þe heuens, his heued shal be an-heȝed in glorie.woneþ in—þe: ioie.
Þe synȝer shal sen is iuel and be wroþe, and he shal gnaist wyþ his teþ for pynes, and he shal failen of holines; þe desire of þe synȝers shal peris.grynte: paynes: of—þe.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 112 (113).
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe childer, herieþ our Lord, herieþ þe name of our Lord.O.
Be þeMS. he. name of our Lord blisced, nou of þis & vnto heuen.he] þe: nou . . . heuen] fram þis tyme withoute ende.
Þe name of our Lord ys worþshipful fram þe birþe of þe sunneMS. sinȝe. vnto þe going-doun.worschipful: rysyng: sune.
Our Lord is heȝe vp alle men, & his glorie his vp heuens.aboue heuen.
Who is as God, our Lord, þat woneþ on heȝt & loked to þe meke þinges in heuen & in erþe?lokeþ: &—in.
Liftand þe mysays fram þerþe & dressand up þe pouer out of dung,Areryng.
Þat he sett him wyþ princes, wyþ princes of his folk;wiþ þe princes of h. popill.
Þat doþ þe barain moder of childer to wonen in þe hous ioyand.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 113 (114).
DIV2.P: In þe out-going of þe childer of Israel of Egipt, of þe men of Iacob hous [fram] þe strange folk,out-g.] passyng oute: hous+fram.
Iude is made his halwyng, Israel is made his pouste.power.
Þe see saȝe hem, & fled hem; and so his þe flum Iordan [turned] oȝain[ward].oȝain] turned aȝenward.
Hij hedeni e. heiden, heȝeden. þe mounteyns as weþeres, & þe littel hilles as lambren of shepe.Hij . . . m.] þe mountaynes ioed(!): lambren] bombe(!).
Ha þou see, what þyng is to þe, þat tou fleddest, & þou flum Iordan, for þou art turned oȝainward?O: —þyng.
Ha ȝeȝe added over line. childer of Israel, ȝe anheȝed þe mounteyns [as weþeres] and þe littel hulles as lambren of shepe.O: m.+as weþers: lombe.
Þe erþe is stired fram þe face of our Lord, fram þe face of God of Iacob;mouyd: Lorde+&.
Þe which turned þe stone to flodes of waters and þe roche to welles of waters.þe wh. t.] He þat turneþ: flode.
(PSALM 115.) Nouȝt to us, Lord, nouȝt to us; bot ȝif glorie to þy name.
Be we vp þy mercy and vp þy soþenes, þat þe folk ne say nouȝt, Wher is her God?—ne. 3. is+in.
For-soþe our God is [in] heuen; he made al þyng þat he wolde.
Þe ymagerie of men wyþ-outen lawe ben gold and seluer, werkes of mennes hondes.maumetrie.
Hij han mouþe, & hij ne shal nouȝt speken; hij han eȝen, & hij ne shal nouȝt se.—ne: —ne.
Hij han eren, and hij ne shul nouȝtThe words and hij ne shul nouȝt are erroneously dotted out. [heren; hij] han noses, and hij ne shul nouȝt smullen.—ne: I. noȝt+here þai: — ne: smell.
Hij han hondes, & hij ne shul nouȝt fele; hij han fete, & hij ne shul nouȝt gon; hij ne shul nouȝt crien in her þrote.—ne: —ne: —ne: crie with.
Hij þat maken hem be liche to hem, & hij þat affien in hem.be] be þai made: hij þ. aff.] all þat beleueþ.
Þe folk of þe hous of Israel hoped in our Lord; he is her helper & her defendour.—of þe hous.
Þe hous of Aaron hoped in our Lord; he his her helpe[r] & her defendour.h.] folke: helper.
Hij þat dreden our Lord hoped in our Lord, he his her helper & her defendour.in+hym.
Our Lord was þenchand on vs, and blesced us.
He blisced þe folk of Israel, he blesced þe folk of Aaron.blessed: Israel+&: blessed+to.
He blisced alle þat douten our Lord, þe littel wyþ þe mechel.dredeþ.
Cast ourr on erasure. Lord grace vp ȝou, vp ȝou & up ȝour sones.MS. fones.childer.
Blisced be heRead ȝe. god of our Lord, þat made heuen and erþe.ȝe gode.
Þe heuens ȝauen heuen to our Lord, & he ȝaf þerþe to mennes sones.
Þe dampned, Lord, ne shul nouȝt herien þe, ne alle þo þat descenden in-to helle.Lorde þe d.—ne: ne] no.
Bot we þat lyuen, blisce our Lord nou and þanne vnto þe worled.nou . . . ] fram now vnto þe w.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 114 (116).
DIV2.P: Ich loued our Lord; for our Lord shal here þe voice of my praier.
For he bowed his ere to me, & y shal clepe him in mi daies.& in my d. y sch. c. h.
Sorowes of deþ ȝede a-bouȝt me, & þe perils of helle fonde me.þe sorows: ȝede ab.] aclosed (d is corrected from þ): fonde] haþ founde.
Y funde tribulacion & sorowe, & cleped þe name of our Lord.fonde: cl. our Lordis n.
Ha þou Lord, ryȝtful & merciable, deliuer my soule; and our Lord haþ mercy.O.
Our Lord is kepand þe littel; ich am made buxum, & he deliuered me of iuels.
Turne my soule in-to þy reste, for our Lord haþ don wele to me.
For he defended my soule fram deþ, myn eȝen fram teres, myn fete fram slideinge.teres+&.
Y shal pleise to our Lord in þe kyngdom of þe leueand.plese: leuyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 115 (116 continued).
DIV2.P: Y byleued þat y spake; ich am for-soþe michel lowed.muche.
Y said in my passing, Ich man is liȝer.
What þyng shal y ȝeue to our Lord for alle þyng þat he haþ ȝeuen to me?—þyng: ȝelde: þinges—þat.
Y shal take þe chalice of helþe & clepe þe name of our Lord.&+y schal.
Y shal ȝelde to our Lord myn vowesMS. bowes. to-fore alle his folk; þe deþ of his holy is precious in þe siȝt of our Lord.vowes: holy+men: in . . . Lord] in his siȝt.
Ha Lord, for þat ich am þy seruauntMS. seruanut. & þe sone of þyn honde|maiden,O Lorde fo (!) y am þi s.+y am þi seruant: honde-mayde.
Þou to-brak myn bondes; y shal sacrefie to þe offrand of hereing, & y shal clepen þe name of our Lord.þou brake: offryng.
Y shal ȝelde vowes to our Lord in þe siȝt of alle his folke, in þe halles of þe hous of our Lord amiddes of Ierusalem.of þe Jerusalem.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 116 (117).
DIV2.P: Ȝe alle folkes, herieþ our Lord; ȝe alle folkes, herieþ hym.
For his mercy is confermed vp us, and þe soþenes of our Lord woneþ wyþ-outen ende.c.] fest.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 117 (118).
DIV2.P: Þe folkes, shriueþ to our Lord, for he his God; for his mercy is in þe worled.Ȝe: in þe w.] with-oute ende.
Saie nov þe folk of Israel, for he his god, for in þe world is his mercy.for our Lord is gode, for his mercye is with-oute ende.
Saie nov þe hous of þe folk of Aaron, for his mercy ys in þe world.folk of þe hous of Aa.: i. þ. w.] with-oute ende.
Saien hij nov þat dreden our Lord, for in þe wor[l]d is his mercy.for his mercy is withoute ende.
Ich cleped our Lord in my tribulacioun, and our Lord herd me in brede.brodnes.
Be our Lord myn helper, & y shal despisen myn enemys.
Gode is to affien in our Lord þan to affien in man.Better is to leue: leue.
Gode is to hopen in our Lord þan to hopen in princes.Better.
Alle folkes wyþ-outen lawe bisett me wyþ iuels, and in þe name of our Lord; for ich am venged in hem.
Þe encumpassand iuels encumpassed me wyþ iuels, and in þe name of our Lord; for ich am venged in hem.Omitted.
Hij encumpassed me asHere of follows, but is expuncted. ben, & brenden as fur in þornes, & in þe name of our Lord; for ich [am] venged in hem.closed: bene &+þay: y+ am.
Ich am putt oȝain & turned oȝain, þat y shuld fallen, & our Lord toke me vp.—2. oȝain.
Our Lord ys my strengþe & myn hereing, & he is made to me in-to helþe.herying.
He is voice of ioie & of helþe in þe tabernacles of ryȝtful.
Þe help of our Lord did vertu, þe helpe of our Lord anheȝed me, þe helpe [of] our Lord did vertu.help] riȝt honde: did] haþ made: h.] riȝt honde: haþ enhied: h.] riȝt honde of: did] haþ made.
Y ne shal noȝt dien, bot y shal liuen & telle þe werkes of our Lord.—ne: but—y schal: &+ schal.
Our Lord chastiand chastied [me], & ne ȝaf me nouȝt to deþ.chastesyng chasted+me: —ne.
Openeþ to me þe ȝates of riȝtfulnes; ich, entred in-to hem, shal shriue to our Lord; þat is þe ȝate of our Lord, þe ryȝtful shul entren þer-inne.þeriȝtful] r. men: inne] þurgȝ.
Y shal shryue to þe, forMS. repeats þe for. þou herd me; & þou art made to me in-to helþe.Y] Lorde, y.
Þe stone which þe biggand reproued, and it is made oȝain þe heuedMS. heried. of þe corner.wh.] þat: þe b.] þai: and it] þat: oȝ. þ. h.] into þe heuyd.
Þis þynge is made of our Lord, and it is wonder-ful in our eȝen.
Þis ys þe daie þat our Lord made; ioie we, glade we in yt.in yt] þer-in.
Ha Lord, make me sauf; ha Lord, be þou wele enprospered; blisced be he þat comeþ in þe name of our Lord.w. enpr.] in well-fare.
We haue blisced ȝou of þe hous of our Lord; God is our Lord, and he shone vnto vs.God . . . vs] & Godd our Lorde liȝtyd to vs.
Stablis þe solempne daie in þikkenesses vnto corner of þe auter.St. þe] Ych ordeyned te a: vnto+þe.
Þou art my God, & y shal shryue to þe; [þou art my God, & y shal an-heȝe þe].þe+þou art my God, & ych schal enhye þe.
Y shal shryue to þe, for þou herd me; and þou art made to me into helþe.
Shriueþ to our Lord, for he his God; for his mercy is in þe world.i. þ. w.] with-oute ende.

DIV3.HEAD: Aleph.Aleph is omitted in MS.
DIV3.P: Þe vnfiled in her waie ben blisced, þat gon in þe lawe of our Lord.Þe . . . bl.] Blyssid be þe vnfilde: lawe] way.
Ben hi blesced þat sechen his witnes & sechen hem in alle his hert.Blissyd be þai: her hert.
For hij þat wirchen wickednes, ne ȝede nouȝt in his waies.—ne.
Þou comaunded þy comaundement to ben greteliche kept.sent þi commaundmentes.
God ȝyf þat min waies ben dresced for to kepe þy ryȝtfulnes.Godd wold: —ben.
Þanne shal y nouȝt be confounded, whan ichaue loked in alle þyn comaundementȝ.y schal loke.
Y shal shryue to þe in drescynge of hert, in þat ichaue lerned þe iugementȝ of þy ryȝtfulnes.þat+þat: domes.
Y shal kepe þy ryȝtfulnes; ne forsake me nouȝt in no manere.riȝtfulnesses—ne.

DIV3.HEAD: Beth.
DIV3.P: In what þynge amendeþ þe ȝenge man his waie in keping þy wordes?ȝonge—man.
Ichaue bi-soȝt þe in alle myn hert, ne putt me nouȝt owaie fram þyne comaundementȝ.—ne.
Ich hidde þy spekynges in myn hert, þat y ne synȝesynȝe on erasure. nouȝt to þe.speches: —ne.
Ha Lord, þou art blisced; teche me þy ryȝtfulnisses.ryȝtfulnes.
Ichaue shewed for-þe in myn lippes alleMS. atte. þe iugementȝ of þy mouþe. all þe domes.
Ich delithed me in þe waie of þy witnisses asMS. twice as. in alle riches.delityd: richesses.
Y shal be haunted in þy comaundement, & y shal sen þyn waies.vsed: commaundmentes.
Y shal be þenchand in þyn ryȝtfulnesses, & y ne shal nouȝt for-ȝete þyn wordes.be vsyd in þi riȝtwysnesses: —ne.
