DIV3.HEAD: Gymel.
DIV3.P: Ha God, ȝif grace to þy seruaunt, & quike me; & y shal kepe þyn wordes.make me qwyk.
Shewe myn eȝen, and y shal kepe þe wondres of þy lawe.
Ich am tilier in erþe, ne hide þou noȝt fram me þyn comaunde|ment.—ne: commaundmentes.
My soule haþ couaited for to desiren þy ryȝtfulnesses in alle time.c.] couayte: ryȝtfulnes.
Þou blamed þe proude; hij ben weried þat bowen fram þyn comaundement.curssed: declineþ: command|mentis.
Do fro me vpbradeing & despite, for ich haue soȝt þyn witnisses.reproue—& despite.
For princes seten and spoken oȝains me; þin seruaunt for-soþe was haunted in þy riȝtynnges.For+soþe: —for-soþe: vsed in riȝtwysnesses.
For myHere þoute follows first, but it is dotted out. þouȝt is þy witnisses, & þy ryȝtfulnisses ben m[i] conseil.mynde: & my conseyle is þi riȝtwysneses(!).

DIV3.HEAD: Beleth.
DIV3.P: My soule drow to stablenes; quike me efter þy worde.drow] cleuyd: make me quyk.
Ich told myn waies, and þou herdest me; teche me þy ryȝtful|nisses.schewyd.
Teche me þee on erasure. way of þy ryȝtfulnes, and y shal be haunted in þy wondres.ryȝtfulnesses: vsyd.
My soule trembleþ for anguisse; conferme me in þy wordes.trembled: confirme.
Do fro me þe way of wickednes, & haue mercy on me for þy lawe.& of þil. haue mercye on me.
Y chese þe way of þe soþenes, and y ne for-ȝate nouȝt þyn iugementȝ.—ne: domes.
Lord, y droȝ to þyn wittenisses, ne wil þou nouȝt confounde me.droȝ] haue cleuyd: —ne.
Ichaue vrnen þe wai of þy comaundementȝ, as tou enlarged mi hert in godnisse.ȝorne: sprad.

DIV3.HEAD: He.
DIV3.P: Sett, Lord, lawe to me, way of þyn ryȝtynges, & y shal euer seche it.way] þe lawe: riȝt|wysnesses.
Ȝif me vnderstondyng; and y shal seche þy lawe & kepe it in alle myn hert.kepe] y schal kepe.
Lade me in þe bi-stiȝe of þy comaundement, for ich wold it.paþe: commaundmentȝ.
Bowe myn hert into þy witnisses, & nouȝt in-to auarice.
Turne owai myn eȝen, þat yi.e. hy=Latin ei. ne se no uanites; quik me in þyHere name follows, but is expuncted and struck out. waie.y ne] þai: make me qwyk.
Stablisce to þy seruant þy worde in þy drede.Sett.
Schre[d] owai my reproce, þat ich haue in suspeccioun; for þyn iugementȝ ben ioiful.Cutt away my reproue: sus|pecyon: domes.
Se, ich couaited þy comaundementȝ; quike me in þin euennisse.Lo: couayte: make me qwyk.

DIV3.HEAD: Vau.MS. Paau.
DIV3.P: & cum þy mercy, Lord, vp me, þyn helþe efter þy spekynge.
And y shal answere to þe reprouaund to me word, for ich hoped in þy wordes.wordes] worders.
And ne do þou noȝt out of my mouþe worde of soþenes in non maner, for ich hoped in þin iugement.—ne: domes.
And y shal kepe þy lawe euer more in þe world and in þe heuen.into þe w. & in h.
And ich ȝede in brede, for ichaue souȝt þyn comaundementȝ.
And y spake of þin witnes in syȝt of kynges, & y ne was nouȝt confounded. witnesses: —ne.
And y shal þenchen in þin comaundementȝ, which y loued.wh.] þat.
Y ne lefted myn hondes to þy comaundementȝ, þat y loued; and y shal be haunted in þy riȝtinges.& y lift+vp: vsed: riȝtful|nesses.

DIV3.HEAD: Zai.
DIV3.P: Be þo biþenchand on þy worde to þy seruaunt, in which þou ȝaf me hope.þou: in+þe: me h.] hope to me.
Þis hope conforted me in my meknes, for þi spekyng quikened me.speche made me qwyk.
Þe proude deden iuel on ich a side; y for-soþe ne bowed nouȝt fram þy lawe.iuel . . . side] wickydlych on ech syde &: —ne.
Ich was, Lord, biþenchand on þy iugementȝ of þe world, & ich [am] conforted.Lorde y was: domes: y am conforde.
Defaut held me for þe synȝers for-sakand þi lawe.
Þy riȝtinges were songelich to me instede of my pilgrimage.riȝtfulnesses were praysable: in þe st.
Ich was, Lord, bi-þenchand of þy name in þe niȝt, & ich kept þy lawe.Lord y was.
Þy[s] lawe is made to me, for þat y soȝt þyn riȝtinges.þy] þis: riȝtfulnesses.

DIV3.HEAD: Beth.
DIV3.P: Ha Lord, myn porcioun, y seid to kepen þy lawe.Ha . . . seid] Lorde y sayde is (!).
Ich bi-þouȝt þy face in alle min hert; haue mercy on me efter þy worde.
Ich bi-þouȝt myn waies, and turned my fet into þy witnesses.
Ich am made redy; & y nam nouȝt ytroubled, þat y kepe þy comandementȝ.am noȝt made sturbled (u added over the line).
Þe wickednisses of sinȝers enbraceden me, & y ne for-ȝate nouȝt þy law.enbr.] haþ enclosed: —ne.
Ich ros vp at midniȝt to shriue to þe vp þe iugement of þy riȝtinge.domes: riȝtwysnes.
Ich am partener of alle þe dredand þe & kepand þy comaundementȝ.partyner: all men dredyng.
Þerþe, Lord, is ful of þy mercy; teche me þin ryȝtinges.Lorde þe erþe: riȝtwysnesses.

DIV3.HEAD: Teth.
DIV3.P: Lord, þou didest godenes wiþ þy seruaunt efter þy worde.efter] ef(!).
Teche me godenes, discipline, and cuningeMS. tuninge.; for ich bileued in þy comaundement.d.] lore: cunnyng: com|maundmentȝ.
Y trespassed to-forn þat y was lowed; for-þy y kept þy worde.þer-for.
Þou art gode; & teche in þy godenes þyn ryȝtynges.& þig. teche me þiriȝtwysnes.
Þe wicked[nes] of prideShould be prude, proude. is multiplied up me; y shal seche for|soþe in alle myn hert þyn comaundementȝ.wickydnes of proude+men: for-soþe y schal seche.
Her hert is runnen to-gideres as milk, ich for-soþe soȝt þy lawe.ȝorne to-gider: for-soþe y had in mynde þi l.
Gode þing it is to me, þat þou lowedest me, þat ich lerne þy riȝtinges.—it: made me meke: riȝt|wysnesses.
Gode þyng ys to me þe lawe of þy mouþe vp a þousand talens of seluer & gold.talentes: &+of.

DIV3.HEAD: Loth.
DIV3.P: Þyn hondes made me, & fourmed me; ȝeue me vnderstondynge, þat ich lern þyn comaundementȝ.
Hij þat dreden þe shul sen me & gladen, for ich vp hoped in þy wordes.drede me(!): se þe: —vp.
Ich knew, Lord, þat þyn iugement ben euenhede, & þou lowedest me in þy soþnes. domes: euennes: in þi s. þou made me meke.
Be þy mercy made þat it conforted me; be it made to þy seruaunt efter þy worde.conforte.
Cum to me þyn mercies, & y shal liue; for þy lawe is my þenching.þi m. to me: mynde.
Ben þeMS. þy. proude confounded, for hij diden wickednes in me wyþ wrong; y for soþe shal be haunted in þy comaundementȝ.þy pr.] proude men: haue do w. wrongfulich aȝens me, f. s. y was vsyd.
Be þe dredand þe turned to me, & hij þat knowen þy witnes.þe dr.] men dredyng: knew.
Be myn hert made vnfiled inMS. in in. þy riȝtinges, þat ich ne be nouȝt confounded.riȝtfulnesses: —ne.

DIV3.HEAD: Chap.
DIV3.P: My soule failed in þin helþe, & ich hoped in þi worde.
Min eȝen faileden in þy worde, saiand, Whan shal tou conforten me?
For ich am made as way in rimfrost; y ne haue nouȝt forȝeten þy riȝtinges.as+a: horefrost: —ne: riȝtfulnesses.
Hou mani ben þe daies of þi seruaunt? whan shalt tou make iugement of þe pursuand me?
Þe wicked telden me tales, ac nouȝt as þi law.told: bot.
Alle þyn comaundementȝ ben soþnes; þe wicked pursued me, helpe þou me.—þou.
Hij hadden nere honde casten me in erþe, for-soþe y ne for-soke nouȝt þin comaundement.nere .. me] neȝ hendyd me by a lytil: —ne: commaundmentȝ.
Quike me efter þy mercy, & y shal kepe þe wittnisses of þi mouþe.Make me qwyk.

DIV3.HEAD: Lameth.
DIV3.P: Lord, þi worde dwelleþ wyþ-outen ende in heuen.woneþ.
Þy soþnes is in kinde & kinde; þou founded þerþe, & it dwelleþ.made.
Þe daie lasteþ þurȝ þin ordinaunce, for alle þinges seruen to þe.
Bot þat þy lawe is mi þouȝt, þan peraunter ich had perissed in my lowenisse.þat] if: is] be: mynde: mekenes.
Y ne shal nouȝt for-ȝete þin riȝttinges wyþ-outen ende, for þou quiked me in hem.—ne: riȝtfulnesses—w. o. ende: in hem þou hastmade me qwyk.
Ich am þy; make me sauf, for ichaue soȝt þi ryȝtinges.riȝtwysnes.
Sinȝers abiden me, þat hij shuld destruen me; ichaue vnderstonden þy witnesses.ab.] haue byde: witnes.
Ich seiȝe þe endeing of alle fulfilling, [þi comaundement is much large].ende: fulf.+þi commaund|ment is much large.

DIV3.HEAD: Mem.MS. Oren.
DIV3.P: Hou, Lord, loued ich þy lawe? al dai it is my þouȝt.Lorde how.
Þou madest me quainte vp myn enemis to þi comaundement, for it is to me wiþ-outen ende.qu.] wys.
Ich vnderstode vp alle techand me; for ich þouȝt þin witnisses bene corrected from o. mi þouȝt.all+men: witnes is: mynde.
Ich vnderstode vp þe olde, for ich soȝt þin comaundement.vp olde men: commaund|mentȝ.
Ich defended miMS. ni. fete fram ich iuel way, þat ich kepe þin wordes.my.
Y ne bowed nouȝt fram þin iugement, for þou sett lawe to me.—ne: domes.
Ful swete ben þi wordes to mi cheke, more þan huniMS. hi mi. to my mouþe.chekes: hony.
Ich vnderstode witt of þy comaundement, for-þi ich hated ich way of wickednes.commaundmentes.

DIV3.HEAD: Nun.
DIV3.P: Þy worde is lanterne to mi fete & liȝt to my bisties.paþes.
Ich swore & stablist to kepe þe iugementȝ of þy riȝtfulnes.sett: domes.
Ich am lowed on ich half; quicke me efter þyn worde.syde, make (—me) qwyk.
Make, Lord, þe wilful þinges of mi mouþe in gode plesaunce, & teche me þin iugement. domes.
My soule is alway in myn hondes, &y ne haue nouȝt for-ȝeten þi lawe.—ne.
Sinȝers laiden gnare to me, and y ne erred nouȝt for þy comaundementȝ.gn.] þe grynne: —ne: for] of.
Ichaue purchased wyþ-outen ende þin witnesses in heritage, for hij ben þe ioie of min hert.Hauey gete: witnes—in h.: ioying.
Ich bowed min hert to do þy riȝtinges wyþ-outen ende for mede.riȝtwysnesses (t added over line.

DIV3.HEAD: Samec.
DIV3.P: Ich hade þe wicked in hateing, & ich loued þi lawe.hate.
Þou art min helper & mi taker, & ich hoped in þi worde.
Ha ȝe wicked, boweþMS. loweþ. fram me, and y shal se chen þe comaunde|ment of my God.l.] goþ: hestes.
Take me efter þy worde, and y shal leuen; & ne confounde me nouȝt fram myn abidyng.—ne.
Helpe me, & y shal be sauf; & y shal euermore þenchen in þy riȝtinges.riȝtwysnesses.
Þou despised alle þe descendand fram þin iugementȝ; for her þouȝt is wrongful.all men departyng: domes.
Ich told alle þe sinȝers of erþe for-fetand; for-þy loued ich þy wittnesses.t.] held: of+þe: trespass|yng þer-for y loue.
Feche my flesshes in þi drede, for y was agaist of þy iugementȝ.Styk: agaste: domes.

DIV3.HEAD: Aym.
DIV3.P: Ich did iugement & riȝt, ne ȝif me nouȝt to þe chalangand me.dome: —ne: þe] men.
Take vp þi seruaunt in gode, þat þe proude ne chalenge me nouȝt.—ne.
Min eȝen faileden in þin helþe & in þe worde of þi riȝt.
Do wyþ þy seruaunt efter þy mercy, & teche me þi riȝtinges.riȝtfulnesses.
Ich am þi seruaunt; ȝif to me vnderstondynge, þat ich cunne þi witnesses.
Lord, it is time to do wreche, þe wicked han wasted þi lawe.Lor.
For-þi loue ich þi comaundement vp gold & topaz.þer-for y louyd þi hestes aboue.
For-þi was ich dresced to þi comaundement, & ichad alle iuel way in hatynge.to+all: commaundmentȝ: y had: hate.

DIV3.HEAD: Phe.
DIV3.P: Ha Lord, wonderful ben þin witnesses; for-þi my soule soȝt hem.
Þe shewynge of þin wordes aliȝteþ me, & ȝeueþ vnderstondyng to litel.liȝteþ: ȝif.
Ich opened my mouþe, & droȝe þe gost, for þat ich desired þi comaundementȝ.—þat.
Loke in me, & haue mercy on me efter þe iugementȝ of him þat louen þi name.in] to: dome.
Dresce min goinges efter þi worde, & al vnriȝt-fulnes ne lord-ship me nouȝt.ne . . . nouȝt] haue noȝt lord|schip on me.
Raunsoun me fram þe chalanges of men, þat ich kepe þin comaundementȝ.
Liȝt þi face vp þi seruant, & teche me þy riȝtinges.me+vp: riȝtwysnesses.
Myn eȝen ladden outgoinges of waters, for þat hij kepten þi lawe.ladd oute vschus.

DIV3.HEAD: Sade.No heading and no paragraph in the MS.
DIV3.P: Lord, þou art riȝtful, & þi iugementȝ is riȝtful.dome.
Þou sendest riȝtfulnesses þin wittnesses & þi soþenes greteliche.sentest: ryȝtfulnes.
Mi loue made me to quaken, for þyn enemis forȝaten þin wordes.
Þy worde is michel aliȝted, and þin seruaunt loued it.muche.
Ich am hongeRead ȝonge. & despised, and y ne haue nouȝt for-ȝeten þin riȝtinges. ȝong: —ne: riȝtwysnesses.
Þy riȝt, Lord, is riȝt wyþ-outen ende, & þi lawe is soþenes.
Tribulacioun and anguis founden me; my þouȝt is þi comaundement.commaundentȝ.
Þi witnesses ben euenhede wyþ-outen ende; ȝif me vnderstondynge, and y shal lyuen.euenhode.

DIV3.HEAD: Ceph.
DIV3.P: Ich cried in alle myn hert; Lord, her me, y shal sechen þy riȝtinges.riȝtwysnesses.
Ich cried to þe; make me sauf, þat ich kepe þin comaundement.commaundmentȝ.
Ich com for-þe in melshede & cried, & ich hoped in þyn worde.melschhode.
Min eȝen com to-fore to þe in þe morwening, þat ich þouȝt þin wordes.mornyng: þoȝt+in.
Here my voice, Lord, efter þy mercy, and quick me after þy iugement.make me qwyk: dome.
Þe persuand me drowen to wickednesse; hij for soþe ben made fer fram þy lawe.pursuing: f. s. þai.
Lord, þou art neȝe, & alle þin waies ben soþenes.
Ich knew fram þe bigynnyng of þi wittnesses, for þou fonded hem wyþ-outen ende.foundid.

DIV3.HEAD: Res.
DIV3.P: Se my mekenisse, & defende me fram iuel; for y ne for-ȝate nouȝt þy lawe.MS. sawe, with a round s.—ne: sawe] lawe.
Iuge my iugement, & bigge me oȝain, & quike me for þi worde.Deme my dome: make me qwyke.
Helþe his fer fram sinȝers, for hij ne souȝt nouȝt þy riȝtfulnesses.—ne: ryȝtfulnes.
Lord, þy mercius ben mani; quikeMS. quiken, but n is expuncted. me efter þy iugement.make me qwyk: dome.
Mani þer ben þat pursuen me; y ne bowe[d] nouȝt fram þy witnes.—ne: bowed: witnesses.
Ich seiȝe þe forfetours, & ich quaked, for þat hij ne kep nouȝt þy wordes.se men trespassyng: —ne: kepide.
Se, Lord, for ich loued þin comaundementȝ; quike me in þy mercy.make me qwyk.
Þe by-ginnyng of þy wordes is soþ; so ben wiþ-outen ende alle þe iugementȝ of þy riȝtfulnisse.soþ . . . ende] soþnes with|oute ende so beþ: domes: ryȝtful|nesses.

DIV3.HEAD: Syn.
DIV3.P: Princes pursued me wyþ wille, & myn hert dradde of þin wordes.w.w.] wilfullych: dred.
Y shal glade vp þi wordes, as he þat findeþ many spolinges.spoiles.
Ichade wickednisse in hateinge, and ich loþed it, & loued þy lawe.Y had: hate.
Ich seid hereingeThe second e is corrected from i. to þe seuen siþes on þe daie vp þe iugement of þi riȝt.herying: on þe d.] a day: dome.
Muchel pes is to þe louand þy lawe, & sclaunder nis nouȝt to hem.Much: þe] men: is.
Ich abode, Lord, þin helþe, and ich loued þin comaundementȝ.ab.] ha bode.
My soule kept þi witnesses, & ich loued hem greteliche.
Ich kept þy comaundementȝ & þi witnisses, for alle my waies ben in þy siȝt.

DIV3.HEAD: Thau.
DIV3.P: Cum, Lord, my praier in þysiȝt; ȝif me vnder-stondynge efterþy worde.Lorde cum; in] nere.
Latin and English omitted.Entre my askyng in þi siȝt, & deliuer me efter þi worde.
My lippes shul shewe songe, whan þou hast tauȝt me þy riȝtinges.riȝtwysnesses.
My tunge shal putt forþe þy worde, for al þy comaundementȝ benþy] þ (!): euennes. euenhede.Preceded by euende, which is dotted out.
Ben þin honde made þat it saue me, for þatich loued þy comaundementȝ.
Lord, ich loued þin helþe, & þy lawe is my þouȝt.
My soule shal lyuen & herien þe, & þi iugementȝ shal helpe me. sh. l.] leuyþ: &it schal hery: domes.
Ich erredMS. Icherred. as a shepe þat perissed; seche, Lord, þy seruant, for y ne forȝate noȝt þy comaundement.—ne: commaundmentȝ.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 119 (120).
DIV2.P: Ich cried to our Lord, as ich was trubled, & he herd me.when: sturbled.
Lord, deliuer my soule fram þe wicked lippes & fram þe trecherous tunge.þe tr.] trichourus.
What þinge be ȝeuen to þe? oþer what be sett to þe trecherous tunge?or what þing is sett to þe to a trichorours tung.
Sharpe arwen of þe miȝtful wyþ coles dis-confortables.myȝty: disconfortable.
Alas to me; for my dwellynge is proloyngned; ichich is added over the line. woned wiþ þe woniand of Cedar, my soule was tilier michel.proloyned: with men wonnyng atte Cedar+&.
Ich whas peisible wyþ hem þat hateden pes; as y spak to hem, hij smiten me wyþ wille.pesable: when: smote.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 120 (121).
DIV2.P: Ich lifted myn eȝen to þe heuens, whennes helpe com to me.lift+vp: fram whens: schal cum.
Myn helpe is of our Lord, þat made heuen and erþe.
Ha þou gode man, þat God þat kepeþ þe ne ȝif nouȝt þy fote in stirynge, ne he ne shal nouȝt refusen hem.O: —ne: in st. ne] or strengþ into mouyng & he: —ne: hem] þe.
Our Lord kepeþ þe, & our Lord is þy fendour vp þi riȝt honde.f.] defendyng
Brynynge of vice ne shal nouȝt brulen þe bi daie, ne enticement bi niȝt.Brennyng: vices: —ne: bren: ne] no.
Our Lord kepeþ þe fram alle iuels; our Lord kepe þi soule.euyll.
Our Lord kepe þin entre and þin yssu fram þis nov vnto þe world.oute-goyng fram þis tyme now+&.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 121 (122).
DIV2.P: Ich am gladed in þe þynges þat ben yseid to me; we shul go into þe hous of our Lord.glade: þe] þi.
Ha þou heuen, our fete wer stondand in þin halles, whan we do wele.O: dyd gode.
Þe heuen þat is edefied as cite, of wham takyng part is in þat ich þing.as+a.
For þider mounted þe kyndesCorrected from kynges by another scribe. of kindes of our Lord, þe witnesse of þe childer of Israel, to shriue to þe name of our Lord.come: kyndes of þe kynde: knowlege.
For þat satten þe chosen in iugement, þe chosen vp þe folk of þe hous of Dauid.þat] þer: dome: vp] of.
Ha ȝe heuens, askeþ þinges þat ben in pes, & wexing be to þe louandMS. louauand. þe.O: in] to: encresyng: to men louyng þe.
Be pes made in þy vertu & wexing in þy miȝtes.encresyng: toures or miȝtes.
Translation omitted.For my breþer & my neȝpurs y spake pees of þe.
For þe houus of God, our Lord, y soȝt godes to þe.of our Lorde Godd y gate.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 122 (123).
DIV2.P: Þou þat wonest in þe heuens, ich lifte myn eȝen to þe.in—þe: eȝe.
Se, as þe eȝen of þe seruauntes ben in þe hondes of her lordes;

As þe eȝen of þe hondemaiden ben in The MS. has þeȝen instead of þe hondes.þe hondesThe MS. has þeȝen instead of þe hondes. of þe ladi, so ben our eȝen to God, þer whiles þat he haue merci on vs.& as: þeȝen] þe hondes: þe] her: þ. w. þ.] to tyme.
Ha mercy on vs, Lord, haue merci [on] us, for we ben michel fulfild of despite.Ha] Haue: +on: much.
For þat our soule is greteliche fulfild wyþ synȝes, reprucynge be to þe wexyng & despite to þe proude.—þat: much: of syn: encresyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 123 (124).
DIV2.P: Bot ȝif our Lord were in vs, sai nou þe folk of Israel, bot ȝif God were in us:
As men arisen oȝains vs, peraunter hij hadden deuoured vs al quike. As] Whem (!): ros.
As her wodeship was wroþe oȝains us, water peraunter hade swolwed vs.When: peraunter water: deuourd.
Our soule passed trauail; perchaunce our soule had passed peine þat maie nouȝt be suffred.peraunter.
Blisced be our Lord, þat MS. þat þat. ne ȝaf vs nauȝt in takyng to her teþe.þat—þat ne.
Our soule is defended as þe sparowe fram þe gnare of þe fouler.deliuerd as a sp.: gryn.
Þe trappe of þe fend is to-broke wyþ þe deþ of Crist, & we ben deliuered fro dampnacioun.gryn: fendeȝ: wyþ] by.
Our helpe is in þe name of our Lord, þat made heuen and erþe.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 124 (125).
DIV2.P: Hij þat affien hem in our Lord, as þe folk of Syon, ben gode; ne he þat woneþ in heuen ne shalt nouȝt be stired wiþ-outen ende.ne he] & he: —ne: schal: mouyd.
Þe ioies ben in his cumpas, & our Lord is in þe cumpas of his folk fram nou & into heuen.—1. þe: & i. h.] with-oute ende.
For our Lord ne shal nouȝt for-sake þe penaunce of þe sinȝer[s] vp þe lot of þe riȝtful, þat þe riȝtful ne shewe nouȝt her hondes to wickednes.—ne: of synners: ne sh.] sprede.
Do wele, Lord, to þe gode & riȝtful of hert.
Our Lord shal laden þe bowand fram gode in-to bindeing wyþ þe wircheand wickednes; pes be vp þe folk of Israel.Our] For-soþe our: þe b.] men declynyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 125 (126).
DIV2.P: We ben made as conforted, our Lord turnand chaitifs of þe folk of Syon.—as: c.+to: turnand ch.] was in turnyng þe wrechidnes.
Þan is our mouþe fulfild of ioie, & our tunge in gladenes.
Þan shul hij saien a-monge men: Our Lord heried to do wyþ hem mercy.
Our Lord heried to do wyþ us, so be we made ioiand.gladyng.
Lord, wil þou turne our chaitifnes, as þi grace is in heuen.willtow: wrechydnes.
Hij þat repenten her sinȝes in teres, hij shul liuen in heuen wiþ ioie.
Þe dyand ȝede out of þe world & wept, sendand her dedes.wepe.
And hij comaund in-to heuen shul cum wyþ ioie, berand to God her honours.cumyng.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 126 (127).
DIV2.P: Bot ȝif ȝour Lord haue bigged þe hous in vain, hij trauaileden þat it sett.ȝour] our: b.] made: s.] made.
Bot ȝif our Lord haue kept þe cite, he þat kepeþ it wakeþ al on idel.on] in.
Ydel þing it is to ȝou for to arisen to-fore liȝt; ȝe þat han don dedelich sinȝe, ariseþ, sen þat ȝe han made dwelling.Vayne: sen þat] seþ: tarying.

Ȝe childer, marchaundis & frut of þe wombe, seþ þe heritage of our Lord, whan he had ȝeuen reste to his loued.Seþ he haþ ȝif rest to his louyd, lo, ȝe childer, þe h. of our Lorde is marchandys of þe frute of þe w.
As arwen ben in þe honde of þe miȝtful, so ben þe sones of þe smiten.
Blisced be þe man þat fulfild his desire of hem; he ne shal nouȝt be confounded, as he shal speken to his enemis in þe ȝate of Paradis.—ne: when.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 127 (128).
DIV2.P: Blisced ben hij al þat dreden our Lord, þe which þat gon in his waies.þe wh.] &.
Ha þou man, þou art blisced, & wele þe shal be, for þou shalt eten þe trauailes of þin hondes.O—þou.
Þy wyf shal be as a vine wexand in þe sides of þyn hous. wexyng vine.
Þy childer shul ben as braunches of oliues a-bout þy table.
Se, þus shal þe man be blisced þat dredeþ our Lord.Lo: schalt.
Þe Lord of þe folk of Syon blisce þe, þat tou se þe godes of heuen alle þe daies of þy lif;
Þat tou se þe sone[s] of þi sones, pes vp þe childer of Israel.sone] sonnes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 128 (129).
DIV2.P: Þe wicked foeten oftȝ oȝains me fram my ȝengþe, cai nou þe folk of Israel.faȝt oft: ȝongþ.
Þe wicked foȝten oft oȝains me fram my ȝouþe, for hij ne miȝten nouȝt to me.faȝt: ȝongþe: —ne.
Þe synȝers forgeden folies vp my rigge, & hij proloined her wickednes.wroȝt.
Our Lord riȝtful shal keruen þe haterels of þe sinȝers; ben hij alle confounded & turned þat hateden þe folk of Syon.Our r. L.: hateþ.
Ben hij made as hai of houses þat dried, ar þat it be drawen vp;
Of which he þat shal repen, ne fild nouȝt his honde, ne he his bosme þat shal gader þe honde-fouls.Of+þe: ne fild] fil: ne he] no: —þe: hanfuls.
And hij þat passeden ne saiden nouȝt, Þe blisceing of our Lord be vp ȝou, [we blisced ȝou] in þe name of our Lord.—ne: ȝou+we blys ȝou.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 129 (130).
DIV2.P: Ich cried, Lord, to þe for þe depe; Lord, here my uoice.Lord y cryd.
Ben þin eres made vnder-stondand to þe voice of mi praier.
Lord, ȝif þou hast kept wickednes, Lord, who shal holde hem vp?hast k.] schalt kepe.
For help is to þe, & ich susteined þe, Lorde, for þy lawe.to] at.
My soule helde vp gode in hishi on erasure. worde, my soule hoped in our Lord.h. vp] susteyned.
Hope þe folk of Israel in our Lord fram þe mornynge kepinge vn-to þe niȝt.m. vnto þe euen kepyng.
For merci is at our Lord, & at him is plentiuose raunsoun.plenteous.
And he shal raunsoun þe folk of Israel fram alle her wickednes.wykkydnesses.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 130 (131).
DIV2.P: Lord, myn hert nis nouȝt anheȝed, ne min eȝen ne ben noȝt born on heȝe.is: ne] no: —ne: b.o.h.] proude.
Ne ich ne ȝede nouȝt in grete þinges, ne in wonderful þinges vp me.No ych ȝode: I. in] in, written over amonge, which is expuncted: ne] no.
Ȝif y ne feld nouȝt lowelich, bot haue heȝed mi soule:ne feld] fred: bot+y.
As þe souking is vp his moder, so is ȝeldyng in my soule.reward.
Hope þe folk of Israel in our Lord, nou fram þis time and to þe heuens.nou . . . h.] fram now withoute ende.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 131 (132).
DIV2.P: Bi-þenche þe, Louerd, of Dauid & of alle his mildenes.Lord: mekenes.
As he swore to our Lord, he avowed voweMS. abowed bowe. to þe God of Iacob.wouyd a wou.
Ȝif ichaue entred in-to þe tabernacle of mi hous, ȝifHere follows ich ȝa, but is expuncted. ichaue went vp into þe bedde of myn apparaile;
Ȝif ichaue ȝeuen sleping to myn eȝen & slomeringe to myn eȝen-liddes,
And rest to my tymes, þer-whiles þat ich finde stede to our Lord, tabernacle to God of Iacob:þ. w. þ.] to (!): Lorde+& a.
Se, we herd it in Effrata, we finde it in þe heuen.Lo: fonde.
We shul entre in-to þe tabernacle of God, & we shul anouren in þe stede, þer his fete stode.honour.
Arise, Lord, in-to þi rest, þou & þe houche of [þin] halwing.huche of+þi.
Þyn prestes ben cladde wiþ riȝt-fulnisses, & glade þin holi.cloþd: ryȝtfulnes.
Ne turne nouȝt þe face of þi prest anoint wiþ creme for Dauid, [þi] seruant.—ne: anoyt: D.+þi.
Our Lord swore to Dauid soþenes, & he ne shal nouȝt deceiue him; y shal laie vp þi sege of þe frut of þi wombe.—ne: dissayue: sett: sete.
Ȝif þi childer haue kept mi testament & miThe MS. has þi testament & þi w. witnesses, þo þinges þat y shal teche hem,kepyd my (corrected from þi) t. & my (corrected from þi) witnes & þes þinges.
Her childer shul siten vp þi sete vn-to þe world.Her] & her: vnto þe w. sch. syt vp þ. s.
For our Lord ches þe folk of Syon, he ches hem in-to wonyng to him.
Þis wonyng is rest to me in heuen, her shal ich wone, for iches it.is my rest: y schal.
Ich blisceand shal blisce his widowe, y shal fulfil his pouer of loues.MS. leues.loues.
Y shal cloþen his prestes wiþ helþe, & his holi shul gladen [wyþ] ioie.glade+with.
ÞerInstead of þer, the MS. has a y. shal y bringe forþe þe power of Dauid; and y made rady þe laterne to mi preste anoint wyþ creme.Y schal—y: forþe+þeder: anoyte.
Y shal cloþe his enemis wiþ confusioun; myn halweing for-soþe shal florissen vp hym.holynes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 132 (133).
DIV2.P: Se, hou gode & hou ioiful þing it is, breþer to wonen in on;Lo: ioyful — þing: breþeren.
As onement in þe heued, þat falleþ into þe berde, þe berde of Aaron;vnement.
Þe which fel in-to þe hemme of his cloþinge, as dew of Hermon þat fel in þe mounteine of Syon.lappe of (of is wrongly dotted out) hym (dotted out) his cl.: falleþ into þe hill.
For our Lord sent þider his blisceinge, and lif vnto þe heuen.v. þ. h.] with ende (!).

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 133 (134).
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe alle seruantes of our Lord, seþ, blisceþ our Lord nou.—seþ.
HeRead ȝe. þat stonde in þe hous of our Lord, in þe halles of our Goddes hous,He] Ȝe: Lorde+&: of þe hous of our Godd.
Heȝeþ your hondes bi niȝtes in-to holi þinges, & blisceþ our Lord.Hold vp.
Our Lord blisced þe, Marie of Syon, þat made heuene & erþe.blyss.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 134 (135).
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe seruauntȝ, herieþ our Lord, herieþ þe name of our Lord.Lorde+&.
Ȝe þat stonde in þe hous of our Lord, in þe halles of þe hous of our Lord,Lorde+&.
Herieþ our Lord, for he is gode; singeþ to his name, for it is milde.meke.
For our Lord ches Iacob to him, Israel to him in possessioun.& Israel.
For ich knew þat our Lord is gret, and our God is to-fore alle goddes.First d added over line.
Our Lord made alle þinges þat he wolde, in heuen & in erþe, in see and in halle depenisses.MS. dennnsses, of which the first e is dotted out.all depenesses.
He his ladand out cloudes of þe last ende of þerþe, & he made liȝtinges in raine.lad.] brynging: ottermast endes: into.
Þe which þat putteþ forþe þe windes of his tresour, þo which smote þe first borne of Egipt fram man vnto beste,— þat: tresours + &: þe: borne] beȝetyng.
And sett his to-knes & his wondres in-middes of þe Egipt, oȝayn Pharaon his seruauntes;& he sent: of — þe: Pharo+&.
Þe which smote mani folkes, & sloȝe stronge kynges,folke: —kynges.
Seon, kyngFollowed by an a, which is expuncted. of Amorreux,Amoreour.
And Og,Followed by an h, which is dotted out. kyng of Basan,
And alle þe kyngdomes of Chanaan.
And he ȝaf her [londe] heritage, into heritage to his folk of Israel.her+londe.
Lord, þy name is wyþ-outen ende, þi minde is in kynde and in-to kinde.fram k. into k.
For our Lord shal iuggen his folk and praie for his seruauntes.deme.
ÞeMS. ye. y-magerie of men ben seluer & gold, werkes of mennes hondes.þe.
Hij han mouþe, and hij ne shul nouȝt speken; hij han eȝen, and ne shul nouȝt sen.—ne: ne] þai.
HijMS. Hij hij. han eren, and hij ne shul nouȝt heren; and no gost is in her mouþe.—ne: and no g. is] no for|soþe þer is no goste.
Hij þat maken hem be made lich to hem, and alle þat affienie on erasure. in hem.Hij . . . made] Be þai þat make hem: leueþ.
Ha heRead ȝe. folk of Israel, blisceþ our Lord; ha ȝe folk of Aaron, blisceþ our Lord.he] ȝe: ha] and.
Þe folke of Leui, blisceþ our Lord; ȝe þat douteþ our Lord, blisceþ our Lord.Þe] Ȝe: Lorde+&: drede.
Blisced be our Lord of þe folkThe flourish at the k is different from the usual one, as, instead of form|ing a loop, it simply goes downward similar to a long comma. of Syon þat woneþ in heuen.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 135 (136).
DIV2.P: Shriueþ to our Lord, for he is god, for hysy corrected from e. merci is in þe world.i. þ. w.] with oute ende.
Shriueþ to þe God of goddes;
Shriueþ to þe Lord of lordes;
Þe which bi him on deþon deþ on erasure. grete wondres;bi . . . deþ] allon doþ many.
Þe which made þe heuens in vnder-stondinge;The English of this verse and the Latin of this as well as of the next verse is written on a long erasure.into.
Þe which fastened þerþe vp waters;vp+þe.
Þe which made grete liȝtes,
Þe sonne in-to þe miȝt of þe dai,power.
Þe mone and þe sterres in-to miȝt of þe niȝt;into þe power.
Þe which smote Egipt wyþ her first biȝeten.byȝetyngȝ.
Þe which lad out þe childer of Israel fram amiddes hem,

In myȝt-ful hondeMS. myȝt fulbonde. and heȝe arme;Then v. 10-12 are repeated, thus: þe which smete Egipte wyþ her fir[st] biȝeten. Þe which lad out (MS. ladent) þe childer of Israel fram amiddes hem. Smiȝt (!) fulhonde & heȝe arme.honde & hie power.
Þe wiche departed þe Reed See in departynges;deuysions.
Þe wichewicked, MS. lad þe folk of Israel þurȝ-out it;þe whych ladd+oute: by amiddes it.
Þe which smote Pharaon and his vertuȝ in þe ReedSecond e added over line. See;and] in.
Þe which lad his folk þourȝ desert;
Þe which smote grete kinges,
And sloȝe stal-worþ kinges,strong.
Seon, kynge of Amorreux,S.+þe: Amoreneȝ.
And Og,MS. h og (h expuncted). kyng of Basan,Ogg+þe.
And alle þe kyngdoms of Chanaan.
And he ȝaf her londe heritage,
Heritage to Israel, his seruaunt.
Þe which was bi-þenchand on us in our mekenes,biþ.] þenchyng.
And raunsouned vs fram our enemis;A. r.] þe which raunson.
Þe which ȝeueþ mete to ich flesshe.
Shriueþ to þe God of heuen;Schryue ȝou to—þe.
Shriueþ to þe Lord of lordes;Schryue+ȝow.
For inin added over line. þe world is his mercy.Fo. h. m. is with-oute ende.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 136 (138).
DIV2.P: Y shal shriue, Lord, to þe in alle myn hert, for þou herdest þe worde of my mouþe.Lorde y sch. schr.: wordes.
Y shal singe to þe in þe siȝt of aungels, & y shal anoure þe to þin holi temple, & ich shal shriue to þi name,honour: name] holy name.
Vp þi merci & þi soþenes; for þou heried þin holi name vp alle þinge.aboue.
In whiche daie þat ichaue cleped þe, her me; þou shalt multiplien vertu in my soule.what: y schal clepe: me+&.
Shriue, Lord, to þe alle þe kinges of erþe; for hij harden alle þe wordes of þi mouþe;Lord, all þe k. of þe e. schryue to þe: my.
Þat hij singe in þe waies of our Lord, for þe glorie of our Lord is grete.way: ioie.
For our Lord is heȝe; & he lokeþ þe lowe þinges, & knoweþ þe heȝe þinges fram fer.seþ.
Ȝif ich haue gon amiddes of [my] tribulacion, þou shalt quike me; & þou sheweþ þin honde vp þe wraþe of min enemis; þi miȝt made me sauf.of+my: mak me qwyke: sheweþ] spredest.
Our Lord shal ȝelden for me; þi merci, Lord, [is] in þe world; ne despise þe werkes of þin hondes.in] is in: ne desp.] desp. noȝt.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 137.
DIV2.P: Þer-whiles þat we bi-þouȝt vs of þe heuen, we satt & wept þer vp þe assautes of þe fende.heuen] in heuen: wepe.
We heng our ioies in passand þinges in-middes of him.
Why hij, deuels, þat ladden vs chaitifs, asked vs þer wordes of songes. þer] þe.
And hij þat ladden vs out of godenes, seiden to vs: Singeþ to us of þe songe of heuen.songes.
Hou shul we singe þe songeMS. senge. of our Lord in iuel liif?songe of+of.
Ha ȝe folk of gode liif,MS. his with a round s. seid our Lord, if þat ich for-ȝete ȝou, be mi miȝt ȝeuen to forȝetinge.O: his] life: be] by.
Fast drawe my tunge to my chekes, ȝif y þenche nouȝt on þe.cleue.
Yf y ne sett nouȝt forþe gode folk in þe biginnynge of my ioie.—ne.
Be þou bi-þenchand of wicked childer in þe daie of iugement of gode men;dome.
Þe which wicked sain, For-doþ þe gode, fordoþ þe gode vnto þe foundement [in it].—1. þe gode: 2. þe gode] gode men: foundement+in it.
Ha þou soule, filed þurȝ þe fende, þou art chaitif; blisced be he þat ȝeldeþ to þe þi ȝeldinge, þe which þat tou ȝelde to vs gode.O þou defoilyd s.: wrechid: þi] þe: ȝeldid.
Blisced be he þat shal holde him in godenes & put his gode dedes to stondynge.dedes] de (!).

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 138 (139).
DIV2.P: Lord, þou prouedest me, and þou knewe [me; þou knewe] my sittyng and my risynge.knew+me þou knew.
Þou vnderstonde mi þoȝutes fram fer; þou soȝt my bisti and myn acorde.þoȝtes: trased my bystye: ac.] corde.
And þou for-seȝest alle myn waies, for þer nis no worde in my tunge.þou seȝ to-fore: is.
Se, Lord, þou kneu alle þe last þynges & þe old; þou fourmed me, and sett vp me þin helpe.—sett.
Þy conynge is made wonderful vp me; it is conforted, and y ne mai nouȝt þer-to.—ne.
Whider shal y go fram þy gost, and whider shal y fle fro þy face?fle] go.
Ȝif ich steiȝe to heuen, þou art þer; ȝif ich go a-doun to helle, þou comest þider.st.] go vp: ad.] doune: art neȝ.
Ȝif þat y take my liȝtynges in þe morning and wonne in þe vtterest of þe see,—þat: swyftnes: vttermast.
Whi hyMS. why þi hy, but þi is expuncted. þin helpeThe MS. has an n here, which is dotted out. shal lede me þider, and þy miȝt shal holde me.Whi (þi) hy] And for-soþe.
And y seid perchaunce, derkenesses shul defoulen me, and þe nyȝt is my liȝting in my delites.peraunter derknes.
For derkenesses ne shul nouȝt be derke of þe, and þe nyȝt shal be briȝted as þe daie; as his derknesses ben, so is his liȝt.derknes—ne: derke] made derk: briȝt: derknes.
For þou weldedest mie reines, and toke me fro þe wombe of my moder.haddest my.
Y shal shriue to þe; for þou art dredefullich heried; þin werkes ben wonderful, and my soule shal knowe hem gretelich.
My mouþe nis nouȝt hidde fro þe, which þou made in priuete, and my substaunce is in þe neþerest of þerþe.is: which] þat: neþ.] iner|mast.
Þyn eȝen sen myn vnparfitnes, & al shul be writen in þi boke; þe daies shul be fourmed, and no man in hem.þi] þe.
Ha God, þin frendes for-soþe ben michel worþshiped to me, her principalte is mychel conforted.O Godd f.s. þifr.; wyrchypt(!): princehode: much.
Y shal telle hem, & hij shul ben multiplied vp grauel; ich aros, & ȝete ich am wyþ þe.aboue þe gr.
Ha God, ȝif þou sle þe synȝers, helpe me; ȝe men suiled wyþ sinȝe, bowe fro me. O: fyled: bowe] goþ.
For þat ȝe say in [ȝ]our þouȝtes, Taken þe gode ini on erasure (of o?). vaine her medes.our] ȝour.
Þinge to wyten ȝif ich hated þe hatend þe, Lord, and failled vp myn enemis?þynge . . . Lord] Lorde wheþer y hatyd noȝt hem þat hatyd þe.
Ich hated hem wiparfitei.e., wiþ parfite. hate, and hij ben made enemys to me.wi] with: —me.
Proue me, God, and wite myn hert; aske me, and knowe my sties.wite] know: paþes.
And se, ȝif waye of wickednes is in me, and lade me in waie euerlastend.euerlastyng waie.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 139 (140).
DIV2.P: Defend me, Lord, fro þe wicked man, and defende me fro þe man vnriȝtful.defende] delyuer.
Þe which þoȝten wickednes in hert, hij stablist batails aldai.þe wh.] þai þat: —hij: sett all d. batayle.
Hij sharped her tunges as naddres, venym of aspides is vnder her lippes.venum.
Kepe me, Lord, fram þe honde of þe sinner, & defende me fram þe vnriȝtful men.
Þe which þouȝten to supplaunten my ganginges, þe proude hidden gnares to me.þe wh.] þai þat: wayes: pr.+men: grynnes.
Hij spradden out wickednesses into gnare, hij sett sclaunder to me by þe waye.Þai sett wickydnes to me into a grynne, & by þe way þai put scl. to me.
Y seid to our Lord, þou art my God; here, Lord, þe voice of my prayere.
Þou Lord, Lord, uertu of myn helþe; þou shadued, Lord, vp min heuede in þe daie of bataile oȝains þe fende.schaduest.
Ne ȝyf me nouȝt fro my desire to þe sinȝer; þe wicked þouȝten oȝains me, þat hij ne be nouȝt peraunter an-heȝed.—Ne: þoȝt+euyl: þat per|aunter þai b. n. enhyed.
Þe heued of her cumpassement & þe trauail of her lippes shal couer hem.cumpas.
Tourmentȝ shul falle vp hem, and þou shalt cast hem in-to dampnacioun; þe gode ne shul nouȝt dwellen in mesais.—ne.
Þe man michel spekand ne shal nouȝt be dresced in erþe, iuels shul taken þe unriȝtful in-to deþ.much: —ne.
Ich knew þat our Lord shal do þe iugement of þe mesais and vengeaunce of þe pouer.dome to þe misays (put instead of pouer, which is expuncted): —þe.
Þe riȝtful for-soþe shul shriuen to þy name, and þe riȝtful shul wonen wyþ þy semblaunt.F. s. þe r.: chere.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 140 (141).
DIV2.P: Lord, ich cried to þe, here me; vnderstonde my voice, whan y crye to þe.vnd.+to.
Be myn orison dresced to þe as encens in þy syȝt, and so be þe lifting of myn hondes sacrifice of heuen.incense: lyftyng+vp: h.] euen.
Lord, sett kepyng to my mouþe, & þe dore of þe vnderstondynge to my lippes.of—þe.
Ne bowe nouȝt myn hert into wordes of malice for to excusen excusaciouns in sinȝes.Ne bowe] Low.
Wyþ men wirchand wickednes, & y ne shal nouȝt commune wyþ her chosen.—ne.
Þe riȝtful shal vndernimen me in merci and blame me; þe iuel for|soþe of þe sinȝer ne shal nouȝt grese minMS. in in. heued.f. s. þe euyl: —ne.
For ȝete is myn orisoun in her welelikand, her iuges ioint to þe stone benFollowed by slo, which is dotted out. swolwed.w.l.] plesynges: þe iuges ionyd (!): swalowed.
Hij shul heren my wordes, for hij miȝten here hem; mi worde his lopen bifore asMS. af. fathede of þerþe.my speche is broke as fatnes.
Our bones ben wasted bisiden helle, for to þe Lord ben our eȝen; Lord, ich hoped in þe, ne do nouȝt owaie þe soule fro me. by-syde: —ne: fram me my soule.

Kepe þou me fro þe assaut þe which þe wicked stablist toFollowed by þe whic þe wicked sta, which words are dotted out. me, & fro þe sclaundres of þe wirchand wickednes.fram asaute þat þai sett to me & fram sclaunder (l added over line) of wyrchyng w.
Þe synȝers shul fallen in her assaut; ich am oneliche, þerwhiles þat y passe.þ. wh.] to þat.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 141 (142).
DIV2.P: Y cried to our Lord wyþ my voice, y bysouȝt our Lord wyþ my voice.
Ich held myn orysoun in his siȝt, & y shew forþe my tribulacioun bi-fore hym.bif.] to-for.
In failland of me my gost, and þou knu my besties.knew: paþes.
InMS. And. þat way þat y ȝede, þe wicked hidden assautes to me.And] in.
Y loke[d] on þe riȝt half and seȝe, and þer nas non þat knewe me.lokyd: h.] syde: & y seȝ: was.
Fleing perisce[d] fro me, and þer nas non þat soȝt my soule.perischt: was.
Lord, y cried to þe; y seid: Þou art my hope, my porcioun in þe erþe of liuand.y seid] & sayde: hope+&.
Vnderstonde to my praier, for ich am michel lowed.much mekyd.
De-liuer [me] fro þe pursuand me, for hij ben conforted vp me.D.+me: þe] men: confort.
Lade my soule out of þe kepyng of wicked to shriue to þi name; þe ryȝtful abiden me, þerwhiles þat þou ȝelde to me.of] fram: habideþ—me: re|warde.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 142 (143).
DIV2.P: Here, Lord, m[i] praier, & take wyþ þin eren my praier, and her me in þy riȝtfulnes, in þi soþenes.my: eres: ryȝtf.+&.
& ne entre nouȝt into iugement wyþ þyn seruaunt, for ich liuand ne shal nouȝ be riȝted in þy siȝt.—ne: dome: —ich: —ne: noȝt: iustified.
For þe enemy pursued my soule, he lowed my lif in erþe.
Hij laiden me in derkenes as þe dede of þe world, and my gost is anoied vp me, myn hert is trubledMS. myn hert is truis anoied vp me myn hert is trubled. in me.He layde: vp me+&.
Ich was bi-þenchand of old daies, &MS. in. þouȝt in alle þin werkes; y þouȝt in þe dedes of þin hondes.in þouȝt . . . hondes] & ych þoȝt in all þe warkes of þin hondes & in þe dedes.
Y sprad out myn hondes to þe, my soule is to þe as erþe wyþouten water.
Here me, Lord, swiftliche, my gost faileþ.faylid.
Ne turne nouȝt fro me þi face, and y shal be liche to þe falland in þe diche.—ne: into.
Make þy mercy erliche herd to me, for ich opedoped begins a fresh line. in þe.hopid.
Make þe waie knowen to me, in which y shal gonMS. god.; for y lifted my soule to þe.in w.] þat: god] go in: lift.
Lord, defende me fro myn enemys, ich fled to þe; teche me to do þy wille, for þou art my God.
Þy gode gost shal lade me in-to þe riȝt londe; þou shalt quicke me, Loue[r]d, in þyn euennesse for þy name.make me qwyk Lorde.
Þou shalt lade my soule out of tribulacioun, and shalt depart myn enemys in þy merci.&+þou.
And þou shalt lesen al þat trublen my soule, for ich am þy seruant.sturbleþ.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 143 (144).
DIV2.P: Blisced be þe Lord, my God, þat techeþ min hondes to feȝt and my fingers to batail oȝains þe fende.
He his my mercy and myn help, my taker & my deliuerer of iuel.
He his my defendour fram iuel, and ich hoped in hym; þou art my God, þat sitteþ my folk vnder me.setteþ.
Lord, what is man, þat tou madest þe knowen to hym? oþer mannes sone,MS. manessones with the last s dotted out. for þou wetest hym?—þe: or man sonne: trowest.
Man is made lich to vanite, is daies passen as shadue.
Bowe, Lord, þyn heuens, and cum a-doun; for-sake þe wicked, and hij shul beMS. ben, with the n expuncted and struck out. dampned.
Aliȝt shynyng, and þou shalt wasten hem; sende out þi manaces, and þou shalt trublen hem.sturble.
Send out þy myȝt fro heuen, and defend me; & deliuer me fram mani perils and fro þe pouste of stronge childer;power: straunge.
Whaus mouþe spake vanite, her riȝthalf is riȝthalf of wickednes.Whas: is+þe.
Whas childer ben as new settynges in her ȝengnes,ȝeuþe.
Her douȝters ben made & aourned about as liknes of þe temple.anoured.
Her selers ben ful, shewand fro þis in-to þis.into þat.
Her shepe ben plentiuous, wexande in her goinges, & her nete ben fatt.oxen.
Fallyng ne passage nis nouȝt to her walle, ne crie nis nouȝt in her stretes.F. of her wall no passyng is þer none, no crying is.
Hij seiden, Þe folke blisced, to whom þes þynges ben; blisced be þe folkOriginally with a flourish to the k, but it is erased. of which þe Lord is her God.1. þe L.] our L.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 144 (145).
DIV2.P: Ha mi God, y shal heȝe þe, kyng, and blisce þy name in þe worldMS. worls. & in þe world of worldes.Ha . . . kyng] Godd my kyng y sch. anhie þe: in þe worls] in world.
Y shal blisce þe by alle daies, and praisen þy name in þe world and inþe, which followed here, is dotted out. world of worldes.—and in (þe) world.
He is grete Lord and michel to praisen, & of his michelnesses nis non ende.is+a: much: muchnes: is.
Kynd and kynd shal herien þy werkes, and shewe þy miȝt.
Hij shul speken þe hereing of þe worþship of þin holines and tellen þin wondres.h.] gretenes: —þe w. of: &+schal.
And y shul saien þe vertuȝ of þi dredes, and shul [tel]lenMS. shullen. þy gretnes.y] þai: schal+tell.
Hij shul putten forþ þe minde of þe mildnes of þyn wexing, and hij shul glade of þy riȝtfulnes.encresyng.
Our LordMS lord lord. is rewful and merciable, suffrand and michel merciable.r.] pyteful: much.
Our Lord is liþe to alle, and his mercies ben vp alle his werkes.mylde.
Shriue, Lord, al þy werkes to þe, and þyne halwen blisce þe.Lorde all þi warkes schriue.
Hij shul saien þe glorie of þy kyngdome and speken þy miȝt,speke: ioie: tell.
Þat hij maden þi miȝt knowen to mennes sones, and þe glorie of þe hereing of þyn kyngdome.make: mensonnes: ioie: gretnes.
Þy kyngdom is kyngdom of alle world, and þy lordship is in kynde and kinde.worldes: fram k. to k.
Our Lord is trew in alle his wordes, holi in alle his werkes.w.+&.
Our Lord arereþ alle þo þat fallen, and dresceþ vp alle þe hurteled.þe h.] hurte.
Þe eȝen, Lord, of alle hopen in þe, and þou ȝeuest hem mete in couenable time.Lorde þe e.: all+men: troweþ: hem] her: behofull.
Þou openes þyn hondes, and fulfilles ich beste wyþ bliscyng.honde & fillest.
Our Lord is riȝtful in alle his waies and holy in alle his werkes.
Our Lord is neȝe to alle þe clepand him, þe clepand hym in riȝtfulnes. to all clepyng hym, to all clepyng hym in soþnes.
He shal do þe wil of þe doutand hym, and here her praier,MS. praies. and make hem sauf.of men dredyng: prayer &+he schal.
Our Lord kepeþ alle þat louen hym, and he shal desparplis alle synȝers.þat l.] louyng: d.] lese.
My mouþe shal speke þe praisyng of our Lord, and ich flesshe blisce to hys holy name in þe world and in þe world of worldes.ich] all: in þ. w. of w.] with|oute ende.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 145 (146).
DIV2.P: Ha þou my soule, hery our Lord; yMS. in. shal herien our Lord in my lif, and y shal syngen to my God as longe as ich haue ben.O: in] & y: haue] schal.
Ne wille ȝe nouȝt affien in princes, in mennes sones, in which non helþe nys.— Ne: beleue: pr.+no: men|sonnes: in whom is no helþe.
His gost shal go out and turne oȝayn in-to heuen; and in þat daie shul alle her þoȝtes perissen.

Bliscedi on erasure. be he which þe God Iacob is his helper, and his help is in þe Lord, þat made heuen and erþe, þe see and alle þynge þat ben in hem;whiche þe G.] þat þe Lorde Godd of: help] hope: þinges.
Þe which kepeþ soþenes in þe world and doþ iugement to hem þat suffren wronge, and ȝeueþ mete to þe hungerand.þai þat: dome: hungrye.
Our Lord vnbindeþ þe fettered, our Lord vnb[1]inded þe blynde.vnbinded] liȝtid.
Our Lord dresced vp þe hurteled, our Lord loueþ þe riȝtful.dresseþ: hurtyd.
Our Lord kepeþ þe straunge, and he shal taken þe moderlesFirst e corrected from o. and þe widowe, and he shal desparpel þe waies of þe synȝers.
Our Lord shal regnen in þe worldes; ha folk of Syon, þy God shal regnen in kynde and kynde.o þou folk: fram k. to k.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 146 (147).
DIV2.P: Herieþ our Lord, for it is god songe, ioyful and faire; heryinge be to our Lord.Hery.
Our Lord is edifiand Ierusalem, and he shal ansemble þe sunderynges of Israel;gadyr to-gyder þe despar|pelynges.
Þe which heliþ þe contrit of hertMS. hter. and bindeþ her contriciouns;He þat: hert.
Þe whiche noumbreþ þe multitude of sterres, & clepand ichon of hem a name.He þat: clepeþ name to hem all.
Our Lord is grete, & is vertu is grete, & þer nys non noumbre of his wisdome.nys] is.
Our Lord is takand þe mild & lowand þe sinȝers vnto þerþe.meke.
Singeþ to our Lord in shrifte, singeþ to our Lord in harpe;schrift+&.
Þe which couereþ þe heuen wyþ cloudes, and makeþ redy þe raine to þerþe;He þat couerþ—þe: —redy.
Þe which bryngeþ for-þe hayMS. haþ. in þe mounteyns, & grasse to mannes þraldome;He þat: haþ . . . ] hay & erbe in þe mounetaynes to seruyng of men.
Þe which ȝeueþ to meres her mete & to crowe-briddes clepand hym.He þat: bestes.
He ne schal nouȝt haue wille in strengþe of hors, ne wele-likeing ne shal nouȝt be to hym in mannes legges.—ne: ne w. l. ne] no plesyng.
Wele likand is our Lord vp þe doutand hym, and in hem þat hopen in hys mercy.Plesyng is+to: vp men dred|yng: in—hem þat.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 147 (147 continued).
DIV2.P: Þou folk of Ierusalem, heri our Lord; hery God, þou folk of Syon.
For he strengþed þe lokkes of þi ȝate, and he blisced in þe [þy] childer;made stronge: gates — and: bl. þi childer in þe.
Þe which sett pes to þi cuntres, and filleþ þe of fatt of þe whete;He þat s. þi c. pees: of þe fat|nes.
Þe which sendeþ his worde to þe erþe; hys worde erneþ swiftlich;He þat: erþe+&: ȝerneþ whiȝtlych.
Þe which ȝeueþ snowe as wolle, and streweþ þe cloude as asken.He þat.
He sendeþ his cristalle as morsels; who shal hold vp to-fore þe face of his colde?
He shal sende out his worde and make hem ernand; his gost shal blowe, & waters shul flowen. hem ern.] it malte.
Þe which telleþ his worde to Iacobes sones, his riȝtfulnesses and his iugementȝ to þe folk of Israel.He þat: domes.
He ne did nouȝt in þisMS. his. maner to ich nacioun, and he ne made nouȝt his iugementȝ aperte to hem.—ne: his] þis: — ne: domes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 148.
DIV2.P: Ȝe soule[s] of heuen, herieþ our Lord, herieþ hym in heȝnes.soules: Lorde+&.
Ȝe alle his aungels, herieþ hym; ȝe alle his vertuȝ, herieþ hym.All ȝe aungels heriþ hym, & all ȝe his vertus heriþ hym.
Ȝe sone & mone, herieþ hym; ȝe sterres and liȝt, herieþ hym.sonne and+þe.
Ȝe heuen of heuens, herieþ hym; & alle þe waters þat ben vp heuens, herieþ þe name of our Lord.heuen] heuens.
For he seid, and hij ben made; heMS. hij. comaunded, & hij ben formed.hij com.] he commaundyd (put instead of sent, which is expuncted): fourmyd.
He stablist hem wyþ-outen ende and in þe word of worldes; sett comandementȝ,MS. to mandementȝ. and it ne shal nouȝt ouerpassen.sett: world of w. he s. com|maundement: —ne.
Ha ȝe helles and alle depenes, herieþ our Lord of þerþe.Ha] All: & depenesses of þe erþe h. our Lorde.
Fur, haile, snowe, yse, & gost of tempestes þat don his wordes, herieþ our Lord.—yse: gost] þe gostes.
Mounteins & alle hilles, tres berand frut, and alle þe cedres, herieþ our Lord.
Bestes & al maner of bestes, serpentes & feþered foules, herieþ our Lord.
Ȝe kynges of erþe & alle folkes, princes & alle iuges of erþe, herieþ our Lord.folke: of þe erþe.
Ȝe ȝonge & ȝe virgines, old wyþ þe ȝonge, herieþ þe name of our Lord, for þe name of hym alon is anheȝed.with—þe.
His [shrift] is vp heuen & erþe, and he anheȝed þe myȝt of his folke.His+schryft: off.
Praiseyng be to alle hys halwen, to þe childer of Israel, to folk þat draweþ to hym.halowes: & to þe folke.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 149.
DIV2.P: Syngeþ to our Lord a new songe; hys hereyng hys in þe chirche of holy.herying: holy+men.
Glade þe folk of Israel in hym, þat hym made, and ioisen þe douȝters of Syon in her kynge.made hym & ioye.
Herien hij his name in croude, and singen hij to hym in tabor and sautri.
For weleplesand it is to our Lord in his folk, and he anheȝed þe milden in-to helþe.—wele: —it: meke.
Þe holy shul gladen in glorie, and ioien in her couches.glorie and] ioie & þay schal.
Þe ioies of God ben in her þrote, & swerdes sharppe a boþe half in her hondes.s. sh. a b. h.] trenchyng swerdes.
To do vengaunces in naciouns and lackeinges in folkes.vengaunce: blamynges: folke.
To bynde her kynges in feteris and her nobles in manicles of iren.noble men: ire.
Þat hij maken in hem iugement wryten, þys ys þe glorie to alle his halwen.dome.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALM 150.
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe folk, herieþ our Lord [in his halwen], herieþ hym in þe sted|fastnes of his uertu.—Hu: Lorde+among his halowen.
Herieþ hym in his vertuȝ, herieþ hym efter þe michelnes of his gretnes.
Herieþ hym in soune of trumpe, herieþ hym in sautri and in harpe.
Herieþ hym in croude and tabor, herieþ hym in cordesd added over the line. and organ.
Herieþ hym in cymbals wele sounand, herieþ hym in cymbals of ioie; ich gost herieþ our Lord. goste h.] goste hery.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS ISAYE.No heading in MS. (Isaie xii. 1-6.)
DIV2.P: Y shal shryue to þe, Lord; for þou art wroþ to me; þy vengeaunce is turned, and þou conforted me.
Se, God ys my saueour, and y shal do faiþlich, & y ne shal nouȝt douten.trewlich: —ne.
For our Lord is my strengþe and my praising; & he is made to me in-to helþe.
Ȝe shul haue solas in ioie of þe grace of þe saueour, & ȝe shul saie in þat daie: shriueþ to our Lord and clepeþ his name.
Singeþ to our Lord, for he did worþshipfullich; sheweþ þis þyng in alle erþe.worschipfullich.
Þou wonynge ofFollowed by an s, which is expuncted. þy Syon, glade and herie, for þe holy of Israel is grete in-middes of þe.—þy.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS EZECHIE.No heading in MS. (Isaie xxxviii. 10-20.)
DIV2.P: Y seid: In þe midel of my daies y shal go to þe ȝates of helle.
Y souȝt þe reme-nanȝt of my ȝeres, and y ne shal nouȝt sen our Lord in þe londe of liueand.remenaunte: —ne.
And y ne shalt nouȝt se man ouer, and wonier of rest.—ne: schal: & þe wonner.
My kinde ys bi-numen and don owaie fram me as wonyng of herdes.fram me before &: hirdmen.
My lif is coruen as of þe weuand;MS. woniand. [he] by-share me, þer-whiles þat ich werped.cutte as of man weuyng he cutte: —þat: warped.
Þou shalt ende me fram morwen to euen: ich hoped lyf in þe morwenyng, my bi-ȝeteing, defouled al my bones as a lyon.morow: morunyng: genera|cion.
Þou shalt ende me fram morwen to euen, y shal alway crye mercy as a swolwe-bridde, y shal þenche as coluer, as þe quiked þurȝ þe holi gost.morow: as þe qu.] inspired.
Myn eȝen ben made þinne, lokand vp on heȝe.
Lord, answere for me, y suffred [strengþe]; what shal y saie, oþer what shal answere to me, whanne ich my seluen haue don?suffre+strengþe.
Y shal þenchen alle myn ȝeres in bitternes of my soule.

Lord, ȝif man liueþ in þis maner, and þe lif of my gost ys in swichc is added over the line. þynges, þou shalt reproue me and quike me; se my bitterestThe latter e is corrected from u. bitternes is in pees.MS. pres.make me qwyk (followed by me, which is dotted out): lo: pees.
Þou for-soþe defended my soule, þat it ne shuld nouȝt perissen; & þou cast by-hynde þy rigge alle myn synȝes.F. s. þou: —ne.
For helle ne shal nouȝt shriue toMS. to to. þe; ne þe deþ ne shal nouȝt herien þe; hij þat fallen into pyne, ne shul nouȝt abide þy soþnes.—ne: ne þ. d. ne] no deþ: payne: —ne.
Þe liueand shal shryue to þe leuiand as ich to-daie; þe fader shal make knowen þy soþenes to his childer.—Þe: lyfyng+he: lyfyng.
Lord, make me sauf; & we shul synge our psalmis al þe daies of our liif in þe hous of our Lord.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS ANNE, In uanitate filij sui Samuelis. (I. Samuelis ii. 1-10.)
DIV2.P: Myn hert gladeþ in our Lord, and myn helpe his anheȝed in my God.gladid.
My mouþe ys made large vp myn enemys, for þy þat y ioied in þyn helþe.—þy þat.
Þer nys non holy as our Lord is; and þer nis non oþer wyþ-outen þe, & þer nis non so stronge as tou our God.is none+so: Lord—is: is: is.
Ne wil ȝe nouȝt manifold speken heȝe þynges, ioiand;—Ne: multyplye+to.
De-partHere or is dotted out in MS. olde þinges out of ȝour mouþes; for God ys Lord of cuninges, & þoutes ben diȝt to hym.
Þe assaut of stronge ys ouercumen, and þe syke ben gird wyþ force.
Þe fulfild to-fore sett hem for loues, and þe hungry ben fild; with loues sett hem: wer.
Þer-whyles þat þe barain childed many, and she þat hade mani childer, is made sike.—þat: childed] broȝt forþ: ch.] sonnes.
Our Lord doþ to deþ, & quikeþ, and ladeþ to helle, & ladeþ oȝayn.d. t. d.] sleþ.
Our Lord makeþ man pouer, and makeþ hym riche, & loweþ & arereþ hym,—makeþ hym.
Heȝand þe nedeful out of poudre, & drescand vp þe pouer out of dung,Araysyng.
Þat he sitt wyþ princes, and holde þe sege of glorie;sete of ioie.
For þe sules of erþe ben our Lordes, & he sett þe world vp hem.s.] oules.
He shal kepe þe fete of his holy, and þe wicked shul fallen in derkenes; for man shal be strengþed in his strengþe.holy+men: strengþed] stronge.
Þe enemis shul dreden our Lord, and he shal desparplis vengeaunce vp hem in heuen.desp.] sprenge.
Our Lord shal iugen þe cuntres of erþe; he shal ȝeue comaundement [to hys kyng, & shal anheȝe þe helpe] of his preste anoynt wyþ creme.deme: of+þe: com.+to his kyng & he schal anhie þe helpe: anoyte.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS MOYSES ET FILIORUM ISRAĒL, In exitu de Egipto transeundo Mare Rubrum. (Exod. xv. 1-19.)
DIV2.P: Synge we to our Lord, for he is gloriouslicheSecond o corrected from e. heried; Pharaon he adrenct in þe see, and hys Eyipciens.Pharaon . . .] he cast & drenkyd Pharaon & Egipcians in þe se.
Our Lord ys my strengþe and my praiseinge; & he is made to me in-to helþe.
He ys my God, and y shal glorifien hym; he his God of my fader, & y shal anheȝe hym.

Our Lord is as man fiȝter, his name is al-myȝtful;MS. as myȝtful. he drunkened in þe ReedThe second e added over line. See Pharaons cartes and hys hoste;man] a man: as myȝtf.] all|miȝty: drenkyd: —reed: oste.
His chosen princes ben adreintMS. be nadreint. in þe Reed See; þe depenes [couered hem, hij fellen into depenes] as stone.beþ adrenkyd: depenes+couerd hem þai fell into depenes: as+a.
Lord, þy miȝt is [heried] in þy strengþe; Lord, þi myȝt smote þyn enemy, and in þe multitude of þi glorie hadestow min aduersaries;is+heried: —þy: þou hadd.
Þou sent þi wraþe, þat deuoured hem as stuble; waters ben gadered in þe gost of þy vengeaunce;
Þe ernand water stode, þe abimes ben gadered to-gidres a-middes þe see. . . . abimes] þe water stode flow|yng þe depe waters.
Þe enemy Pharaon seid: Y shal pursuen & take & departspolies follows, but it is expuncted. spoiles of þe .xij. kynredens of Iacob; my wille shal be fulfild.kynredes.
Y shal drawe out my swerde; myn honde shal slenshen, MS. hem.sle hym (!).
Ha God, þi gost bleu, & þe see couered hem; & þe childer of abyme ben adreint as lede in grete waters.O: adrenchyd.
Ha Lord, who is liche to þe in stronge þynge, who is liche to þe? þou art worþshipful in holines; þou art dredeful, and to praysen, & doand wondres.O: þynges: worschypful.
Þou sprad out þin honde, and þe erthe swolwed hem;
Þou was lader in þy mercy to þe folk, which þou raunsounned.wh.] þat.
And þou bar hym in þy strengþe to þy holy wonyng.
Þe folk steȝe vp, and ben wraþed; sorowes hadden þe woniers of Philistyn.wroþe: wonners.
Þe princes of Edon were þan trubled; quakyng had þe stronge of Moab; alle þe woniand in Chanaan dreden. sturbled: wonnyng: drede.
Falle vp hem doute and drede in þe gret-nes of þy myȝt.
Ben hij made faste as þe stone, þer-whiles þat þy folk passe; þi folk, Lord, þe which þou had in welde.þe w.] þat.
Þou shalt laden hem in, Lord, and sett hem in þe monteyne of þyn heritage, þy fastest woning, þe which þou wroȝt.Lord before þou: þy . . . which] in þe moste faste w. þat.
Lord, in þy holy stedeFirst e corrected from o. þou art, þe which þin hondes fastened; our Lord shal regnen wyþ-outen ende & euer.þe w.] þat: f.] made: euer] ouer.
Þe kniȝt Pharao is entred in-to þe see wyþ his cartes and kniȝtes, and God brouȝt on hem þe waters of þe see.kniȝtes] with his kn.
Þe childer of Israel for-soþe ȝede in dryhede a-middes hym.Forsoþe before þe: drynes. Habakuk, 1. Lorde y herd.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS ABAKUK, De passione et resurrecione Christi. (Habakuk iii. 2-19.)
DIV2.P: Ich herd, Lord, þyn hereing, & y dradde.
We ben, Lord, þy werk; quik þis in-middes of our ȝeres.Lorde we beþ: in-myd of.
Þou shal make knowen amiddes our ȝeres: as tovFollowed first by hastov. hast ben wroþ, þou shal by-þenche mercy.kn.] þing know: —hastov.
God shal cum fram þe norþe, & þe holi fram þe mounteAfter mounte a letter is erased. Pharaon.This verse is repeated in MS. with exactly the same spelling.souȝþe.
Hys glorie couered þe heuens, and þe erþe is ful of his hereing.ioie: herying.
His shinyng shal be as liȝt; þe helpes shul ben in his hondes.in—his.
Þer his hys strengþe hid; þe ded shal go to-fore his face.deþ.
Þe fend shal go to-fore his fete; he stode, and mesured þerþe.
He loked, & vnbond þe folkes; and þe mounteyns of þe world ben defouled.folke.
Þe helles of þe world benFollowed by a b, which is expuncted. croked, fram þe waies of his euer|lastend-hede.hilles: euerlastynghode.
Y seȝe þe tentours of Echiop for her wickednes, & þe skynnes of þe londe of Madian shul ben trubled.Ethyope fo (!): sturbled.
Ne artou enired, Lord, in flodes? oþer þy uengeaunce is in flodes? oþer þin indignacioun in þe see?Lorde artow noȝt wraþed.
Who shal lepen vp þin hors, and þy chares ben sauacioun.saluacion.
Þou heiȝand shal heiȝen þy bowe for þe sweringes, þat þou spak to kindes.anhying schalt arere.
Þou shalt kerue þe flodes of þerþe; þe folk of þe mounteines seiȝen it, & sorweden; & swolȝe of waters passed.seȝ: & swolȝe] þe swoloȝ.
Depnes ȝaf his voice, þe heȝenes lifted vp his hondes.He ȝaf his v. to depe waters: lift.
Þe sunne and þe mone stode in his wonyng, in þe liȝt of þin arwen; hij shul gon liȝtande in þe liȝt of þin launce.
Þou shal defoulen þe erþe in gnasting, and þou shalt maken þe folk afferd in wreche.grentyng—and.
Þou art gon out in-to þe helþe of þy folk, to þe helþe wyþ þy prest anoint wyþ creme.anoyte.
Þou smot þe heued of þe wicked in þe hous; þou madest naked his foundement vnto his nek.his n.] þe neke.
Þou forwardest his septres, þe heuedes of his fiȝters, to þe cumand as whirle-wynde to disparplen me.cursyd.
Her ioie is as of hym þat deuoreþ þe pouer in hidels.priuyte.
Þou madest me waie in þe see to þyn horses in sharpnesses of many waters.made—me: horse: scharpnes.
Ich herd, and my wombe is trubled; my lippes trembleden for þy voice. sturbled: þy] þe.
Rotennes entred in my bones and spring vnder me;entre.
Þat y rest in þe daie of tribulacioun, þat ich wende vp to ourlord follows, but is expuncted. folk girt wyþ godenes.gyrd.
For þe figer ne shal nouȝt floris, and burioun ne shal nouȝt be in uines.figtre—ne: burgon: —ne.
Þe werk of þe olyue shal liȝe, & þe feldes ne shul nauȝt bringe mete.—ne.
Þe beste shal be shorne fram þe fold, and no bestaile ne shal be in cracches.—ne.
And y shal ioien in our Lord, & y shal gladen in Iesum, mi God.
God, our Lord, ys my strengþe; and he shal sett my fete as of hertes.
And þe ouercummerMS. ouercunner. shal lade me vp myn heȝtes, singand in psalmes.ouercumer.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS MOYSI, Quem scripsit quando tradidit legem et assignauit Iosue filium suum populoMS. populi. Israel. (Deuteron. xxxii. 1-43.)
DIV2.P: Ha ȝe heuens, hereþ þe þynges þatMS. &. y shal speken; MS. repeats speken.here þerþe þe wordes of my mouþe.O: &] þat.
Wex mythe follows, but is dotted out. teching as rain, melt my worde as dew,
As reine vp gras, and dropes vp cornes, for þat ich shal klepe þe name of our Lord.rayne: — þat.
Ȝeueþ hereing to our Lord; þe werkes of God ben parfiȝt, and alle his waies ben iugementȝ.herying: L.] Godd: domes.
God is trewe and wyþ-outen ani wickednes; þe riȝtful & þe riȝt synned to hym, and hys childer ne ben nouȝt in filþes.—ne.
Ha wicked kinde and iuel, ha þou foled folk and nouȝt wys, þou ȝeldes þes þynges to our Lord?foly.
Nis nouȝt he þy fader, þat had þe in welde, and fourmed þe and made þe?Is.
By-þenche þe of old daies, þinche þou ich kinde bi it self.þinche] þench.
Aske þy fader, and he shal telle þe, and þi gretter, & hij shul saien to þe.
Whan þe heȝest departed folkes, whan he departed þe sones of Adam,
He sett termes of folkes efter þe noumbre of þe childer of Israel.
Þe partye of our Lord forsoþe is his folk; Iacob is þe corde of his eritage.F. s. þe party of o. L.
He fonde hym in londe forsaken, in hidous stede, and of waste on-hede.forsaken . . . stede] desert in stede of drede: onh.] wyldernes.
He ladde hym a-boute, and tauȝt hym, & kep hym as þe appel of his eȝen.kept: eȝe.
As þe egle clepand hir briddes to fleȝe, and fleȝand a-bouen hem,
He sprad out his wenges, and toke hem, and bare hem vp his shuldres.
Our Lord alle one was hys lader, and oþer god nas nouȝt wyþ hym.was.
He stablist hym vp an heȝe londe, þat he shuld ete þe fruite of þe feldes;sett: an] on: frutes.
Þat he shul souke þe huny of þe stone and oile of þe ardesth is added before a by a different hand. roche,schuld.
Butter of þe bestes & melk of þe ȝowes, wyþ þe fattnes of lombes & weþers, of þe childer of Basan;ȝ.] schepe: & of þe weþeres.
And kiddes wyþ þe merȝþe of wete,MS. swete. þat hij drunken alder-bitterest licor of þe grape.And] þe: merȝe of whete: most bitterest.
Þe loued ys fatted, & he fatted & gresed & en-larged, refused God.enl.] larged.
He for-soke God, hys maker, & departed fram GodMS. repeats hys maker . . . god. his helþe.
Hij cleped hym forþe in straunge goddes, and stired hym to wraþ in abhominacioun.abhominacions.
Hi sacrified to deuelshippes, & nouȝt to God, to goddes which hij ne knew nouȝt. deuels: wh.] þat: —ne.
Newe and fresshe goddes commen, þe which her fadres ne honured nouȝt.come: —ne.
Ha þou fol[k] of Israel, þou for-soke God, þat saued þe, & þou for-ȝate my God, þi fourmeour.O þou folk.
Our Lord seȝe þes þinges, & he is stired to wraþe; for his sones and his douȝters cleped him in maumettries.
And he seied, Y shal hide my face fram hem, and y shal sen her last endinges.
Her kinde is wicked, and her childer vntrewe.
Hij clepeden me forþe in hym, þat [nas] nouȝt God, and tariden in her uanites.þat+was.
And y shal clepen hem forþ in hym, þat nis nouȝt folk, & y shal tarien hem in foled folk.is: —& y shal tarien h. in f. f.
Fur is aliȝt in my vengeaunce, & it shal brenne vnto þe last endes of helle.
And it shal swolwe þerþe wyþ his burron and brennen wiþ his foundementȝ of þe mounteines.Last e added over line.swalow: burgunnyng (radded over line).
Y shal ansemble iuels vp hem, & y shal fulfillen my manaces in hem.gader.
Hij shul ben wasted þurȝ hunger, & foules shal deuore hym wyþ bitterest biting.þurȝ] for.
Y shal sende into hem teþ of bestes and of serpentes drawand wyþ wodeship vp þerþe.wodenes.
Swerde shal waste hem wyþ-outeMS. wyþ outen, but n is expunged. & drede wyþ-innen,
Þe ȝong to-gidres and þe maiden, þe soukand wyþ þe olde man.mayde.
Y seid, For where ben hij? y shal make her mynde to cesenMS. ceser. of men.ben hij] þai be: cese.
Ac ich for-bare for þe ire of her enemis, þat her enemis perchaunce ne prouded nouȝt,Bot: —ne.
And hij seiden, Our Lord miȝt is heȝe, & alle þes þynges ne made noȝt our Lord.Lorde: —ne.
Þys ys folk wy[þ]-outen conseil and wyþ-outen queintise; God, ȝif, þat hij were wys & vnderstonden, & puruaiden þe laste þinges.with-oute consele: wysdome: ȝif] wold: vnderstondyng.
Hou pursued on þousand, & .ij. chaceden .x. þousand?
Nouȝt for þy þat her God solde hem, & her Lord sett hem to-gidres?—þy: sett] closed.
For our God nis nouȝt as her goddes, and our enemis ben iuges.is.
Her uines is of þe uine of Sode-mens & of þe suburbes of Gomorre.is] beþ: Sodomens: subbarbes.
Her grape is grape of galle, & her berye hys bitterest.
Þe galle of dragons is her wyne, and venim of aspides, þat ne mai nouȝt be heled.venum: —ne
Ben nouȝt þes þynges hidded to me, & merked in my tresories?hid: tresourres.
Þe wreche is myne, and y shal ȝelde to hem in time, þat her foteMS. fore. slide.fote aslyde.
Þe daie of lesinge is nere, & þe times hasten to me.neȝ: me] cum.
Our Lord shal iugent his folk, & haue pite of his seruauntes.deme.
He shal sen,MS. ben. þat þe honde is made sike, & þe bishett faileden, & þe remauntȝ ben wasted.ben] se: bishett] closed: remnaunte beþ.
And þe gode shal sain, Where ben her goddes, in which hij had affiaunce?—gode.
Of whas sacrificesMS. sacrifiees. hij eten þe fatthede, & drunken wyn of sacrifices,sacrifice: fatnes: sacrifice.
Arise hij, & helpe ȝou, & defende ȝou in nede.
Seþ þat ich am al-on,MS. as on. and þat þer be no noþer God bot y.allon: be no no.] is none oþer.
Y shal slen, and make to liuen; y shal smiten, & y shal helen; and þer nis non þat may deliuer fram my honde. —to: helen] make hole: is.
Y shal lift my honde to þe heuen, & saie, Y liue wyþ-outen ende.to—þe.
Ȝyf ich sharp my swerde oþer my wreche as liȝtinge, & myn hondes han tauken iugement,take.
Y shal ȝelden vengeaunce to myn enemis, [& y shal ȝelden to hem] þat hateden me.enemys+& y schal ȝelde to hem.
Y shal baþeMS. laþe. my manaces in confusion, and my vengeaunce shal swolwe flesshes,l.] baþe: manace: swalow.
Of blode of þe slain & wreched-hede of þe naked heued of þe enemis.slaw: wrechidhode.
Ȝe folk wyþ-outen lawe, herieþh on erasure. his folk; for he shal venge þe blode of his seruauntes.ȝe f.] þe f.
And he shal ȝelde vengeaunceMS. vengeuance. to her enemis, & he shal be propice to þe londe of his folk.vengance: mercifull.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS ANANIE, AZARIE, ET MISAEL. (Danielis iii. 57-88.)
DIV2.P: Ȝe alle werkes of our Lord, blisceþ our Lord, herieþ & vp-heȝeþ hym in-to þe worldles!
Ȝe our Lordes aungels, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe heuens, blisceþ our Lord!
Ȝe alleMS. repeats alle. waters þat ben vp heuens, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe alle vertuȝ of our Lord, blisceþ our Lord!
Ȝe sonne and mone, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe sterres of heuen, blisceþ our Lord!
Ȝe raine & dew, blisceþ our Lord! ich gost of God, blisceþ our Lord!
Ȝe fur & brueling, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe cold & somer, blisceþ our Lord!br.] hete.
Ȝe dewes & rime-frost, bliseeþ our Lord! ȝe frost & colde, blisceþ our Lord!horefroste.
Ȝe yse & snow,MS. swo. blisceþ our Lord! ȝe miȝtes & daies, blisceþ our Lord!snow.
Þe erthe blisceþ our Lord, and herieþ him, & heȝe him in þe worldel!blys: hery+it: vphie: worldes.
Ȝe mounteins & smale hilles, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe alle þinges burionand in erþe, blisceþ our Lord!all maner of þinges burioun|yng in þe e.

Ȝe whalles & alle þinges þat ben stired in þe waters, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe alle þe foulesMS. folkes. of heuen, blisceþ our Lord!walles: stired . . . folkes] mouyd in þe w. ȝe all byrdes (r added over line).
Ȝe alle bestes, blisceþ our Lord; ȝe mennes sones, blisceþ our Lord!ȝe sonnes of men.
Blisce þe folk of Israel our Lord! herie hym, & heȝe hym in þe world!þe f. of I. blyss: hyȝe—hym: into þe worldes.
Ȝe prestes of our Lord, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe seruauntes of our Lord, blisce our Lord!& ȝe s.
Ȝe gostes & soules of riȝtful, blisceþ our Lord! ȝe holy & meke ofhym follows, but is expuncted. hert, blisceþ our Lord!& ȝe souleȝ of r.+men: & ȝe meke.
Ȝe Anani & Azary & Mysael, blisceþ our Lord! herieþ hym, & heȝeþ hym in þe world!enhiȝe.
Blisce we þe fader and þe sone wyþ þe holy gost! hery we, and heȝe we hym in þe worldel!Blysse—we: with—þe: an|hiȝe: worlde.
Lord, þou art blisced in þe firmament of heuen and ful of heryynge & gloriouse and vp-heȝed in þe worldes!in þi: anhyed.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS ZACHARIE.No heading in MS. (Luke i. 68-79.)
DIV2.P: Blisced be our Lord, God of Israel; for he uisited, and made þe raunson of his folke.our] þe: visett.
And he dresced þe helpe of his helþe to ous in þe hous of Dauid, his childe.arered vp þe helpe of helþe.
And as he spake þurȝ þe mouþe of holy his prophetes, þat ben in þe world.in] of.
Helþe of our enemys & of þe honde of alle þat hated us.
To do merci wyþ our fader, and forto by-þenchen of hys holy testament. faders: of hys] on.
Þe oþe þat he swore to Abraham, our fader, to ȝif hym to us.
Þat we, de-liuerd fram þe honde of our enemis, serue to him, wyþ|outen drede.þat] & þat.
In holynes & riȝtfulnes to-fore hym alle our daies.
And þou, childe, shal be cleped prophete of þe heȝest; for þou shal go to-fore þe face of our Lord to diȝt his waies;ordeyne.
To ȝif coning of helþe to his folke, in forȝeuenes of her synȝes;cunnyng: remyssions.
ÞourȝMS. þe urþe, the latter þ being corrected from ȝ. þe workes of þe mercy of our God, in which he viseted vs born fram heȝt;þe urþe] By: in+þe: viset.
To liȝten to hem þat sitteþ in derkenes & shadue of deþ, & to drescen our fete in-to way of pees.

DIV2.HEAD: TE DEUM.No heading in MS.
DIV2.P: God, we herieþ þe, we knoweleche [þe].knowligge+þe Lorde.
Alle þerþe honureþ þe, fader wyþ-outen ende.All erþe worschepeþ þe, euer|lastyng fader.
To þe crien alle aungels, to þe crien þe heuens and alle miȝtes.to þe cr. þe h] & heuens.
To þe crien cherubin and seraphin, and wiþ voice nouȝt cessand.s.—and: with a incessable voyce.
Holy! holy! holy!
Lord, God, Sabaoth.S.] of ostes.
Þe heuens & þe erþe ben ful of þe maieste of þye glorie.þe heuens & þe e.] h. & erþe: maieste . . gl.] ioie of þi mageste.
Þe glorious felaw-es-hip of apostels herieþ þe.cumpany of postels.
Þe praiseable numbre of prophetes herieþ þe.
Þe whit felaweship of martirs herieþ þe.whyte cumpany.
Þe holi chirch knowelicheþ þe þurȝ þe world.þe h. ch. kn.] Holy chirches knowlegeþ.
Fader of gret maieste!
And it is to honouren þy soþefast & onelich sone,& þi verrey onlych sonne to be worschypt.
And þe holy gost confortour.
Þou, Christ, art kynge of glorie.ioie.
Þou art þe euer-lastand sone of þy fader.þy] þe.
Þou [forto] take to deliuer man ne drad nouȝt þe wombe of þe virgine.þou+forto: —ne.
Þou opened þe kingdomes of heuens to hem þat bileuen in þe carnacioun, þe broche of þe deþ ouer-cumen.be-leuyd: incarnacioun: br.] pryk.
Þou sittest at þe riȝthalf of God in þe glorie of þe fader.atte r. side.
Þou art leued for to be iuge to comen.be . . .] cum a domes-man.
For-þy bi-seche we þe, Helpe þy seruauntȝ, whichMS. repeats which. þou raunsouned wyþ þy preciouse blode.we beseche þi help: wh. wh.] þat.
Make þyMS. my. seruauntes to be rewarded wyþ glorie euerlastand.my] þi.
Make sauf, Lord, þy folk, & blesce þyn heritage.
And goueren hem, and heȝe hem to wyþ-outen ende.gouerne: anhie: —to.
We blisceþ þe by ich daie.The English is omitted.
And we herie þy name in þe world & in heuen.
Be it þy wille, Lord, þis daie to kepe us wyþouten sinȝe.Lorde be it þy w.
Haue mercy on vs! Lord, haue mercy on vs!Lord haue m. on vs.
Be, Lord, þy merci made vp vs, as we hoped in þe!Lord be: trowed.
Lord, ich hoped in þe; ne be y nouȝt confounded wyþ-outen ende.haue hopid: —ne.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS MARIE.No heading in MS. Luke i. 47-55.
DIV2.P: My soule herieþ our Lord.hyried.
And my gost gladeþ in God, myn helþe.gladyd.
For he seȝe þe mekenesse of his honde-maiden; se for-þy, of þat shal alle kindes saie me blisceed.honde-mayde lo: all k. schall.
For he þat his miȝtful made to me grete þinges, & his name is holy.
And his mercy is fram kinde in-to kindes to þe dredand hym.into] to.
He made miȝt in hys helpe, he sprad abrode þe proude þurȝ þe þouȝt of his hert. spr. ab. þe] disparpled: þurȝ þe] in: his] her.
He did doun þe miȝt-ful of her setes, & anheȝed þe meke.put: —þe: miȝty: setes] sett.
He fulfild þe hungry of godes, & left þe ryche empty.empty] in vayne.
He toke Israel, his childe, & he by-þouȝt of hys merci,
As he spak to our fadres, Abraham & to his sede in þe worldes.

DIV2.HEAD: PSALMUS SIMEONIS.No heading in MS. (Luke ii. 29-32.)
DIV2.P: Nou late stonde, Lord, þy seruant in pees efter þy worde.Lord now þou letest —stonde.
For myn eȝen seȝen þyn helþe,haþ sey.
Þe which þou diȝted to-fore þe face of alle folkes,þat þou hast ordeynyd: folke.
Lit to sheweinge of men, & glorie of þy folk of Israel.Liȝt.

DIV2.HEAD: ATHANASIAN CREED.No heading in MS.
DIV2.P: Who so wyl be sauf, nede it is to hym to-fore alle þinges, þat he holde þe catholich faiþe;catholy.
Þe which bot ȝif ichon kepe hole & nouȝt de-fouled, wyþ-outen drede he shal peris wyþ-outen ende.n.d.] vndefoylid: doute.
Þe faiþe for-soþe of holy chirche is þis, þat we honuren o God in trinite & þe trinite in on-hede,o] one: onhode.
Noiþer confoundand persons, ne departand þe substaunce.ne] no.
On for-soþe is persoun of þe fader, anoþer of þe sone, anoþer of þe holy gost.
Bot of þe fader and of þe sone & of þe holy gost is o god-hede, euen glorie & maieste to-gidres euer-lastand.of þe sone & of] þe sonne &: on goddhode.
Swich as þe fader is, swich is þe sone, swich is þe holi gost.
Vnfourmed is þe fader, vnfourmed is þe sone, vnformed is þe holi gost.
Mychel his þe fader, mychel his þe sone, michel his þe holy gost.Grete: grete: grete.
Þe fader hys euer-lastend, þe sone is euerlastend, þe holy gost is euerlastend.Euerlastyng is þe f., euer|lastyng is þe sun, e.l. is þe h. goste.
And neuer þe lesse þer ne be nouȝt þre euerlastend, ac þer is on euerlastend.neþþeles: —ne: bot one euer|lastyng.
As hij ne ben nouȝt þre vnfourmed, ne þre grete, ac on vnfourmed, & on grete:hij ne] þer: no: bot.
Also his þe fader almiȝti, þe sone almiȝti, þe holi gost almiȝti.Also almiȝty is þe f., almiȝty is þe sun, alm. is þe h. goste.
And neuer þe les þer ne ben non þre almiȝti, bot on is almiȝti.ne ben non] be noȝt: —is.
So is God fader, GodTwice god in MS. is sone, God ys þe holy gost.So Godd is f., Godd is sun, Godd is h. goste.
And na-for-þan þer ne ben nouȝt þre goddes, bot þer is o God,na . . . ne] neuer þe les þer: þer is o] one.
So is þe fader Lord, þe sone Lord, þe holy gost Lord.
And na-for-þan þer ne ben nouȝt þre lordes, ac on is Lord.And . . . ne] Ac neþeles þer: ac on is] bot one.

For as we ben constreint þurȝ cristen soþenes to knowelich on-lich God and Lord ich a persone, so we be defended þurh catholik religion to sai, þre goddes & þre lordes.constreynyd: knowlege: ich a] ech.
Þe fader nis made of no wiȝt, ne fourmed, ne biȝeten.is: no þing no: no.
Þe sone is oneliche of þe fader, nouȝt made, noȝt formed, ac biȝeten.of þe onlych f.: bot.
Þe holy gost is of þe fader and of þe sone, nouȝt made, nouȝt fourmed, noȝt biȝeten, bot forþgoand.nouȝt fourmed] no f.: —n. biȝ.
For-þi o fader is, & nouȝt þre fadresInstead of the e, the MS. has a loop to the r.; o sone, and nouȝt þre sones; on holy gost, & nouȝt þre holy gost.one: one: one: gostes.
Bot in þis trinite noȝt is to-fore, ne nouȝt by-hinde, nouȝt more ne lasse, ac alle þre persons ben to-gadres euerlastand & euen.ne nouȝt] no noȝt: nouȝt m. ne l.] no lesse bot: togyders.
So þat by alle þinges, as it is sone said aboue, & on-hede in þre-hede & þre-hede in on-hede be to honour. sone] now: & o.] as onehode: þrehode: þrehode: onehode is to be honouryd.
For-þy he þat wil be saued, fele he so of þe þrehede.s.f.] safe frede: trinite.
Bot nedeful þinge is to þe euerlastand helþe, þat he trowe-lich bi-leue þe in-carnacioun of our Lord Iesu Crist.trewlych.
For-þy þe riȝt bileue is þat we bi-leue & knowelich, þat our Lord Iesu Crist, Goddes sone, is God & man.riȝtful: knowlege.
He his God, of þe substaunce of þe fader biȝeten to-fore þe worldes; & man, of þe substaunce of þe moder born in þe world.
He is parfit God, parfit man, beand of resonable soule & of mannes flesshe.
He is euen to þe fader efter þe godehede, lasse þan þe fader efter þe manhede;goddehede + &: manhode.
Þe which, þeȝ he bi God & man, na-for-þan hij ben nouȝt two, bot o Crist.bi] be: neþe les.
He is for-soþe on, noȝt þurȝt [confusioun of god-hede in flesh, bot þurȝ] takeing of manhode in-to God.noȝt one þurȝgh + confusion of godd-hode in flesch bot þurȝgh.
He is on in alle, nouȝt þurȝ confusion of substaunce, bot þurȝ onhede of persone.ac: onhode.
For as resonable soule & flesshe is o man, so is God & man o Crist;one: one.
Þe which suffred for our helþe, went to helle, & aros þe þridde daie fram deþ to lyf.

He steȝe vp tohe follows here, but is expuncted. þe heuens, sitteþ at þe riȝt half of God, fader al-miȝti, fram þennes he is to cum to iugen þe quike and þe ded.þe heuens] h.: sittyþ (but instead of the þ the MS. has only a long down|ward flourish): r. side: deme: & —þe.
Tho whos cumyng al men han to rise wyþ her bodis, & ben to ȝelden rekening of her propre dedes.Tho] To: —ben.
And hij þat deden wele, shul gon to þe lif euerlastand; & hij þat han don iuel, shul gon into fur euer-lastend.
Þis ys þe bileue catholik, þe which bot if ich man haue bileued trewlich & fastelich, he ne may nouȝt be sauf.cath.] of holy chyrche: —ne.
DIV2.TRAILER: Explicit psalterium translatum in anglicum John Hyde constat.

BODY.TRAILER:
END OF THE TEXT
AND OF PART I.
